Adhola: Jochoki misolo bende jokitim ameno?
English: Do not even the tax collectors do the same?

Adhola: To ka wimothere wiwegi gi wegi, meno witimoye aŋo mopokere kodi gima ji man jotimo?
English: And if you greet only your brothers, what more are you doing than others?

Adhola: Jopath bende jokitim ameno?
English: Do not even the Gentiles do the same?

Adhola: 48 Bedi win maleŋ paka Baa win mani polo leŋ.
English: You therefore must be perfect, as your heavenly Father is perfect.

Adhola: Fuonji kwoŋ konyirok
English: Teaching on charity

Adhola: Gwokere win wikiri winyuthi tim mewin mabeyo i waŋi ji ni aka ji jowoneni to jofuoyo win. Ka witimo ameno i dyer ji wikolim kemba bongi Baa win mani polo.
English: Beware of practicing your charitable deeds before other people in order to be seen by them, for then you will have no reward from your Father who is in heaven.

Adhola: Amomiyo ka wimiyo jachandi gimoro, wikiri wiasa nyutho kamaler, paka joma rendere jotimo i kalamo pa Joyudaya kodi i royo mokare i tindi. Jotimo ameno nike ji jowopaki jo.
English: Thus, when you give to the needy, sound no trumpet before you, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may be praised by others.

Adhola: Adyeri awacho ri win, otyek miyo jo kemba pajo mopoŋ.
English: Truly, I say to you, they have received their reward.

Adhola: To ka ichwayo ri jachandi gimoro, konyi go ma kada mere perin ma kachunyin koŋeyo, ŋey wobedi gima nyaliŋliŋ.
English: But when you give to the needy, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing, so that your giving may be in secret.

Adhola: Aka Benin ma neno gima itimo nyaliŋliŋ, ama bino miyin kemba.
English: And your Father who sees in secret will reward you.

Adhola: Fuonji kwoŋ kwayo
English: Teaching on prayer

Adhola: Ka ikwayo, ikiri ichale kodi joma jorendere!
English: And when you pray, you must not be like the hypocrites.

Adhola: Jomaro chungo ka jokwayo i kalamo pa Joyudaya kodi i thengi royo mokare ma tindi ŋey dhano jye wonen jo.
English: For they love to stand and pray in the synagogues and at the street corners, that they may be seen by others.

Adhola: Adyeri awacho ri win, ameno jotyeko limo kemba pajo kichutho.
English: Truly, I say to you, they have received their reward.

Adhola: To ka ikwayo, donji i ot perin ichiegi thigo, aka ikway Benin, ma kinenere kamaler.
English: But when you pray, go into your room and shut the door and pray to your Father who is in secret.

Adhola: Aka Benin, ma neno gima itimo nyaliŋliŋ bino miyin kemba.
English: And your Father who sees in secret will reward you.

Adhola: I kwayo perin, ikiri ior wach kweth mongoye kony paka jokafiri jotimo; ato joparo ni Were bino winjo jo ru kwayo pajo maboyo.
English: And when you pray, do not heap up empty phrases as the Gentiles do, for they think that they will be heard for their many words.

Adhola: Amomiyo wikiri wichale gi jo; kole Baa win mani polo oŋeyo gima wichando kada ma fuodi wikikwayo go.
English: Do not be like them, for your Father knows what you need before you ask him.

Adhola: Me apaka wiripo kwayo,"Bawan mani polo, nyingin wolwor"
English: Pray then like this: “Our Father in heaven, hallowed be your name.

Adhola: Ker perin wobin, gima iyenyo wotimere i piny paka timere i polo.
English: Your kingdom come, your will be done, on earth as it is in heaven.

Adhola: Miyi waye konon chiemo mawan ma noknok;
English: Give us this day our daily bread

Adhola: Chwaki ri wan gimarecho mawan; Paka wachwako ri joma timo ri wan marach.
English: And forgive us our debts, as we also have forgiven our debtors.

Adhola: Ikiri iter wan ka ratem, to bothi wan ayino kwoŋ Ŋatarach,
English: And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil.

Adhola: Rupiri ker obedo aperin, kodi men, kodi dwoŋ, chil gi chil.
English: For Yours is the kingdom and the power and the glory forever.

Adhola: Ameno.
English: Amen

Adhola: Kole ka wichwako ri ji recho ma jotimo ri win, Baa win mani polo bende bino chwako win.
English: For if you forgive others their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.

Adhola: To ka wikichwaki recho pa joman, ameno Baa win mani polo bende kibino chwako ri win recho ma wityeko timo.
English: But if you do not forgive others their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.

Adhola: Fuonji kwoŋ riyo kech
English: Teaching on fasting

Adhola: Aka ka wiriyo kech, wikiri winenere pa wigut paka joma rendere.
English: And when you fast, do not look gloomy like the hypocrites,

Adhola: Ato jonyieko waŋ gin ŋey ji jye jowoŋey nike joriyo kech.
English: For they disfigure their faces that their fasting may be seen by others.

Adhola: Adyeri awacho ri win, ameno jotyeko limo kemba pajo mopoŋ.
English: Truly, I say to you, they have received their reward.

Adhola: To ka iriyo kech, lwoki waŋin kendo iyiki wiyin, aka joman jokiri jowoneni nike iriyo kech; Benin kende ma kinenere kamaler ama bino ŋeyo.
English: But when you fast, anoint your head and wash your face, that your fasting may not be seen by others but by your Father who is in secret.

Adhola: Aka Benin, ma neno gima itimo nyaliŋliŋ, ama bino miyin kemba.
English: And your Father who sees in secret will reward you.

Adhola: Kano ŋaŋo i polo
English: Storing wealth in heaven

Adhola: Wikiri wikan ŋaŋo mewin i piny ka, kama masirigi kodi nyal jobino nyiek'iye, aka jokwo jobino donj'iye to jokwalo woko.
English: Do not lay up for yourselves treasures on earth, where moth and rust destroy and where thieves break in and steal.

Adhola: To kuchiel, kani win ŋaŋo mewin i polo, kama masirigi kodi nyal jokibino nyiek'iye, aka jokwo jokibino donj'iye kwalo.
English: But lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust destroys and where thieves do not break in and steal.

Adhola: Kole kama di ŋaŋo perin ama chunyin bed'iye ndir jye.
English: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.

Adhola: Lero ma delkwoŋ dhano
English: The light of the human body

Adhola: Waŋ meno tala ma del.
English: The eye is the lamp of the body.

Adhola: Ka waŋin olama, delkwoŋin gipi lero bino poŋ'iye; to ka waŋin kolama, delkwoŋin bino bedo i mudho.
English: So, if your eye is healthy, your whole body will be full of light, but if your eye is bad, your whole body will be full of darkness.

Adhola: Amomiyo ka lero ma kwoŋin olokere mudho, mudho bino asere marom nedi?
English: If then the light in you is darkness, how great is the darkness!

Adhola: Were kodi lim
Ongoye ŋata nyalo tiyo ri ruodhe aryo; go bino maro achiel to dak man, kosa nyalo tiyo ri achiel to chayo man.
English: No one can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other.

Adhola: Ikinyal tiyo ri Were kodi ri lim bende.
English: You cannot serve God and money.

Adhola: Amomiyo awacho ri win gime: wikiri wirembi kwoŋ girachama kodi giramadha ma wiyenyo ma kwo, kosa ruk ri delkwoŋ win.
English: Therefore I tell you, do not be anxious about your life, what you will eat or what you will drink, nor about your body, what you will put on.

Adhola: Adyer kwo pa dhano kiloy chiemo, odoko delkwoŋe kiloy ruk?
English: Is not life more than food, and the body more than clothing?

Adhola: Neni win winyin ma joucho malo, jokipidhi kodhi, jokichoki chiemo jokethi i dere, to kole Baa win mani polo kuro jo!
English: Look at the birds of the air: they neither sow nor reap nor gather into barns, and yet your heavenly Father feeds them.

Adhola: To kere win wikiloy winyin no bori?
English: Are you not of more value than they?

Adhola: Ŋa kwoŋ win ma nyalo medo kiyindira i kwo pere ru rembo ri gikipiny no?
English: And which of you by being anxious can add a single hour to his span of life?And why are you anxious about clothing?

Adhola: To raŋo ma wirembo ri ruk?
English: And why are you anxious about clothing?

Adhola: Neni win thiwi dudi paka jodongo; jokichwer kwok i tich odoko wegi jokitim ruk pajo.
English: Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow: they neither toil nor spin,

Adhola: To awacho ri win kada Solomon, ma chango oŋaŋ moasere, kobedo gi ruk mabeyo paka nyaka achiel kwoŋ thiwi dudi me.
English: yet I tell you, even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these

Adhola: To k'inen meno apaka Were ruko lum, ma konon nitye to yawere mere thwo tiwaŋo i kendo, go koruki win maloyo kenyo, a ji ma yeyo pajo nok me!
English: But if God so clothes the grass of the field, which today is alive and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, will he not much more clothe you, O you of little faith?

Adhola: Amomiyo wikiri wichaki rembo, ka wiwacho ni, ‘Wanocham aŋo?’ kosa ni ‘Wanomadhi aŋo?’ kosa ni ‘Wanoruki aŋo?’
English: Therefore do not be anxious, saying, ‘What shall we eat?’or ‘What shall we drink?’or ‘What shall we wear?’

Adhola: Kole me a gikipiny ma jokafiri joyenyo hongo jye; aka Baa win mani polo oŋeyo nike wiyenyo gigo jye.
English: For the Gentiles seek after all these things, and your heavenly Father knows that you need them all.

Adhola: To kutho rangi win Ker pa Were kodi tiro ma go yenyo, aka go bino miyo win gikipiny me jye.
English: But seek first the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things will be added to you.

Adhola: Amomiyo wikiri wirembi ri gima dikin; kole kis ndelo won yawere gi wach mere.
English: Therefore do not be anxious about tomorrow, for tomorrow will be anxious for itself.

Adhola: Kiyenyere medo teko man wi teko ma piny moyawere kelo.
English: Sufficient for the day is its own trouble.

Adhola: Thumo banja ri jowoti jo
English: Judging others

Adhola: Wikiri withum banja ri jowoti win, aka bende Were kothum ri win banja.
English: Judge not, that you be not judged.

Adhola: Kwoŋbedo ibino thumo ri win banja i yo achiel ma withumo gine banja ri jowoti win, aka ibino tiyo kwoŋ win gi chik ma witiyo gine kwoŋ jowoti win.
English: For with the judgment you pronounce you will be judged, and with the measure you use it will be measured to you.

Adhola: Amomiyo, raŋo m'iŋiyo nyaka yath mondhilo mani manitye i waŋ omerin, t'ikidew kwoŋ thwon kasik manitye i waŋin won?
English: For with the judgment you pronounce you will be judged, and with the measure you use it will be measured to you.

Adhola: Iere nedi wacho ri omerin ni, ‘Mondo, weyi akwany woko nyaka yath mondhilo no i waŋin,’ mato iwon bende initye gi thwon kasik i waŋin?
English: For with the judgment you pronounce you will be judged, and with the measure you use it will be measured to you.

Adhola: In, jarendirok!
English: You hypocrite!

Adhola: Kutho kwanyi woko thwon kongolo kasik i waŋin, aka nyaka ibino neno maber ŋey inokwany woko yath mondhilo i waŋ omerin.
English: First take the log out of your own eye, and then you will see clearly to take the speck out of your brother’s eye.

Adhola: Ikiri imiy gwokere gikipiny maleŋ, jobino wire rin to jokayin ayino; kendo ikiri ibol gee mawelo ri mbiji, jobino nyono anyona ayino
English: Do not give dogs what is holy, and do not throw your pearls before pigs, lest they trample them underfoot and turn to attack you.

Adhola: Kwayi, rangi, gudi thigo
English: Ask, seek and knock

Adhola: Kwayi, aka inolim; rangi, aka inonwaŋ; gudi thigo aka ibino yawo rin.
English: Ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you.

Adhola: Kole dhano jye ma kwayo, limo; aka ŋata rango, nwaŋo, aka ŋata gudo thigo, iyawo ri go.
English: For everyone who asks receives, and the one who seeks finds, and to the one who knocks it will be opened.

Adhola: Ŋa kwoŋ win bachere ji ka ma di miy wuode tele, ka okwayo mugat?
English: Or which one of you, if his son asks him for bread, will give him a stone?

Adhola: Kosa di miy go thwol, ka okwayo rech?
English: Or if he asks for a fish, will give him a serpent?

Adhola: Kole kada wirecho ameno, wiŋeyo miyo nyithindho mewin gikipiny mabeyo.
English: Even youwho are evil, know how to give good gifts to your children.

Adhola: Aka Baa win mani polo oloy win didi i miyo joma kwayo go, gikipiny mabeyo!
English: How much more will your Father who is in heaven give good things to those who ask him!

Adhola: Timi win ri jowoti win gima wimito jowotim ri win: me a dwoŋ Chik pa Musa kodi fuonji pa jotuchi wach Were.
English: So whatever you wish that others would do to you, do also to them, for this is the Law and the Prophets

Adhola: Waŋkach madiny kodi malach
English: Narrow and Wide gate

Adhola: Donji gi i waŋkach madiny, rupiri waŋkach malach ni gi royo mayot luwo, to tero jo i reyirok, aka joma thoth joluwo royo no.
English: Enter by the narrow gate, for the gate is wide and the way is easy that leads to destruction, and those who enter by it are many.

Adhola: Waŋkach madiny ni gi royo matek luwo, to tero jo i kwo, aka ji manok ama jonwaŋo royo no.
English: For the gate is narrow and the way is hard that leads to life, and those who find it are few.

Adhola: Yath kodi gimanyak kwoŋe
Gwokere win kwoŋ jotuchi wach matwodo, ma jobino bongi win i chal pa rombo gi woko, to iyadyeri mere jobedo arara i chuny gin.
English: “eware of false prophets, who come to you in sheep’s clothing but inwardly are ravenous wolves.

Adhola: Ri ameno wibino ŋeyo jo kwoŋ gimanyak wok i tim pajo
English: You will recognize them by their fruits.

Adhola: Kudho oryaŋ bende chiene nyak vini?
English: Are grapes gathered from thornbushes?

Adhola: Odoko kudho alwi bende chiene nyak nyandere?
English: Are figs  gathered from thistles?

Adhola: Kole yath maber nyak gimaber, aka yath marach bende nyak gimarach.
English: So, every healthy tree bears good fruit, but the diseased tree bears bad fruit.

Adhola: Yath maber kinyal nyak gimarach, aka yath marach kinyal nyak gimaber.
English: A healthy tree cannot bear bad fruit, nor can a diseased tree bear good fruit.

Adhola: Yath jye ma kinyak gimaber itoŋo woko tibolo i mach.
English: Every tree that does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.

Adhola: Amomiyo wibino ŋeyo jotuchi wach matwodo chungo kwoŋ gimanyak ma nenere i tim pajo
English: Thus you will recognize them by their fruits.

Adhola: Ki dhano jye ma lwoŋan ni, ‘Ruoth, Ruoth,’ ma bino donjo i Ker ma polo, kende ŋata timo gima Baba mani polo yenyo.
English: Not everyone who says to me, ‘Lord, Lord,’will enter the kingdom of heaven, but the one who does the will of my Father who is in heaven.

Adhola: I ndelo no, joma thoth jobino wacho ni, ‘Ruoth, Ruoth, kole watucho mikwenda pa Were i nyingin, waryemo woko jwogi i nyingin aka watimo giraura madongo momore i nyingin!’
English: On that day many will say to me, ‘Lord, Lord, did we not prophesy in your name, and cast out demons in your name, and do many mighty works in your name?’

Adhola: Gikenyo abino wacho ri jo ni, ‘Akuya win, kendo eye win bongan win wijotimi recho me.’
English: And then will I declare to them, ‘I never knew you; depart from me, you workers of lawlessness.’

Adhola: Jogeto aryo
English: the two builders

Adhola: Amomiyo dhano jye ma winjo wach paran me aka tiyo gine bino chale gi dhano maryek mogeto ot pere wi tele.
English: Everyone then who hears these words of mine and does them will be like a wise man who built his house on the rock.

Adhola: Koth ochwe, mikula omol, aka asur okudho ot no matek.
English: And the rain fell, and the floods came, and the winds blew.

Adhola: To ot no kopodho, kwoŋbedo oger wi tele.
English: And the house did not fall, because it had been founded on the rock.

Adhola: To ŋata winjo wach paran me aka kitiy gine, chalo dhano mamiŋ mogero ot pere i kwoyo.
English: And everyone who hears these words of mine and does not do them will be like a foolish man who built his house on the sand.

Adhola: Koth ochwe, mikula omol, asur okudho ot no matek, to podho.
English: And the rain fell, and the floods came, and the winds blew and beat against that house, and it fell

Adhola: Podho no oasere marom kune!”
English: And great was the fall of it.

Adhola: Munyo Yesu ochowo wacho gime, kweth ji jouro swa kite ma go ofuonjo gine.
English: And when Jesus finished these sayings, the crowds were astonished at his teaching,

Adhola: Go onwaŋo kichale kodi jofuonji ma Chik, rupiri go ofuonjo pa ŋata oido ni gi men.
English: for he was teaching them as one who had authority, and not as their scribes.

Adhola: Winji Were
English: Listen to God

Adhola: Were chale gi janywolma maro nyithindho pere.
English: God is like a loving father.

Adhola: Were oro Baibul luwo kodi wan.
English: God speaks to us through the Bible.

Adhola: Baibul wacho ni: ‘Joma jowinjan, Amiyo jo kwo makirum.
English: The Bible says: 'Those who listen to me, I give them everlasting life'

Adhola: Ji jowinjo wach pa Were kis Kamoro
English: People everywhere are listening.

Adhola: Jehova ochweyo gikipiny jye manitye ipolo kodi i piny
English: Jehovah created everything in heaven . . . and on earth.

Adhola: Jehova omiyo Adam kodi Eva gikipiny mabeyo kweth
English: Jehovah gave Adam and Eve many good things.

Adhola: Were ochiero jo chamo kwo  yath achiel.
English: God said not to eat from one of the trees.

Adhola: Adam kodi Eva jokowinjo Were, amomiyo jotho.
English: Adam and Eve did not obey God, so they died.

Adhola: Paka fukefuke ongoye gi kwo, jomotho bende jongoye gi kwo.
English: The dead are as lifeless as the dust.

Adhola: Joma thoth indir pa Nowa jotimo gikipiny marecho.
English: Most in Noah’s time did what was bad.

Adhola: Nowa owinjo Were to geto yee.
English: Noah listened to God and built an ark.

Adhola: Were oreyo woko jomarecho tobotho Nowa kodi jopecho pere.
English: God destroyed the wicked but saved Noah and his family.

Adhola: Odoko Were chiegin reyo woko jomarecho to botho joma beyo.
English: God will again destroy the wicked and save the good people.

Adhola: Jehova ooro Yesu ipiny.
English: Jehovah sent Jesus to earth.

Adhola: Kada nende Yesu otimo gikipiny mabeyo, komar go.
English: Jesus did good but was hated.

Adhola: Yesu othoney wanyal limokwo.
English: Jesus died so that we might live.

Adhola: Were ochierino Yesu to loko go Kere ma Ker pa Were
English: God resurrected Jesus and made him King of God’s Kingdom.

Adhola: Chandirok manitye ipiny nyutho ni Ker pa Were chiegin bino.
English: Troubles on the earth prove that God’s Kingdom will soon act.

Adhola: Ker pa Were bino kwanyo woko gikipiny marecho jye.
English: The Kingdom will remove all wickedness.

Adhola: Jomotho jobino chierino jobedi ipinyka.
English: Most of the dead will be resurrected on earth.

Adhola: Ker pa Were bino kwanyo woko chandirok jye
English: God’s Kingdom will end all suffering.

Adhola: Were winjo kwayo mawan.
English: God does hear our prayers.

Adhola: Wanyalo kwayo kwo gimoro jye
English: We can pray about many things.

Adhola: Mar amakelo kisangala ipecho.
English: Love is the key to happy families.

Adhola: Bedi dhano ma woro ji kendo magenere, ma kiweno dhano mager makigenere
English: Be kind and faithful, not cruel and unfaithful.

Adhola: Ikiri itimi gimarach.
English: Avoid what is bad.

Adhola: Timi gimaber.
English: Do what is good.

Adhola: Bedi yuthenge pa Were.
English: Take your stand on God’s side.

Adhola: Or ryeko munyo iyero giratima—winji Were.
English: Make the right choice​—listen to God.

Adhola: Were amochweyo wan, aka go dewo kwo wan swa
English: God is our Creator, and he cares for us.

Adhola:
Janywol maryek kendo mani gi mar,
fuonjo nyithindho pere.
English: Just as a wise and loving father instructs his children,

Adhola:
Were fuonjo wan adyeri ma kelo ri wan kisangala kendo ma miyo
wan geno.
English: God reveals precious truths that fill us with joy and hope.

Adhola: Ka iwinjo Were, go bino miyin ryeko kendo bino konyin i teko moro jye.
English: If you listen to God, he will guide and protect you and help you deal with problems.

Adhola:
Kareno nitye kir gima loyo meno
—ibino limo kwo makirum!
English: But there is more​—you will live forever!

Adhola:
Ameno apaka Were bende fuonjo ji pere
nger malimo kwo maber.
English: Likewise, God teaches people everywhere the best way to live.

Adhola: Were Luwo Kodi Wan Nedi?
English: How Does God speak to us?

Adhola: Chango chon, Were maradyeri ooro ji ndiko paro pere i kitawo achiel male milwoo ni Baibul
English: The true God directed men to write down his thoughts in one sacred book called the Bible

Adhola: Kitawo no n’iye wach maber ma Were mito ni ieyi.
English: It contains important information that God wants you to know.

Adhola: Were oeyo gimaber ri wan aka ryeko jye wok bonge.
English: God knows what is best for us, and he is the Source of all wisdom.

Adhola: Ka inowinji go ibino bedo dhano maryek.
English: By listening to him, you will become truly wise.​

Adhola: Were mito ni kis dhano manitye i piny osoma Baibul Baibul nwaere i dhudhok makweth.
English: God wants everyone on earth to read the Bible which is now available in many languages.

Adhola: Ka imito winjo Were, iripo kisoma kendo inia gima Baibul wacho.
English: If you want to listen to God, you must read and understand the Bible.

Adhola: Wajulizi pa Jehova jonyalo konyin fuonjirok Baibul.
English: Jehovah’s Witnesses can help you understand the Bible.

Adhola: I piny gipi, jofuonjo adyeri ma mako kwo Were.
English: In all the earth, they teach the truth about God.

Adhola: Ikiripere chulo pesa moro jye nyalo limo fuonji me.
English: You do not have to pay anything for this instruction. Y

Adhola: Inyalo kir fuonjere kwo Were ka ikidho ka chokirok pa Wajulizi pa Jehova.
English: You can also learn about God when you attend  Jehovah Witness meetings

Adhola: Ka chokirok no ilwoo ni Kingdom Hall of Jehovah’s Witnesses
English: Those meeting places are called  Kingdom Hall of Jehovah’s Witnesses.

Adhola: Wach pa Were obedo adyeri.
English: God’s word is truth.​

Adhola: Irao wanyalo geno Were?
English: Why can we trust in God?​

Adhola: Were Maradyeri a a?
English: Who Is the True God?

Adhola: Nitye Were achiel kende maradyeri, aka ilwoo go ni Jehova.
English: There is only one true God, and his name is Jehovah.

Adhola: Go obedo chuny, wakinyal neno go.
English: He is a Spirit; we cannot see him.

Adhola: Go maro wan aka go mito ni wabende wamar go.
English: He loves us and wants us to love him in return.

Adhola: Kendo go mito ni wamar jowoti wan.
English: He also wants us to love other people.

Adhola: Go a Were Majameni jye, Jachwech ma gikipiny jye
English: He is the Supreme One, the Creator of all things.

Adhola:
Munyo obino i piny olwo
go ni Yesu Kristo.
English: Later he came to earth ans was called  Jesus Christ

Adhola: Chwech pa Were marapena obedo dhano ma chuny majameni.
English: The first of God’s creations was a mighty spirit person

Adhola: Jehova amochweyo kir jomalaika.
English: Jehovah also created the angels.

Adhola: Jehova ochweyo michalin, piny kodi gikipiny jye man’iy
English: Jehovah God created the stars as well as the earth and all that is on it

Adhola: Ochweyo Adam, dhano marapena, wok i fukefuke.
English: He formed Adam, the first man, from the dust of the ground.​

Adhola: Irao waripo miyo Jehova wor?
English: Why should we honor Jehovah?​

Adhola: Megi kwo kite pa Were a mene?
English: What are some of God’s qualities?​

Adhola: Kwo Oido Chale Nedi i Ndelo ma Eden?
English: What Was Life Like in Paradise?

Adhola: Jehova ochweyo dhako motelo milwoo ni Eva, to miyo Adam dhako no wobedi chiege.
English: Jehovah made the first woman, Eve, and gave her to Adam to be his wife

Adhola: Jehova ochweyo jo munyo joni gi paro kanyachiel gi kwo maber, jokobedo gi teko moro jye.
English: Jehovah created them with minds and bodies that were perfect, without any flaw.

Adhola: Pecho pajo maon oido ilwoo ni ndelo ma Eden —jwom, yen manyak girachama kodi ogwange jye oido nitye kanyago.
English: Their Paradise home was the garden of Eden​—a place of great beauty with a river and fruit trees and animals.

Adhola: Jehova oido luwo gi jo kanyachiel gi fuonjo jo; bedi jowinjo go di jobedo i piny ka chil gi chil.
English: Jehovah spoke to them; he taught them. If they listened to him, they would live forever in Paradise on earth.

Adhola: Malaika achiel ochayo Were.
English: One of the angels rebelled against God.

Adhola: Malaika marach no ilwoo ni Sitan.
English: That wicked angel is Satan the Devil.

Adhola: Jehova onyutho Adam kodi Eva yath achiel mobedo i ndelo ma Eden to wacho ri jo ni ka jochamo kwo yath no jobino tho.
English: Jehovah showed Adam and Eve one fruit tree in the garden and told them that if they ate from it, they would die.

Adhola: Sitan komito ni Adam kodi Eva jowinji Jehova.
English: Satan did not want Adam and Eve to obey Jehovah.

Adhola: Ri ameno munyo oro thwol, Sitan owacho ri Eva ni ka jochamo kwo yath no jokiletho, kwanyo woko jolebedo paka Were.
English: So he used a serpent to tell Eve that if she ate the fruit from that tree, she would not die, but she would be like God.

Adhola: To meno obedo twodo.
English: Of course, that was a lie.

Adhola: Ginao Mowok’iye?
English: With What Results?

Adhola: Jowinjo Sitan
English: They Listened to Satan​

Adhola: Eva owinjo thwol to chamo kwo yath ma Were ochiero jo.
English: Eve listened to the serpent and ate of the fruit.

Adhola: Rumachien to miyo Adam bende to chamo.
English: Afterward, she gave some to Adam, and he ate it.

Adhola: Gima jotimo kobedo gimotire
English: What they did was wrong​

Adhola: Were oryemo jo i ndelo ma Eden.
English: God made them leave their Paradise home.

Adhola: Kwo obedo ri jo matek kanyachiel gi nyithindho pajo.
English: Life was hard for them and their children.

Adhola: Joti to jotho.
English: They grew old and died.

Adhola: Ongoye kama jokidh’iye; kwo pajo orumo kichutho.
English: They did not go to the spirit world; they ceased to exist.

Adhola: obedo gimarach.
English: it was a sin.

Adhola:
Watho rupiri wajojye wabedo nyikway
Adam gi Eva.
English: We die because we all come from Adam and Eve.

Adhola: Jomotho jokinyal neno kosa winjo kosa timo gimoro jye.
English: The dead are not able to see or hear or do anything.

Adhola: Jochale pa dhano ma nindo.
English: They are like those who are asleep

Adhola: Tho kobedo atoa pa Were ri ji.
English: Jehovah did not mean for people to die.

Adhola: Jehova chiegin chierino jomotho.
English: Soon he will bring back to life those asleep in death.

Adhola: Ka jowinji go, jobino limo kwo makirum.
English: If they listen to him, they will live forever.

Adhola: Irao watho?
English: Why do we die?​

Adhola: Tho bino rumo woko kichutho.
English: Death will be no more.​

Adhola: Mikula ma Ndir pa Nowa
English: The Great Flood​ during Noah's time

Adhola: Jomene ma Jowinjo Were?
English: Who Listened to God

Adhola: Adam kodi Eva jonywolo nyithindho to ji jomedere i piny.
English: Adam and Eve had children, and people became many on the earth.

Adhola: Rumachien, jomalaika megi jomakere gi Sitan to jochayo Were.
English: In time, some angels joined Satan’s rebellion.

Adhola: Jobino i piny to jolokere ji to jonywomo mon.
English: They came to earth and took on the bodies of men so that they could marry women.

Adhola: Nyithindho ma mon no jonywolo oido jombo loyo dhano moro jye, oido joger aka oido joni gi men moasere.
English: The women gave birth to superhuman sons, who were fierce and strong.

Adhola: Piny obino opo’iye ji marecho.
English: The world became filled with people who did bad things.

Adhola: Recho pa dhano obino opo i piny gipi aka paro pere jye oido rach hongo jye.
English: man’s wickedness was great on the earth and that every inclination of the thoughts of his heart was only bad all the time.

Adhola: Nowa obedo dhano maber.
English: Noah was a good man.

Adhola: Jehova owacho ri Nowa nike kidho reyo woko ji jye gi mikula.
English: Jehovah told Noah that He was going to destroy the wicked people with a great flood.

Adhola: Were owacho ri Nowa geto yee madwo swa, orwak’iye jopecho pere kodi ogwange mopokere opokere.
English: God also told Noah to build a huge boat, called an ark, and to take into it his family and every sort of animal.

Adhola: Nowa owacho ri ji kwo mikula moido kidho bino, to jokowinjo go.
English: Noah warned people about the coming Flood, but they did not listen.

Adhola: Jomegi jonyiero go; jomegi oido jomon gi go.
English: Some laughed at Noah; others hated him.

Adhola: Munyo geto yee orumo, Nowa orwak’iye ogwange.
English: When the ark was finished, Noah brought the animals inside.

Adhola: Nowa kodi jopecho pere to bende jodonjo i yee
English: Noah and his family entered too.

Adhola: Ginao ma Wafuonjere Kwo Mikula ma Ndir pa Nowa?
English: What Do We Learn From the Great Flood?

Adhola: Koth ochwe ndelo 40, wor g’odyechie, to umo piny gipi.
English: It rained for 40 days and 40 nights, and the water covered all the earth.

Adhola: Ji marecho jye jotho
English: All the wicked people died.

Adhola:
Jomalaika marecho jolunyo del
pajo to jolokere jwogi.
English: The rebellious angels left their bodies of flesh and became demons.

Adhola: Joma jobedo i yee joboth.
English: Those who were in the ark survived.

Adhola: Kada nende Nowa kodi jopecho pere jotho rumachien, jobino chierino jolimi kwo makirum.
English: Though Noah and his family eventually died, God will bring them to life again with the prospect of living forever.

Adhola: Sitan kodi jwogi fuodi jomedere wondo ji.
English: Satan and the demons continue to mislead people.

Adhola: Konon, paka obedo I ndir pa Nowa, joma thoth jokiwinji Jehova.
English: Today, as in Noah’s time, many reject Jehovah’s loving direction.

Adhola: Jehova bino reyo woko jomarecho jye.
English: Soon Jehovah will destroy all who are wicked.

Adhola: Jomegi jochale gi Nowa.
English: Some people are like Noah.

Adhola: Jowinjo Were to jotimo gima Were wacho; jono ilwoo jo ni Wajulizi pa Jehova.
English: They listen to God and do what he says; they are Jehovah’s Witnesses.

Adhola: Yeri royo ma tero jo i kwo.
English: Choose the road that leads to life.​

Adhola: Jomarecho ibino reyo woko jo aka joma mwol jobino bedo i piny.
English: The wicked will be destroyed; the meek will stay on earth

Adhola: Yesu Obedo ŋa?
English: Who Was Jesus?

Adhola: Ka wamito ni Jehova osangala, waripo winjo dhano man madwo.
English: If we want to please Jehovah, we must listen to another important person.

Adhola: Chango chon ma fuodi Jevova kochweyo Adam, Jehova ochweyo ato i polo.
English: Long before creating Adam, Jehovah created a mighty spirit person in the heavens.

Adhola: Munyo hongo okadho, Jehova ooro go i piny ka.
English: In time, Jehovah sent him to earth.

Adhola: Dhako ma fuodi kuya jachwo milwoo ni Maria to nywolo go.
English: A virgin named Mary gave birth to him

Adhola: Nyathi no ochwoki nyinge ni Yesu.
English: The child was given the name Jesus.

Adhola: Munyo nitye i piny ka, Yesu onyutho kite pa Were.
English: As a man on earth, Jesus perfectly reflected God’s qualities.

Adhola: Go obedo jawor, jamar, kendo dhano mayot tiyirok gine.
English: He was kind, loving, and approachable.

Adhola: Ofuonjo ji adyeri ma mako kwo Were gi miseni.
English: Fearlessly, he taught others the truth about Jehovah.

Adhola: Yesu obotho jotwo to chierino kir jomotho.
English: Jesus also healed the sick and raised to life some who had died.

Adhola: Jotel ma din oido jodak Yesu rupiri Yesu otucho ri jo fuonji pajo matwodo kodi kula pajo marecho.
English: The religious leaders hated Jesus because he exposed their false teachings and their evil ways.

Adhola: Jotel ma din joluwo twodo kwo Yesu momiyo Joroma jogoyo go to joneko.
English: The religious leaders persuaded the Romans to beat Jesus and to kill him.

Adhola: Irao ber ni waey gima mako kwo Yesu?
English: Why is it important to know about Jesus?​

Adhola: Ginao ma Yesu otimo i polo munyo fuodi kobino i piny?
English: What did Jesus do in heaven before he came to earth?​

Adhola: Tho pa Yesu Konyin Nedi?
English: What Does the Death of Jesus Mean for You?

Adhola: Rumachien ma ndelo adek munyo Yesu otyeko tho, nitye mon ma jokidho kama oido oyik’iye go to jokonwao del pere.
English: Three days after Jesus died, some women visited his tomb and found it empty.

Adhola: Jehova oido otyeko chierino Yesu.
English: Jehovah had raised Jesus from the dead.

Adhola: Rumachien, Yesu oneno ri jofuonjirok pere.
English: Jesus later appeared to his apostles.

Adhola: Jehova ochierino Yesu odoko Yesu to lokere chwech ma chuny makitho.
English: Yes, Jehovah had resurrected Jesus to life as a powerful, immortal spirit creature.

Adhola: Jofuonjirok pa Yesu joneno go munyo gik i polo.
English: Jesus’ disciples saw him go up to heaven.

Adhola: “Kemba” pa gimarach obedo ginao?
English: What are “the wages” of sin?​

Adhola: Yesu oyawo ri wan royo ma limo kwo makirum.
English: Jesus opened the way to everlasting life.

Adhola: Yesu omiyo kwo pere paka chul ri ji jye.
English: Jesus gave up his life to pay a ransom for mankind.

Adhola: Luwo kwo chul no, Were bino miyo wan kwo makirum.
English: By means of that ransom, God makes it possible for us to live forever.

Adhola: Jehova oyero Yesu bedo Kere ma ledhumo piny.
English: Jehovah appointed Jesus as King to rule over the earth.

Adhola: Ji 144,000 jolechierino wok i piny to jokidho i polo.
English: With him will be 144,000 faithful people who are resurrected from the earth to life in heaven.

Adhola: Yesu kodi ji 144,000 joledhum i Ker pa Were ma polo.
English: Jesus and the 144,000 form a righteous heavenly government​—God’s Kingdom.​

Adhola: Ker pa Were bino loko piny me kabedo maber swa.
English: God’s Kingdom will make the earth a paradise.

Adhola: Lweny, turo chik, chandi, kodi kech jye bino rumo woko.
English: War, crime, poverty, and hunger will be no more

Adhola: Ji jolebedo i kisangala madit swa.
English: People will be truly happy

Adhola: Silwany mene ma Ker pa Were lekelo ri wan?
English: What blessings will God’s Kingdom bring?​

Adhola: Waripo kwayo Ker pa Were wobin.
English: We should pray for God’s Kingdom to come.​

Adhola: Piny pa Were Manyien Obin Kerao?
English: When Will Paradise Come?

Adhola: Baibul chango oluwo kwo gikipiny matimere pama.
English: The Bible foretold many of the things that are happening today.

Adhola: Owacho ni ji di jobedo jomawor i pesa, joma kiwinji jonywol pajo, jomager, kodi joma maro kisangala ma piny.
English: It said that people would be lovers of money, disobedient to parents, fierce, and lovers of pleasures.

Adhola: Yengirok ma piny, lweny, kech, kodi two ma kiboth.
English: There would be great earthquakes, wars, food shortages, and widespread disease

Adhola: Gikipiny me jye nitye konon.
English: These things are happening now.

Adhola: Kendo Yesu owacho ni wach maber ma mako kwo Ker pa Were ibino fuonjo I piny gipi.
English: Also, Jesus said that the good news about the Kingdom would be preached in all the earth.​

Adhola: Jehova chiegin reyo woko jomarecho jye.
English: Jehovah will soon destroy all the wicked.

Adhola: Sitan kodi jwogi ibino reyo jo woko.
English: Satan and the demons will be punished.

Adhola: Joma winjo Were joleboth jobedi i piny pa Were manyien, kama lworo moro jye kobed’iye, piny ma lebed’iye genirok kodi mar.
English: Those who listen to God will survive into a righteous new world, where there will be no more fear, a world where people trust and love one another.

Adhola: Gikipiny mene ma Yesu chango owacho ma timere pama?
English: What did Jesus say would occur in our time?

Adhola: Ibino reyo woko jomarecho.
English: The wicked will be destroyed.​

Adhola: Joma Winjo Were Jobino Limo Silwany Mene i Hongo Mabino?
English: What Blessings Await Those Who Listen to God?

Adhola: Par kwo gikipiny mabeyo minolimi i hongo ma bino ka iwinjo Jehova!
English: Imagine the future blessings that you will enjoy if you listen to Jehovah!

Adhola: Ilebedo gi kwo maber; mongoye dhano moro jye ma two kosa mool.
English: You will have perfect health; no one will be sick or infirm.

Adhola: Jomarecho jokobedi, aka ibino geno kis dhano.
English: There will be no bad people, and you will be able to trust everyone.

Adhola: Litho, rembo, kosa ywak jye kobedi.
English: There will be no pain, sorrow, or tears.

Adhola: Ongoye dhano moro jye ma leti to tho.
English: No one will grow old and die.

Adhola: Ilebedo gi merin perin, wutimin in kanyachiel gi nyimerin.
English: You will be surrounded by friends and family. happy.

Adhola: Kwo i piny manyien bino kelo ri wan kisangala madit swa.
English: Life in Paradise will be a delight.

Adhola: Lworo moro jye kobed’iye.
English: There will be no fear.

Adhola: Ji jobino limo kisangala maradyeri.
English: People will be truly

Adhola: Jehova Winjo Kwayo Mawan?
English: Does Jehovah Listen to our prayers?

Adhola: Jehova winjo kwayo mawan.
English: Jehovah listens to our prayers

Adhola: Go mito ni waluwi gi go munyo gima wawacho wok i chuny wan.
English: He wants us to speak to him from our hearts.

Adhola: Ikiri ikway were moro jye kwanyo woko Jehova kende.
English: Pray to Jehovah and not to anyone else.

Adhola: Yesu ofuonjo wan paka waripo kwayo.
English: Jesus taught us how to pray.​

Adhola: Were winjo kwayo pa jomene?
English: To whom does God listen?​

Adhola: Kwayi gima Were yenyo wotimere i piny paka timere i polo.
English: Pray that God’s will be done in heaven and on earth.

Adhola: Kwayi Jehova wokonyin inyal timo gimaber.
English: Ask Jehovah to help you do what is good.

Adhola: Inyalo kwayo go chiemo, tich, kabedo, ruk, kodikwo maber.
English: You can also pray about food, employment, shelter, clothing, and health.

Adhola: Kwayi i nyingi Yesu inyuthi ni ifuoyo gima go otimo ri wan.
English: Pray in the name of Jesus to show that you value what he did for you

Adhola: Jehova winjo kwayo pa joma timo gimotire
English: Jehovah listens to people who do what is right.​

Adhola: Ikiri irembi.
English: Do not be anxious.​

Adhola: Inyalo Limo Nedi Kisangala i Pecho Perin?
English: How Can You Have a Happy Family Life?

Adhola: Were mito ni nywomirok wobedi i dyer jachwo achiel gi dhako achiel.
English: God’s standard is that marriage should be between one man and one woman.

Adhola: Jachwo ma maro chiege woro chiege.
English: A loving husband treats his wife with tenderness and understanding.

Adhola: Dhako ripo tiyirok maber gi chwore.
English: A wife should cooperate with her husband.

Adhola: Nyithindho joripo winjo jonywol pajo
English: Children should obey their parents.

Adhola: Wach pa Were wacho ni jachwo ripo maro chiege paka del kwoe won kendo ni dhako bende ripo miyo chwore dwo.
English: God’s Word says that a husband should love his wife as his own body and that a wife should have deep respect for her husband.

Adhola: Dhano ka onindo gi ata kobedo dhako pere kosa chwore meno gimarach.
English: Sex outside the marriage arrangement is wrong.

Adhola: Nywomo mon ma kalo achiel bende rach.
English: Polygamy is also wrong.

Adhola: Wach pa Were fuonjo ji paka jonyalo limo kisangala i pechin pajo.
English: Jehovah’s Word teaches families how to be happy.

Adhola: Wikiri witimi chot.
English: Keep morally clean.​

Adhola: Mar nyithindho perin, ifuonji jo, kendo ikuri jo.
English: Love, teach, and protect your children.​

Adhola: Ka Wamito ni Were Osangala Ginao ma Waripo Timo?
English: What Must We Do to Please God?

Adhola: Ka wamaro Jehova wakiletimo gikipiny ma go kimiti.
English: If we love Jehovah, we will not do things that he hates.

Adhola: Jehova kimiti ni wakwali, wameri, waor yen manyalo nyieko paro mawan
English: Jehovah does not want us to steal, to get drunk, or to abuse drugs.

Adhola: Were dak nek, redho iyi jo, chwo nindo gi chwo wadi gin mon bende gi mon wadi gin.
English: God hates murder, abortion, and homosexuality.

Adhola: Go kimiti wabedi jomawor kosa gorok  gi wadi wan.
English: He does not want us to be greedy or to fight with others.

Adhola: Wakiripi lamo chal kosa thyedho.
English: We must not worship idols or practice spiritism.

Adhola: Joma timo gikipiny marecho jokobedi I piny pa Were manyien.
English: In the earthly Paradise to come, there will be no place for people who do bad things.

Adhola: Were paro nedi kwo thyeth?
English: What is God’s view of magic?

Adhola: Irao wakiripi lamo chal?
English: Why should we not worship idols?

Adhola: Ka wamito ni Were osangala, waripo temo paka nyalere bedo paka go.
English: To be pleasing to God, we must try to be like him.

Adhola: Bedi dhano ma ni gi mar kodi wor kendo japok.
English: Show love to others by being kind and generous.

Adhola: Bedi dhano magenere.
English: Be honest.

Adhola: Bedi dhano ma mako wor ri ji kendo ma jachwak.
English: Be merciful and forgiving.

Adhola: Wach ri ji gima mako kwo Jehova kodi gima go mito niwatimi.
English: Tell others about Jehovah and his ways.​

Adhola: Bedi dhano male paka Jehova.
English: Imitate Jehovah.

Adhola: Nyuthi mar.
English: Show love.

Adhola: Inyalo Nyutho Nedi ni Iwinjo Jehova?
English: How Can You Show Loyalty to Jehovah?

Adhola: Timi gima nyalere jye iweyi kula moro jye ma Baibul kiyeyere gine.
English: Avoid taking part in any customs that are not in agreement with the Bible.

Adhola: Kada nende kiyot timo ameno.
English: It takes courage to do this.

Adhola: Ikiri idonji I wach maradhum ma piny rupiri joradhum jokithyel Jehova kodi Ker pere.
English: Do not get involved in the political affairs of the nations; they do not support Jehovah and his Kingdom.

Adhola: Jehova kuro joma winjo go.
English: Jehovah guards those loyal to him

Adhola: Tiyere gi Wajulizi pa Jehova; jobino konyin chorok chiegin gi Were.
English: Associate with Jehovah’s Witnesses; they will help you draw close to God.

Adhola: Medere fuonjirok gima mako kwo Were kendo itemi timo gima go yenyo.
English: Continue to learn about God and try to obey his commandments.

Adhola: Ka yeyo perin omedere, inyalo miyo Jehova kwo perin t’ilimo batisimo.
English: When your faith has become strong, you should dedicate your life to Jehovah and get baptized.​

Adhola: Soma Baibul,ikwayi Wajulizi pa Jehova jowokonyin nia gima Baibul fuonjo.
English: Read the Bible, and ask Jehovah’s Witnesses to help you understand it.

Adhola: Kethi gikipiny mifuonjere i tim.
English: Then, apply what you learn.

Adhola: Ka inotimi ameno, ibino limo kwo makirum.
English: If you do, you will live forever.

Adhola: Ng'uti recho perin aka ey Were wochwak rin.
English: Repent and be forgiven.​

Adhola: Wothi i royo matero jo I kwo
English: Walk on the road to life.

Adhola: Ilimi Kwo Makirum
English: Live Forever

Adhola: Imito eyo Adyeri?
English: Would You Like to Know the Truth?

Adhola: Adyeri ma mako kwo ginao?
English: The truth about what?

Adhola: Ma mako kwo penji madongo ma ji jomaro penjere.
English: About some of the most important questions that humans have ever asked.

Adhola: Miti ityeko penjereye penji me:
English: Perhaps you have wondered about such questions as these:

Adhola: Adyeri Were dewo kwo wan?
English: Does God really care about us?

Adhola: Lweny kodi chandirok orumi?
English: Will war and suffering ever end?

Adhola: Jomotho jo nikune?
English: What happens to us when we die?

Adhola: Odoko wanoneni ji mawan ma jotho?
English: Is there any hope for the dead?

Adhola: Anyalo kwayo nedi aka Were Owinjan?
English: How can I pray and be heard by God?

Adhola: Anyalo nedi limo kisangala i kwo?
English: How can I find happiness in life?

Adhola: Wanyalo nwao kune radwok ma penji me?
English: Where would you look for answers to these questions?

Adhola: Ka ipenjo ji mopokere opokere jodwoko penji no i nger mopokere.
English: If you went to libraries or bookstores, you might find thousands of books claiming to provide the answers.

Adhola:
Kada ipenji ji maryek kodi joma iworo, nger ma joledwokin
kimakere.
English: Often, though, one book contradicts another.

Adhola: Megi kwo radwok ma jomiyin nyalo neno p’otire to rumachien ma hongo machiek, inwao ni kotire.
English: Others seem valid at the moment but soon become outdated and are revised or replaced.

Adhola: Kareno, nitye kitawo achiel ma dwoko penji no maber swa.
English: There is, however, one book that contains reliable answers

Adhola: Kitawo no obedo wach maradyeri.
English: It is a book of truth

Adhola: Munyo Yesu Kristo kwayo Were, owacho ni: “Wach perin obedo adyeri.”
English: Jesus Christ said in prayer to God: “Your word is truth.”

Adhola: Wach no a Baibul.
English: Today we know that Word as the Holy Bible.

Adhola: Medere kisoma ineni paka Baibul dwoko penji no i nger mayot kendo magenere.
English: On the following pages, you will get a glimpse of the Bible’s clear, truthful answers to the above questions.

Adhola: Adyeri Were Dewo Kwo Wan?
English: Does God Really Care About Us?

Adhola: IRAO JI JOPENJERE PENJI ME?
English: WHY THE QUESTION ARISES:

Adhola: Din mathoth fuonjo ni Were ama kelo ri wan chandirok.
English: We live in a world full of cruelty and injustice. Many religions teach that the sufferings we experience are God’s will.

Adhola: GIMA BAIBUL FUONJO:
English: WHAT THE BIBLE TEACHES

Adhola: Were kinyal timo gima kotire.
English: God never causes what is wicked.

Adhola: Joroma 9:14 wacho ni: “Onyo wawachi nedi?"
English: Romans 9:14 says: "What then shall we say? "

Adhola: Nike Were kotire?
English: Is God unjust?

Adhola: Kameno be.
English: Not at all!

Adhola: Were ni g’atoa maber ri ji.
English: God has a loving purpose for humans.

Adhola: Amomiyo Yesu ofuonjo wan kwayo ni: “Bawan mani polo, . . . Ker perin wobin."
English: That is why Jesus taught us to pray: “Our Father in the heavens, let . . . your kingdom come. "

Adhola: Gima iyenyo wotimere i piny paka timere i polo.
English: Let your will take place, as in heaven, also on earth.

Adhola: Were dewo kwo wan tektek amomiyo otimo ri wan gikipiny mabeyo kweth
English: God cares so deeply about us that he has gone to great lengths to make the fulfillment of his purpose a certainty.

Adhola: Lweny Kodi Chandirok Orumi?
English: Will War and Suffering Ever End?

Adhola: Ji gana gi gana jomedere tho i lweny.
English: War continues to claim untold numbers of human lives.

Adhola: Wajojye wachandere.
English: All of us have been touched by human suffering.

Adhola: Were chiko kelo syem i piny gipi.
English: God foretells a time when he will establish peace earth wide

Adhola: I Ker pa Were ma polo, ji jokilefuonjere lweny
English: Under his Kingdom, a heavenly government, people will not “learn war anymore.”

Adhola: Were bino chowo woko chandirok jye.
English: God will bring an end to all injustice and suffering.

Adhola: Baibul wacho ni: Were bino yweyo pigi wa jo.
English: The Bible promises: God will wipe out every tear from their eyes.

Adhola: Tho odoko kobedi, kosa rembo, kosa litho, rupiri
English: Death will be no more, neither will mourning nor outcry nor pain be anymore.

Adhola: Gikipiny machon kanyachiel gi chandirok ma wan’iye konon jotyeko leny woko.
English: The former things including today’s injustices and sufferings have passed away.

Adhola: Din mathoth fuonjo ni ka dhano otho nitye gimoro i del pere aka ni gino kitho.
English: Most of the world’s religions teach that something inside a person continues living after death.

Adhola: Jomegi jofuonjo ni jomotho jonyalo chando jomakwo kosa ni Were wao jomarecho i mach makitho.
English: Some hold that the dead can harm the living or that God punishes the wicked by condemning them to eternal torment in a fiery hell.

Adhola: Ka dhano otho, kwo pere rumo kichutho.
English: At death, humans cease to exist.

Adhola: Jomotho jokinyal neno, winjo kosa timo gimoro jye, jochale pa dhano ma nindo
English: The dead cannot see, hear or do anything, they are like people who are asleep

Adhola: Rupiri jomotho jokuya gimoro jye, jokinyal winjo kosa timo gimoro jye, jokinyal chando kosa konyo jomakwo.,
English: Since the dead cannot know, feel, or experience anything, they cannot harm—or help—the living

Adhola: Odoko Wanoneni ji Mawan ma Jotho?
English: Is There Any Hope for the Dead?

Adhola: Wamito kwo kendo wamito bedo kanyachiel gi merin mawan.
English: We want to live, and we want to enjoy life with those we love.

Adhola: Kis ndir wamaro mito neno merin mawan ma chango jotho.
English: It is only natural that we yearn to see our dead loved ones again.

Adhola: Jomotho jobino chierino.
English: Those who have died will be resurrected.

Adhola: Yesu owacho ni: “Jomotho jye ma jonitye i kalyel jobino . . . wok kenyo.”
English: Jesus promised that “those in the memorial tombs will . . . come out."

Adhola: Paka obedo atoa pa Were, joma jolechierino jobino limo silwany ma bedo i piny pa Were manyien.
English: In harmony with God’s original purpose, those resurrected as humans will have the opportunity to live on a paradise earth.

Adhola: Chikirok me nyutho ni i hongo ma bino joma jolechierino jobino bedo gi kwo maber aka jobino bedo i piny chil gi chil.
English: This promised future includes perfect health and everlasting life for obedient humans.

Adhola: Baibul wacho ni: “Josilwany a joma mwol rupiri jobino lunjo piny.”
English: The Bible says: “The righteous will possess the earth, and they will live forever on it.”

Adhola: Chiegin ji i din jye jokwayo.
English: People in practically all religions pray.

Adhola: Kuchiel, joma thoth joparo ni Were kiwinji kwayo pajo.
English: Yet, many feel that their prayers are not answered.

Adhola: Munyo Yesu fuonjo wan kwayo, owacho ni wakiripi oro “wach kweth” paka jomegi jotimo.
English: Jesus taught us to avoid repeating set formulas in our prayers.

Adhola: Meno nyutho ni wakiripi kiluda wach i kwayo mawan.
English: “When praying,” he said, “do not say the same things over and over again.”

Adhola:
Ka wamito ni Were owinji kwayo mawan, waripo kwayo i nger ma go
mito.
English: If we want God to listen to our prayers, we must pray in the way that he approves.

Adhola: Nyalo timo ameno, waripo fuonjere gima Were yenyo nyaka to wakwayo paka Were mito ni wakway go.
English: To do that, we need to learn what God’s will is and then pray accordingly.

Adhola: 1 Yohana 5:14 wacho ni: “Waridho nike Were bino miyo wan gimoro jye ka wakwayo go paka go yenyo.”
English: First John 5:14 explains: “No matter what we ask according to God’s will, he hears us.”

Adhola: Joma thoth joparo ni bedo gi ao, kosa eyirok, nyalo kelo ri jo kisangala.
English: Many people believe that money, fame, or beauty will make them happy.

Adhola: Ri ameno, jodwaro gikipiny no.
English: So they pursue such things.

Adhola: To rumachien jonwao ni gikipiny no kikeli kisangala.
English: Later they find that those things don't bring happiness.

Adhola: Yesu onyutho gima kelo kisangala munyo wacho ni: “Josilwany meno a joma jowinjo Wach pa Were to joketho i tim.”
English: Jesus identified the key to happiness when he said: “Happy are those conscious of their spiritual need.” .

Adhola: Ka wafuonjere Wach pa Were to waketho i tim walimo kisangala maradyeri kosa silwany
English: True happiness can be found If we study the word of God and act on it.

Adhola: Adyeri no  nitye I Baibul
English: That truth is found in the Bible.

Adhola: Fuonjirok adyeri manitye i Baibul, konyo wan eyo gikipiny ma nyalo konyo wan i kwo.
English: Knowing that truth can help us to discern what is really important and what is not.

Adhola: Ka waoro fuonji ma Baibul i kwo mawan, wanyalo limo kisangala.
English: Allowing Bible truth to guide our decisions and actions leads to a more meaningful life.

Adhola: Watyeko nenoye paka Baibul dwoko penji auchiel no
English: This has been just a brief look at the Bible’s answers to six questions.

Adhola: Imito ŋeyo maloyo kenyo?
English: Do you want to know more than that?

Adhola: Ka ibende ini gi riyo ma ŋeyo Wach pa Were, miti imaro penjere penji ma chalo ama
English: If you are among those “conscious of their spiritual need,” no doubt you do.

Adhola: ‘Bedi Were dewo kwoŋ wan, d’oweyo wachandere ama?
English: ‘If God cares about us, why has he allowed so much evil and suffering throughout history?

Adhola: Anyalo nedi limo kisangala i pecho paran?
English: How can I improve the quality of my family life?

Adhola: Baibul dwoko penji ma chalo ameno kodi penji megi i nger maber swa.
English: The Bible gives full and satisfying answers to these and many more questions.

Adhola: Kareno, joma thoth jokimiti kisoma Baibul.
English: However, many today hesitate to look into the Bible.

Adhola: Joparo ni Baibul obedo kitawo madwoŋ swa kendo matek.
English: They see it as a lengthy book that is sometimes hard to understand.

Adhola: Imito dhano wokonyin fuonjirok Baibul?
English: Would you like help to find the answers in the Bible?

Adhola: Wajulizi pa Jehova jonitye gi gikipiny aryo ma nyalo konyi
English: Jehovah’s Witnesses offer two tools that can assist you.

Adhola: Marapena, obedo kitawo milwoŋo ni ’What Does the Bible Really Teach?’ mondiki konyo ji ŋeyo paka Baibul dwoko penji madongo ma wamaro penjere.
English: First, the book ’What Does the Bible Really Teach?’ is designed to help busy people to examine the Bible’s clear answers to vital questions.

Adhola: Mararyo, obedo chan ma fuonjo ji Baibul nono i pechin pajo.
English: The second tool is a free program of home Bible study.

Adhola: Mujulizi pa Jehova ma bedo chiegin kodin nyalo wendo rin i pecho perin kosa kamoro jye to soma kodin Baibul.
English: A jehovah witness next to youcan come to your home or another convenient location and  discuss the Bible with you.

Adhola: Kisoma no bedo ma nono.
English: The study is free of charge

Adhola: Kisoma me otyeko konyo ji gana gi gana i piny gipi.
English: Millions of people the world over have benefited from this program

Adhola: Joma thoth jotundo kir wacho ni “Anwaŋo adyeri!” Ongoye ŋaŋo moro jye maloyo meno.
English: Many of them have come to this thrilling conclusion: “I have found the truth!”

Adhola: Adyeri ma Baibul gonyo wan kwoŋ lworo moro jye ma wanyalo bedo gine.
English: Bible truth liberates us from superstition, confusion, and morbid fear.

Adhola: Miyo wan geno, kodi kisangala.
English: It gives us hope, purpose, and joy.

Adhola: Yesu owacho ni: “Wibino ŋeyo adyeri aka adyeri no bino miyo wibedo i syem.”
English: Jesus said: “You will know the truth, and the truth will set you free.”

Adhola: Imito kisoma gime i ?
English: Would you like to read this article in ?

Adhola: Ongoye gima loyo bedo mere pa Were.
English: Becoming God's friend is the best thing that could ever happen to you.

Adhola: Were bino fuonjin nger ma limo kisangala kodi syem.
English: God will teach you how to be happy and secure.

Adhola: Go lebothin fuonji matwodo kanyachiel kodi kula marecho
English: He will free you from many wrong beliefs and harmful practices.

Adhola: Were bino winjo kwayo perin.
English: God will listen to your prayers.

Adhola: Kendo wokonyin limo syem
English: He will help you to enjoy inner peace and confidence.

Adhola: Were bino konyin i teko.
English: God will support you during times of trouble.

Adhola: Were bino miyin mich ma kwo makirum
English: And God offers you his gift of everlasting life.

Adhola: Ka ichore chiegin gi Were, ilebedo mere pa joma jomaro go
English: As you draw close to God, you will draw close to friends of God

Adhola: Jobende jobino bedo merin perin
English: They will become your friends too

Adhola: Adyeri, jobino bedo wutimerin gi nyimerin
English: In fact, they will be like brothers and sisters to you

Adhola: Jobino winjo maber konyin fuonjirok gima mako kwoŋ Were aka jobino medin men
English: They will be happy to teach you about God and will help you and encourage you

Adhola: Wakirom gi Were
English: We are not equal to God

Adhola: Paka imito bedo mere pa Were, nitye gima dwoŋ swa m’iripo ŋeyo
English: As you seek God's friendship, you must understand an important fact

Adhola: Bedo mere pa Were ki chale kodi bedo mere gi muworo perin
English: Friendship with God is not a friendship between equals

Adhola: Were dwoŋ swa loyo wan, ryek, aka ni gi men moasere
English: He is far older and wiser and is more powerful than we are

Adhola: Go amaripo dhumo wan
English: He is our rightful Ruler

Adhola: Ri ameno ka wamito bedo mere pere, waripo winjo go kendo to watimo gima go yenyo
English: So if we want to be his friend, we must listen to him and do what he tells us to do

Adhola: Timo ameno konyo wan
English: This will always work for our good

Adhola: MERE PA WERE
English: GOD'S FRIEND

Adhola: Ka imito bedo mere pa Were iripo fuonjere gima mako kwoŋ go.
English: To be God’s friend, you need to learn about him.

Adhola: Merin perin joŋeyo nyingin kendo jooro?
English: Do your friends know your name and use it?

Adhola: Were mito ni iŋeyi nyinge kendo ior.
English: God wants you to know and use his name too.

Adhola: Nyingi Were a Jehova.
English: God’s name is Jehovah.

Adhola: Iripo fuonjere gima go mito kodi gima go kimiti.
English: You must also learn what he likes and dislikes.

Adhola: Ber iŋeyi merin pere kodi jokwor pere.
English: You need to know who his friends are and who his enemies are.

Adhola: ŋeyo dhano tero hongo ma romo.
English: It takes time to get to know someone.

Adhola: Baibul wacho ni ber walimi hongo ma fuonjirok gima mako kwoŋ Jehova.
English: The Bible says that it is wise to set aside time to learn about Jehovah.

Adhola: Merin pa Were jotimo gima sangala go
English: God’s friends do what is pleasing to him

Adhola: Par kwoŋ merin perin
English: Think about your friends

Adhola: Ka itimo ri jo gimarach, iparo ni jomedere bedo merin perin?
English: If you treat them badly and do the things that they hate, will they continue to be your friends?

Adhola: Be! I royo achiel, ka imito bedo mere pa Were, iripo timo gima sangala go
English: Of course not! In the same way, if you want to be God’s friend, you need to do what is pleasing to him

Adhola: Nitye din achiel kende ma nyalo lokin mere pa Were
English: Not all religions lead to friendship with God

Adhola: Yesu, mobedo mere pa Were ma loyo, oluwo kwoŋ royo aryo
English: Jesus, who is God’s closest friend, spoke of two roads

Adhola: Royo achiel lach aka opoŋ’iye ji
English: One road is wide and is filled with people

Adhola: Royo no tero jo i reyirok
English: That road leads to destruction

Adhola: Royo man diny aka n’iye ji manok
English: The other road is narrow and has few people traveling on it

Adhola: Royo no tero jo i kwo makirum
English: That road leads to everlasting life

Adhola: Meno nyutho ni ka imito bedo mere pa Were, iripo fuonjere nger motire ma lamo go
English: This means that if you want to have God’s friendship, you must learn the correct way to worship him

Adhola: Nitie din acel kende mar’adieri?
English: Is there only one true religion?

Adhola: Neni gikipiny abic manyutho din mar’adieri.
English: Consider five identifying marks of true worship

Adhola: Inyalo fuonjere gima mako kwoŋ Jehova ka isoma Baibul.
English: You can learn about Jehovah by reading the Bible.

Adhola: Chango chon, Jehova oyero ji ndiko wach pere.
English: Long ago God picked certain humans to write down his thoughts.

Adhola: Wach ma jondiko ilwoŋo ni Baibul.
English: Those writings are called the Bible.

Adhola: Konon wafuonjere gima mako kwoŋ Were ka wasoma Baibul.
English: Today we learn about God by reading the Bible.

Adhola: Baibul n’iye wach pa Jehova, amomiyo ilwoŋo ni Wach pa Were.
English: Because the Bible contains Jehovah’s word, or message, it is also called God’s Word.

Adhola: Wanyalo geno gima Baibul wacho rupiri Jehova "kinyal twodo
English: We can believe what the Bible says because Jehovah never lies.

Adhola: Wach pa Were n’iye adyeri.
English: God’s Word contains the truth.

Adhola: Baibul obedo mich maber mowok bongi Were
English: The Bible is one of God’s most precious gifts to us

Adhola: Chale gi balwa ma janywol ma maro nyithindho pere ondiko ri jo
English: It is like a letter from a loving father to his children

Adhola: Wacho ri wan kwoŋ chikirok pa Were, nike go kidho loko piny me kabedo maber swa
English: It tells us about God’s promise to change the earth into a wonderful place to live in

Adhola: Wacho ri wan gima Were otimo chango chon, gima go timo pama, kodi gima go letimo i hongo ma bino ri joma geno go
English: It tells us what he has done in the past, what he is doing now, and what he will do in the future for his faithful children

Adhola: Aka konyo wan i teko mawan, kendo konyo wan limo kisangala
English: It also helps us to solve our problems and to find happiness

Adhola: Â Wajulizi pa Jehova jobedo merin pa Were
English: Â Jehovah’s Witnesses are friends of God

Adhola: jobino konyin iniaŋ gima Baibul fuonjo.
English: they will help you understand what the Bible teaches.

Adhola: Wach ri jo ni imito fuonjere Baibul.
English: Just tell them that you want to study the Bible

Adhola: Jolefuonjin mongoye pesa moro jye m’ichulo.
English: They do not charge money for this.

Adhola: Medo kwoŋ meno, inyalo kidho kachokirok pajo milwoŋo ni Kingdom Hall.
English: In addition, you can attend Christian meetings in places called Kingdom Halls.

Adhola: Ka inokidhi i chokirok pa Jokristo me, ibino medo ŋeyo Were.
English: If you attend Christian meetings, you will rapidly grow in your knowledge of God.

Adhola: Gikipiny ma Were ochweyo nyalo fuonjin gima mako kwoŋ go
English: You can learn about God from the things he has made

Adhola: Baibul wacho ni: Were ochweyo polo gi piny
English: For example, the Bible says: "God created the heavens and the earth"

Adhola: Jehova kochweyo "polo" kende, to ochweyo kir waŋchieŋ
English: When Jehovah created "the heavens",  he made the sun

Adhola: Meno fuonjo wan aŋo kwoŋ Were?
English: Now what does that tell us about God?

Adhola: Fuonjo wan nike Jehova ni gi men madit swa
English: It tells us that Jehovah has great power

Adhola: Go kende ama nyalo timo gima ni gi men paka waŋchieŋ
English: Only he could make something as powerful as the sun

Adhola: Kendo gino fuonjo wan nike Jehova ryek, rupiri ripo bedo ni go ooro ryeko madit swa nyalo chweyo waŋchieŋ ma miyo wan lero aka ma kinyal leny woko
English: It also tells us that Jehovah is wise, since it required wisdom to make the sun, which gives out heat and light and never burns out

Adhola: Chwech pa Jehova nyutho ni go maro wan
English: Jehovah’s creation shows that he loves us

Adhola: Par kwoŋ yen mopokere opokere ma Jehova ochweyo manyiak girachama
English: Think about all the different kinds of fruits that there are on earth

Adhola: Jehova oido nyalo chweyo yath achiel kende kosa to weyo ma kochweyo kada achiel
English: Jehovah could have provided just one kind of fruit for usâ€‹â€”or none at all

Adhola: To, Jehova ochweyo ri wan yen makweth manyiak girachama
English: Instead, Jehovah gave us many types of fruit with a great variety of shapes, sizes, colors, and tastes

Adhola: Gino nyutho ni Jehova obedo Were ma maro wan, ma japok, ma dewo kwoŋ wan, kendo mani gi wor
English: This shows that Jehovah is a God who is not only loving but also very generous and thoughtful and kind

Adhola: Piny pa Were manyien kobedi paka piny ma wan’iye pama
English: Paradise will not be like the world we live in now

Adhola: Kobedo atoŋa pa Were nike piny wobed’iye teko, rembo, litho kodi chandirok
English: God never wanted the earth to be filled with trouble and sorrow, pain and suffering

Adhola: I hongo mabino, Were bino loko piny me kabedo maŋon
English: In the future, God will make the earth a paradise

Adhola: Piny manyien lechale nedi?
English: What will Paradise be like?

Adhola: Wey wanen gima Baibul wacho:
English: Let us see what the Bible says:

Adhola: Ji mabeyo
English: Good people

Adhola: Merin pa Were ama jobino bedo i piny manyien
English: Paradise will be the home of God’s friends

Adhola: Kis dhano bino timo ri nyawote gikipiny mabeyo
English: They will do good things for one another

Adhola: Jobino kuro chik pa Were
English: They will live according to the righteous ways of God

Adhola: Chiemo bino bedo mathoth
English: Plenty of food

Adhola: Kech kobedi i piny manyien
English: In Paradise, there will be no hunger

Adhola: Baibul wacho ni: "Chiemo bino bedo mathoth i piny"
English: The Bible says: "There will come to be plenty of food on the earth"

Adhola: Udi mabeyo gi tich ma kelo kisangala
English: Fine houses and enjoyable work

Adhola: I piny manyien, kis dhano lebedo gi pecho pere
English: On the Paradise earth, every family will have a home of its own

Adhola: Kis dhano bino timo tich ma kelo ri go kisangala
English: Everyone will do work that brings true happiness

Adhola: Syem i piny gipi
English: Peace worldwide

Adhola: Ji odoko jokonekere i lweny
English: No longer will people fight and die in war

Adhola: Wach pa Were wacho ni: "Go kweyo lweny i piny gibe
English: God’s Word says: "He is making wars to cease"

Adhola: Kwo maber.
English: Good health.

Adhola: Baibul wacho ni: ˜Ongoye ŋata bed i piny ma latwo kendo
English: The Bible promises: "No one will be sick again.

Adhola: Kendo piny manyien kobed’iye jomoŋol, joma waŋ gin otho, kosa obadha.
English: Also, no one will be lame or blind or deaf or unable to talk.

Adhola: Litho, rembo kodi tho jye bino rumo woko.
English: An end to pain, sorrow, and death.

Adhola: rupiri gikipiny macon jotieko leny woko.
English: The former things have passed away.

Adhola: Wach pa Were wacho ni: "Tho odoko kobedi, kosa rembo, kosa ywak, kosa litho"
English: God’s Word says: "Death will be no more, neither will mourning nor outcry nor pain be anymore.

Adhola: Jomarecho jokobedi.
English: Bad people will be gone.

Adhola: Jehova chiko ni jomarecho ibino reyo jo woko.
English: Jehovah promises: "The wicked will be cut off from the very earth".

Adhola: Ji jobino marere kendo jobino worere
English: People will love and respect one another

Adhola: Chando ji, woro, kodi dakirok kobedi
English: No longer will there be injustice, oppression, greed, and hatred

Adhola: Ji jye jobino tiyere maber kendo jobino luwo chik pa Were
English: People will be united and will live in harmony with God’s righteous ways

Adhola: Baibul waco ri wan gim’omiyo Were ocweyo piny, hongo ma candirok bino rum’iye, kodi gim’omiyo Were ocweyo piny kodi ji
English: The Bible explains why God created the earth, when suffering will end, and what the future holds for the earth and those who live on it

Adhola: Gikipiny marecho matimere i piny konon, nyutho ni piny manyien chiegin tundo.
English: The bad things that are now happening on earth show that Paradise is near.

Adhola: Baibul chango owacho ni di waneno teko makweth munyo piny manyien chiegin tundo.
English: The Bible said that we would see terrible times just before the Paradise would come.

Adhola: Adyeri, pama wanitye i hongo ma chalo ameno.
English: We are living in such times now!

Adhola: Me a gikipiny megi ma Baibul chango owacho ni d’otimere:
English: Here are some of the things that the Bible said would happen:

Adhola: Lweny
English: Great wars

Adhola: Nono bino lwenyo gi nono man, to ker acel lwenyo gi ker man
English: Nation will rise against nation and kingdom against kingdom

Adhola: Mikwenda me otyeko tundo i kare
English: This prophecy has come true

Adhola: Wok i oro ma 1914, watyeko bedo gi lweny ma piny gipi diryo kodi lweny megi i kabedo mopokere opokere
English: Since the year 1914, there have been two world wars and many smaller wars

Adhola: Ji gana gi gana jotyeko tho i lweny
English: Millions of people have died in them

Adhola: Two moasere
English: Widespread disease

Adhola: Two labedo bedo i kabedo m’opokere
English: There would be in one place after another pestilences

Adhola: Iyadyeri, wach me otundo i kare
English: Truly, this has this come to pass

Adhola: Two pal chuny jo, lihera, musuja, two twilo, kanyachiel gi two megi mopokere opokere otyeko neko ji gana gi gana
English: Cancer, heart disease, tuberculosis, malaria, AIDS, and other diseases have killed millions of people

Adhola: Kech
English: A lack of food

Adhola: I piny gipi, nitye ji ma jongoye gi chiemo ma romo jo
English: Throughout the earth there are people who do not have enough food to eat

Adhola: Ji gana gi gana jotho kech kis oro
English: Millions of people die of hunger every year

Adhola: Me obedo ranyuth man ma miyo wan ŋeyo nike piny manyien chiegin tundo
English: This is another sign that the Paradise will soon be here

Adhola: Baibul wacho ni: "Kec bino bedo"
English: The Bible says: "There will be food shortages"

Adhola: Yengirok pa piny.
English: Earthquakes.

Adhola: Yengirok pa piny [bino bedo] i kabedo m’omore."
English: "There will be . . . earthquakes in one place after another."

Adhola: Gime bende timere pama.
English: This also has come true in our time.

Adhola: Yengirok pa piny otyeko neko ji ma kalo milion achiel wok i oro ma 1914.
English: Over a million people have died in earthquakes since 1914.

Adhola: Ji marecho.
English: Wicked people.

Adhola: Ji jobino bedo "jomawor i pesa" kodi "joyumirok"
English: People would be "lovers of money" and "lovers of themselves."

Adhola: kendo "jobino maro kisangala ma piny loyo Were."
English: And they would be "lovers of pleasures rather than lovers of God."

Adhola: Aka nyithindho jobino bedo "joma kiwinji jonywol pajo.
English: Children would be "disobedient to parents."

Adhola: Ikiyey ni pama joma chalo ameno jonitye?
English: Do you not agree that there are many people like that today?

Adhola: Jokiwor Were, kendo jodak joma fuonjere gima mako kwoŋ Were.
English: They have no respect for God, and they make trouble for those who try to learn about God.

Adhola: Turo chik
English: Crime

Adhola: Tim mareco medere
English: There would also be an increasing of lawlessness

Adhola: Miti ibende ineno ni tim marecho omedere tektek konon
English: Likely you will agree that crime is worse than it was years ago

Adhola: Kis kamoro ji jolworo kwalo jo kosa timo jo marach
English: People everywhere are at risk of being robbed, cheated, or harmed

Adhola: Gikipiny me jye nyutho ni Ker pa Were chiegin bino
English: All these things show that God’s Kingdom is near

Adhola: Baibul wacho ni: ˜Ka wineno gikipiny me timere, ŋeyi win ni Ker pa Were cegin bino"
English: The Bible says: "When you see these things occurring, know that the kingdom of God is near"

Adhola: Ker pa Were a ginaŋo?
English: What is the Kingdom of God?

Adhola: Obedo adhum pa Were ma polo ma bino loko piny me kabedo maŋon swa
English: It is God’s heavenly government that will bring Paradise to this earth

Adhola: Ker pa Were bino kwanyo woko adhum pa ji nyaka won wochaki dhumo
English: God’s Kingdom will replace human governments

Adhola: Gikipiny mareco ocako nedi, aka raŋo Were oweyo gikipiny mareco tundo pama?
English: How did evil begin, and why has God allowed it to continue?

Adhola: Candirok orumi?
English: Will there ever be an end to suffering?

Adhola: Jehova koyey jomarecho nyieko piny manyien
English: Jehovah will not allow bad people to ruin Paradise

Adhola: Merin pa Were kende ama jolebedo i piny manyien
English: Only his friends will live there

Adhola: Were letimo nedi jomarecho? Nyalo dwoko penji no, par kwoŋ gimobedo i ndir pa Nowa
English: What will happen to bad people? To learn the answer, consider the true story of Noah

Adhola: Nowa obedo i piny ka chango chon
English: Noah lived thousands of years ago

Adhola: Go obedo dhano maber aka otemo paka nyalo timo gima Jehova yenyo
English: He was a good man who always tried hard to do Jehovah’s will

Adhola: Kuchiel, joman moido jobedo i piny i ndir no, oido jotimo gikipiny marecho
English: But the other people on earth did bad things

Adhola: Ri ameno, Jehova owacho ri Nowa ni oido kidho kelo mikula woreyi woko jomarecho
English: So Jehovah told Noah that He was going to bring a flood to destroy all those wicked people

Adhola: Owacho ri Nowa geto yee ma botho go kanyachiel gi jopecho pere ka Mikula obino
English: He told Noah to build an ark so that he and his family would not die when the Flood came

Adhola: Nowa kodi jopecho pere jogeto yee.
English: Noah and his family built the ark.

Adhola: Nowa owacho ri ji kwoŋ mikula moido kidho bino, to jokowinjo go.
English: Noah warned people that the Flood was coming, but they did not listen to him.

Adhola: Jomedere ameda timo gikipiny marecho.
English: They continued to do bad things.

Adhola: Munyo geto yee orumo, Nowa orwak’iye ogwange, to go bende kanyachiel gi jopecho pere jodonjo i yee.
English: After the ark was finished, Noah took animals into the ark, and he and his family also went inside.

Adhola: Rumachien to Jehova kelo asur  madwoŋ swa.
English: Then Jehovah brought a great storm.

Adhola: Koth ochwe ndelo 40 wor g’odyechieŋ to umo piny gipi.
English: Rain fell for 40 days and 40 nights. The water flooded all the earth.

Adhola: Jomarecho jotho, to Nowa kodi jopecho pere joboth
English: The wicked people lost their lives, but Noah and his family were saved

Adhola: Jehova obotho jo to jobedo i piny mongoy’iye recho moro jye
English: Jehovah brought them safely through the Flood into an earth cleansed of wickedness

Adhola: Baibul wacho ni ndelo chiegin tundo ma doko Jehova lerey’iye woko joma kimiti timo gimaber
English: The Bible says that once again the time is coming when Jehovah will destroy those who refuse to do what is right

Adhola: Ji mabeyo joleboth
English: Good people will not be destroyed

Adhola: Jobino bedo i piny manyien chil gi chil
English: They will live forever on the Paradise earth

Adhola: Konon joma thoth jotimo gikipiny marecho
English: Today many people do bad things

Adhola: Piny opoŋ’iye teko
English: The world is full of trouble

Adhola: Kis ndelo, Jehova oro ji pere miyo ji rapiri, to joma thoth jokiwinji wach pa Jehova
English: Jehovah sends his Witnesses again and again to warn the people, yet most do not want to listen to Jehovah’s words

Adhola: Jokimiti wiro kula pajo
English: They do not want to change their ways

Adhola: Jokimiti yeyo gima Were wacho kwoŋ gimotire kodi gima kotire
English: They do not want to accept what God says about right and wrong

Adhola: Were otimi aŋo ri jono?
English: What will happen to these people?

Adhola: Jowiri kula pajo?
English: Will they change someday?

Adhola: Joma thoth jokowiri kula pajo
English: Many will never change

Adhola: Ndelo chiegin tundo worey woko jomarecho kichutho ma doko jokobedi i piny ka
English: The time is coming when wicked people will be destroyed and will never live again

Adhola: Were korey woko piny me; to bino loko manyien ayino
English: The earth will not be destroyed; it will be made into a paradise

Adhola: Merin pa Were jobino bedo i piny ka chil gi chil
English: Those who become God’s friends will live forever in the Paradise on earth

Adhola: Jakwor pa Were madwoŋ a Sitan
English: God’s chief enemy is Satan the Devil

Adhola: Go obedo chwech ma chuny mochayo Were
English: He is a spirit creature who rebelled against Jehovah

Adhola: Sitan fuodi medere pyemo gi Were kanyachiel gi kelo ri ji teko
English: Satan continues to fight against God and causes great trouble for humans

Adhola: Sitan rach
English: Satan is evil

Adhola: Go jatwodo kendo janek
English: He is a liar and a murderer

Adhola: Jomalaika megi bende jomakere gi Sitan to jochayo Were
English: Other spirit creatures joined Satan in his rebellion against God

Adhola: Baibul lwoŋo jo ni jwogi
English: The Bible calls them demons

Adhola: Paka Sitan, jwogi bende jokwor pa ji
English: Like Satan, the demons are enemies of humans

Adhola: Jomito swa kelo ri ji litho
English: They like to hurt people

Adhola: Jehova bino reyo woko Sitan kodi jwogi pere kichutho
English: Jehovah will destroy Satan and his demons forever

Adhola: Jodoŋ gi nyaka hongo machiek ma chando ji
English: They have only a short time left to make trouble for humans

Adhola: Ka imito bedo mere pa Were, ikiripi timo gima Sitan mito ni itimi
English: If you want to be God’s friend, you must not do what Satan wants you to do

Adhola: Sitan kodi jwogi jodak Jehova
English: Satan and the demons hate Jehovah

Adhola: Jobedo jokwor pa Were, aka jomito ni ibende ibedi jakwor pa Were
English: They are enemies of God, and they want to make you an enemy of God

Adhola: Iripo yero ŋata imito kisangala Sitan kosa Jehova
English: You must choose whom you want to please Satan or Jehovah

Adhola: Ka imito kwo makirum, iripo timo gima Were yenyo
English: If you want everlasting life, you must choose to do God’s will

Adhola: Sitan ni gi ryeko kodi nger mopokere opokere ma wondo gine ji
English: Satan has many tricks and ways to deceive people

Adhola: Go otyeko miŋo ji makweth
English: Most people are being fooled by him

Adhola: Yesu Kristo obedo Nyathi pa Jehova, kendo mere pere maloyo.
English: Jesus Christ is Jehovah’s Son and his closest, dearest friend

Adhola: Munyo fuodi kobino i piny ka, Yesu oido bedo i polo paka chwech ma chuny majameni.
English: Before he lived as a man on earth, Jesus lived in heaven as a mighty spirit creature

Adhola: Rumachien, go obino i piny ka to fuonjo ji adyeri ma mako kwoŋ Were.
English: Then he came to earth to teach people the truth about God

Adhola: Kendo omiyo kwo pere wonyal botho ji kwoŋ gimarach kodi tho.
English: He also gave his human life to save obedient humans from sin and death

Adhola: Onyo pama Yesu amobedo Kere ma Ker pa Were, adhum ma polo ma bino loko piny me kabedo maber swa.
English: Jesus is now the King of God’s Kingdom, a heavenly government that will bring Paradise to this earth

Adhola: Jomalaika bende merin pa Were
English: The angels are also God’s friends.

Adhola: Jomalaika jokobedo ji ma chango jobedoye i piny to jotho
English: The angels did not begin their lives as humans on earth.

Adhola: Were ochweyo jo chango chon munyo fuodi kochweyo kir piny
English: They were created in heaven before God made the earth.

Adhola: Nitye jomalaika gana gi gana
English: There are millions of angels.

Adhola: Merin pa Were me ma jobedo i polo jomito ni ji jowofuonjere adyeri ma mako kwoŋ Were
English: These heavenly friends of God want people to learn the truth about Jehovah

Adhola: Were ni gi merin pere i piny ka; go lwoŋo jo ni Wajulizi pere.
English: God also has friends on the earth; he calls them his witnesses.

Adhola: Mujulizi i koti luwo gima mako kwoŋ dhano pere.
English: A witness in court tells what he knows about someone or something.

Adhola: Wajulizi pa Jehova bende jowacho ri ji gima mako kwoŋ Jehova kanyachiel kodi atoŋa pere.
English: Jehovah’s Witnesses tell others what they know about Jehovah and his purpose.

Adhola: Paka jomalaika, Wajulizi pa Jehova jomito konyin ifuonjere gima mako kwoŋ Jehova.
English: Like the angels, the Witnesses want to help you learn the truth about Jehovah.

Adhola: Jomito ni ibende ibedi mere pa Were.
English: They want you to be God’s friend too.

Adhola: Ka imito bedo mere pa Were, iripo lamo go i nger motire.
English: If you want to be a friend of God, you must practice the religion that God approves.

Adhola: Yesu owacho ni joma lamo Were i royo motire jobino lamo go "iy’adieri."
English: Jesus said that "the true worshipers" would worship God in harmony with "truth."

Adhola: Nitye royo achiel kende motire ma lam’iye Were.
English: There is only one correct way to worship God.

Adhola: Din maradyeri tero jo i kwo makirum, aka din matwodo tero jo i reyirok
English: True religion leads to everlasting life, and false religion leads to destruction.â€‹

Adhola: Inyalo ŋeyo din maradyeri ka ineno tim pa joma nitye i din no.
English: You can recognize true religion by watching the people who practice it

Adhola: Kwoŋbedo ni Jehova ber, joma lamo go iyadyeri bende joripo bedo ji mabeyo.
English: Since Jehovah is good, those who are his true worshipers must be good people
