Adhola: Paka tyendi muchungwa maber nyak muchungwa mabeyo, apaka din maradyeri bende bed’iye ji mabeyo.â€‹
English: Just as a good orange tree produces fine oranges, the true religion produces fine people

Adhola: Merin pa Jehova joworo Baibul
English: Jehovah’s friends have deep respect for the Bible.

Adhola: Joŋeyo nike Baibul obedo wach pa Were
English: They know that the Bible is from God.

Adhola: Jooro gima Baibul wacho i kwo pajo, i chowo teko pajo, kodi konyo jo fuonjirok gima mako kwoŋ Were
English: They allow what it says to guide their lives, to solve their problems, and to help them learn about God.

Adhola: Jotemo ketho gikipiny ma jofuonjo i tim
English: They try to practice what they preach.

Adhola: Merin pa Jehova jomarere.
English: Jehovah’s friends show love for one another.

Adhola: Rupiri Yesu onyutho ji mar, ofuonjo jo gima mako  kwoŋ Were, kodi botho jo two.
English: Jesus showed love for people by teaching them about God, by curing those who were sick.

Adhola: Joma nitye i din maradyeri bende jomaro ji.
English: Those who practice the true religion also show love to others.

Adhola: Paka Yesu, jokichay jochandi kosa joma jokobedo jonono pajo.
English: Like Jesus, they do not look down on those who are poor or are of a different ethnic group.

Adhola: Yesu owacho ni ji di joŋeyo jofuonjirok pere chungo kwoŋ mar ma joni gine i dyer jo.
English: Jesus said that people would know his disciples by the love they show for one another

Adhola: Merin pa Were joworo nyingi Were, Jehova.
English: God’s friends honor God’s name, Jehovah.

Adhola: Adyeri dhano nyalo bedo mere perin ka okwero oro nyingin?
English: If someone refused to use your name, would that person be your close friend?

Adhola: Be! Ka wani gi mere mawan, waoro nyinge aka wawacho ri joman gikipiny mabeyo ma mako kwoŋ mere mawan no.
English: No! When we have a friend, we use his name and we say good things about that friend to others.

Adhola: Ri ameno, joma mito bedo merin pa Were joripo oro nyinge kendo to jowacho ri joman gima mako kwoŋ go.
English: So those who wish to be God’s friends should use his name and talk about him to others

Adhola: Jehova mito ni watimi ameno.
English: Jehovah wants us to do that.

Adhola: Paka Yesu chango otimo, merin pa Were jofuonjo ji kwoŋ Ker pa Were.
English: Like Jesus, God’s friends teach people about God’s Kingdom

Adhola: Ker pa Were obedo adhum ma polo ma bino loko piny me kabedo maŋon swa.
English: God’s Kingdom is the heavenly government that will make the earth a paradise

Adhola: Merin pa Were jowacho ri ji wach maber me ma mako kwoŋ Ker pa Were.
English: God’s friends share this good news about God’s Kingdom with others

Adhola: Wajulizi pa Jehova jotemo paka jonyalo bedo merin pa Were
English: Jehovah’s Witnesses try to be friends of God.

Adhola: Joworo Baibul aka jomarere
English: They respect the Bible and have love among themselves.

Adhola: Jooro kendo joworo nyingi Were aka jofuonjo ji gima mako kwoŋ Ker pa Were
English: They also use and honor God’s name and teach others about God’s Kingdom.

Adhola: Wajulizi pa Jehova ama jonitye i din maradyeri
English: Jehovah’s Witnesses practice the true religion on earth today.

Adhola: Saitan kodi jwogi pere jokimiti ni ilami Were.
English: Satan and his demons do not want you to serve God.

Adhola: Jokimiti dhano moro jye wodoŋi yu thenge pa Were.
English: They want to turn everyone away from God if they can.

Adhola: Jooro ryeko mene?
English: How do they try to do this?

Adhola: Achiel kwoŋ gikipiny ma jooro, a din matwodo.
English: One way is through false religion.

Adhola: Ka din kifuonji adyeri mawok i Baibul, bedo din matwodo.
English: A religion is false if it does not teach the truth from the Bible.

Adhola: Din matwodo chale gi pesa mochwogi achwoga.
English: False religion is like false money

Adhola: Nyalo neno pa pesa motire, to kibedi gi kony.
English: It may look like the real thing, but it is worthless.

Adhola: Pesa ma chalo ameno nyalo kelo rin teko madwoŋ swa.
English: It can cause you much trouble.

Adhola: Fuonji matwodo kinyal kisangala Jehova, Were maradyeri
English: Religious falsehood can never please Jehovah, the God of truth

Adhola: Munyo Yesu nitye i piny ka, oido nitye kitipa ma din moido mito neko go
English: When Jesus was on earth, there was a religious group who wanted to kill him

Adhola: Oido joparo ni din pajo amotire
English: They thought that their way of worship was the right way

Adhola: Jowacho ni: "Wanitie gi Bawan acel kende, Were won gipi"
English: They said: "We have one Father, God

Adhola: Yesu oyeyere gi jo?
English: Did Jesus agree?

Adhola: Be! Owacho ri jo ni: "Wibedo nyithindho pa bawin, jwogi"
English: No! He said to them: "You are from your father the Devil"

Adhola: Konon, joma thoth joparo ni jolamo Were, kareno iyadyeri, jolamo Sitan kodi jwogi pere!
English: Today many people think that they are worshiping God, but they are really serving Satan and his demons!

Adhola: Paka yath marach nyak gimarach, apaka din matwodo bende bed’iye ji marecho
English: Just as a rotten tree produces bad fruit, false religion produces people who do bad things

Adhola: Piny opoŋ’iye teko rupiri ji jotimo gikipiny marecho
English: The world is full of trouble because of the bad things people do

Adhola: Nitye lweny, kwo, chandirok, nek, kodi mako mon
English: There is immorality, fighting, stealing, oppression, murder, and rape

Adhola: Joma thoth ma jotimo gikipiny me jo ni gi din, to din pajo kifuonji jo timo gimaber
English: Many who do these bad things have a religion, but their religion does not move them to practice what is good

Adhola: Ka jokoweyo ameno timo gikipiny marecho, jokinyal bedo merin pa Were
English: They cannot be God’s friends unless they stop doing bad things

Adhola: Din matwodo fuonjo ji lamo chal.
English: False religion teaches people to pray to idols.

Adhola: Were chiero wan lamo chal.
English: God says not to pray to idols.

Adhola: Par kwoŋ gime.
English: This is reasonable.

Adhola: Inyalo fuoyo ka dhano okwero luwo kodin to luwo gi picha perin ayino?
English: Would you like it if someone never talked to you but only talked to your picture?

Adhola: Ŋato nyalo bedo mere perin?
English: Could that person be your true friend?

Adhola: Be, kinyal.
English: No, he could not.

Adhola: Jehova mito ni waluwi gi go ayino, ma kiweno gi picha kosa chal, mongoye gi kwo.
English: Jehovah wants people to talk to him, not to a statue or a picture, which has no life

Adhola: Din matwodo fuonjo ni neko ji i lweny kobedo gimarach
English: False religion teaches that it is all right to kill others in time of war

Adhola: Yesu ofuonjo ni merin pa Were joripo marere
English: Jesus said that God’s friends would have love among themselves

Adhola: Wakinyal neko ji ma wamaro
English: We do not kill people we love

Adhola: Kada neko jomarecho obedo gimarach
English: It is even wrong for us to kill bad people

Adhola: Munyo jokwor pa Yesu jobino mako go, Yesu ochiero jofuonjirok pere lwenyo
English: When the enemies of Jesus came to arrest him, he did not let his disciples fight to protect him

Adhola: Din matwodo fuonjo ni Were waŋo ji i mach makitho
English: False religion teaches that the wicked will suffer in hellfire

Adhola: Kuchiel, Baibul fuonjo ni: "Kemba pa gimarach obedo tho
English: Yet, the Bible teaches that sin leads to death

Adhola: Jehova obedo Were majamar
English: Jehovah is a God of love

Adhola: Were majamar nyalo waŋo ji i mach makitho?
English: Would a loving God torment people forever?

Adhola: Be!
English: Of course not!

Adhola: Din achiel kende ma Jehova yeyere gine, ama bino bedo i piny manyien
English: In Paradise, there will be only one religion, the one that Jehovah approves

Adhola: Din moro jye ma fuonjo twodo pa Sitan ibino reyo woko
English: All religions based on Satan’s lies will be gone

Adhola: Nitie din acel kende mar’adieri? Neni gikipiny abic manyutho din mar’adieri
English: Is there only one true religion? Consider five identifying marks of true worship

Adhola: Ka dhano otho kwo pere rumo kichutho
English: Death is the opposite of life

Adhola: Tho chale gi nindo
English: Death is like a deep sleep

Adhola: Jomotho jokinyal winjo, neno, luwo, kosa paro
English: The dead are unable to hear, see, speak, or think anything

Adhola: Din matwodo fuonjo ni jomotho jolokere jwogi to jokidho bedo kanyachiel gi ji pajo ma chango jotho
English: False religion teaches that the dead go to a spirit world to live with their ancestors

Adhola: Baibul kifuonji ameno
English: That is not what the Bible teaches

Adhola: Jomotho jokinyal konyo wan, kendo jokinyal chando wan
English: Those who have died cannot help us, and they cannot harm us

Adhola: Ji jomaro chowere munyo joparo nike jonyalo kisangala jomotho
English: It is common for people to perform rituals and sacrifices that they believe will please those who have died

Adhola: Were kimiti ni wachowere rupiri meno obedo twodo pa Sitan
English: This is displeasing to God because it is based on one of Satan’s lies

Adhola: Aka jomotho jokinyal kisangala, rupiri jongoye gi kwo
English: It cannot please the dead either, since they are lifeless

Adhola: Wakiripi lworo kosa lamo jomotho
English: We should not fear or worship the dead

Adhola: Waripo lamo Were kende
English: We should worship only God

Adhola: Jomotho jobino chierino
English: The dead will live again

Adhola: Jehova bino chierino jomotho jowobedi i piny manyien
English: Jehovah will awaken the dead to life on a paradise earth

Adhola: Hongo no fuodi kotundo
English: That time is yet future

Adhola: Paka inyalo chewo dhano ma nindo, apaka Were bende nyalo chewo jomotho
English: God can awaken those who have died just as surely as you can awaken a person from sleep

Adhola: Fuonji ma nyutho ni wakitho kichutho wok bongi Sitan
English: The idea that we do not die is a lie spread by Satan the Devil

Adhola: Sitan kodi jwogi pere jomiyo ji paro nike chuny pa jomotho fuodi kwo aka ni kelo ri ji two kodi teko mopokere opokere
English: Satan and his demons make people think that spirits of the dead are alive and cause sickness and other problems

Adhola: Ruman Sitan wondo ji munyo luwo i lek kodi menyirok
English: Satan deceives people, at times through dreams and visions

Adhola: Jehova kimiti ni watem luwo kodi jomotho
English: Jehovah condemns those who try to talk to the dead

Adhola: Jom’otho jokwo?
English: What happens to us when we die?

Adhola: Jom’otho jonyalo kwo kendo?
English: Will we ever see our dead loved ones again?

Adhola: Sitan mito ni ithyedhi.
English: Satan wants you to practice magic.

Adhola: Joma thoth jochowere ri ji pajo ma chango jotho nike jowonyali geŋo kwo pajo kwoŋ teko.
English: Many make sacrifices to ancestors or spirits to protect themselves from harm.

Adhola: Jotimo ameno rupiri jolworo jomotho.
English: They do this because they fear the powers of the spirit world.

Adhola: Joruko aminda, tiko, kodi gagino.
English: They wear magical rings or bracelets.

Adhola: Jomadho kosa jowire gi yen munyo joparo ni gikipiny no nyalo geŋo jo kwoŋ jwogi.
English: They drink or rub on their bodies "medicines" that are supposed to have magical power.

Adhola: Joyiko gikipiny i lowo i pechin pajo munyo joparo nike gikipiny no nyalo kuro jo
English: In their homes or in the ground, some people hide articles believed to have protective powers.

Adhola: Jomegi jooro yen pa jothyeth rupiri joparo ni yen no nyalo konyo jo i miten pajo, kadho penji, kosa nywomo mon.
English: Others use magical "medicine" because they believe it will bring success in business, school exams, or courtship.

Adhola: Mako mere gi Jehova amanyalo kurin kwoŋ men pa Sitan.
English: Your best protection against Satan is to have Jehovah as your friend.

Adhola: Jehova kodi jomalaika pere jo ni gi men madit swa loyo Sitan gi jwogi pere.
English: Jehovah God and his angels are far more powerful than Satan and his demons.

Adhola: Jehova mito swa konyo merin pere ma jotimo gima go yenyo.
English: Jehovah is eager to show his strength in behalf of his friends who are completely loyal to him

Adhola: Wach pa Were chiero wan thyeth.
English: God’s Word says: "You must not practice magic."

Adhola: Jehova chiero thyeth gi yido rupiri kula no nyalo ketho dhano i men pa Sitan
English: Jehovah condemns magic and witchcraft because those practices can put one directly under the power of Satan the Devil

Adhola: Sitan ketho ji i karatem ma timo gimarach
English: Satan tempts people to do bad things

Adhola: Ŋata mito bedo mere pa Were kiripi timo gima Jehova dak
English: A person who wants to be God’s friend needs to hate what Jehovah hates

Adhola: Me a gikipiny ma merin pa Jehova jokiripi timo:
English: Here are some things that God’s friends avoid:

Adhola: Timo chot
English: Sexual sins

Adhola: Ikir’itim cot
English: You must not commit adultery

Adhola: Nindo gi dhano ma fuodi ikinywomere gine obedo gimarach
English: Having sex before marriage is also wrong

Adhola: Mero
English: Drunkenness

Adhola: Jomero jokodonji i Ker pa Were
English: Drunkards will not inherit God’s kingdom

Adhola: Nek kodi redho iyi jo
English: Murder, Abortion

Adhola: "Ikir’ineki
English: "You must not murder

Adhola: Kwo
English: Theft

Adhola: Ŋata yado kwalo wowey kwo
English: You must not steal

Adhola: Twodo
English: Lying

Adhola: Jehova dak jotwodo
English: Jehovah hates a false tongue

Adhola: Gorok kodi nge madit
English: Violence and Uncontrolled Anger

Adhola: Jatic pa Ruoth kiripi bedo jadhawirok
English: Anyone loving violence Jehovah certainly hates

Adhola: dhawirok
English: fits of anger

Adhola: Tuko ma pesa. "Wikiri wimakere gi dhano ma wor."
English: Gambling. "Quit mixing in company with anyone that is a greedy person."

Adhola: Dakirok gi dhano rupiri kobedo janono perin
English: Racial and Ethnic Hatreds

Adhola: Mari win jokwor mewin, odoko kway win ri joma timo riwin marac
English: Continue to love your enemies and to pray for those persecuting you

Adhola: Gikipiny ma Were wacho ri wan timo konyo wawegi
English: The things God tells us are for our good

Adhola: Kimar bedo mayot weyo timo gimarach
English: It is not always easy to avoid doing bad things

Adhola: Jehova kanyachiel gi Wajulizi pere, jonyalo konyin timo gikipiny ma sangala go
English: With Jehovah’s help and with the help of his Witnesses, you can avoid doing the things that displease God

Adhola: Yesu otito gimomiyo wamito rieko mawok bongi Were kodi cik ario madongo
English: Jesus explained why we need guidance and what two Biblical principles are of prime importance

Adhola: Ka ini gi mere perin m’imaro kendo m’iworo, itemo bedo paka go.
English: When you have a friend whom you admire and respect, you try to be like him.

Adhola: Baibul wacho ni: "Jehova ber kendo otire."
English: "Good and upright is Jehovah," says the Bible.

Adhola: Ka wamito bedo merin pa Were, waripo bedo jomabeyo kendo jomotire.
English: To be God’s friend, we must be good and upright.

Adhola: Baibul wacho ni: "Paka wibedo nyithindho pa Were ma kachunye, wiripo temo cale go.
English: The Bible says: "Become imitators of God, as beloved children, and go on walking in love."

Adhola: Inyalo nedi chale gi Were?
English: Here are some ways to do that:

Adhola: Kony ji
English: Be helpful to others

Adhola: Waripo timo bero ri dhano je
English: Let us work what is good toward all

Adhola: Timi tich gi men
English: Work hard

Adhola: "Ŋata yado kwalo woweyi kwo, kucel wocaki tic, wotimi tic mabeyo gi cinge
English: Let the stealer steal no more, but rather let him do hard work, doing with his hands what is good work

Adhola: Bedi dhano molony i del kodi i chunyin
English: Keep physically and morally clean

Adhola: Walonyi win kwoŋ gimoro je ma koco delkwoŋ wan, kosa cuny wan, aka warangi lokirok maleŋ ma kicutho, ka walworo Were i kwo mawan
English: Let us cleanse ourselves of every defilement of flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in God’s fear

Adhola: Mari kendo wori jopecho perin.
English: Treat your family members with love and respect.

Adhola: Jacwo je ripo maro cege paka won omare, aka dhako bende ripo miyo cwore dwoŋ.
English: Let each one of you love his wife as he does himself; on the other hand, the wife should have deep respect for her husband.

Adhola: Nyithindho, winji win jonywol mewin."
English: Children, be obedient to your parents."

Adhola: Mari ji
English: Show love to others

Adhola: Wamare win, rupiri mar wok bongi Were
English: Let us continue loving one another, because love is from God

Adhola: Winji chik ma piny mibed’iye
English: Obey the laws of the land

Adhola: Dhano je ripo winjo or pa rwodhe ma piny
English: Let every soul be in subjection to the government

Adhola: cul win gima wiripo culo dhano; cul misolo perin bongi ŋat’iripo culo
English: Render to all their dues, to him who calls for the tax, the tax

Adhola: Ka imito kuro mere, iripo luwo gi mere perin.
English: To keep a friend, you need to talk with him.

Adhola: Iwinjo gima go wacho rin, aka go bende winjo gima iwacho ri go.
English: You listen to him, and he listens to you.

Adhola: Kendo iluwo maber kwoŋ mere perin ka ilyesa gi joman.
English: You also say good things about your friend to others.

Adhola: Neni gima Baibul wacho kwoŋ gime:
English: Consider what the Bible says about this:

Adhola: Luwi gi Jehova kis ndelo munyo ikwayo
English: Talk to Jehovah regularly in prayer

Adhola: Kway win Were hongo je
English: Persevere in prayer

Adhola: Soma Wach pa Were, Baibul
English: Read God’s Word, the Bible

Adhola: Ndiko je Were am’omiyo meni, aka konyo swa ma fonjo adieri, kipusa komo, tiro podho, gi fonjo bedo gi kwo m’otire
English: All Scripture is inspired of God and beneficial for teaching, for reproving, for setting things straight

Adhola: Fuonji ji gima mako kwoŋ Were
English: Teach others about God

Adhola: Kidhi win wiloki nonin je jofonjirok paran
English: Go therefore and make disciples of people of all the nations

Adhola: wifonji jo mako or je m’amiyo win
English: teaching them to observe all the things I have commanded you

Adhola: Timi mere gi merin pa Were
English: Draw close to God’s friends

Adhola: Kitipa marac nyeko kite maber
English: He that is walking with wise persons will become wise

Adhola: Kidhi kachokirok pa Wajulizi pa Jehova milwoŋo ni Kingdom Hall
English: Attend meetings at the Kingdom Hall

Adhola: Weyi wapari win kwoŋ jowoti wan, munyo wakonyere i nyutho mar gi timo bero ri jowoti wan
English: Let us consider one another to incite to love and fine works,

Adhola: weyi wamiyere miseni
English: encouraging one another

Adhola: Thyeli tich ma mako kwoŋ Ker pa Were
English: Help support the Kingdom work

Adhola: Dhano je ripo miyo gimoro paka won oridho timo, m’ongoye kiŋunyaŋunya kosa paro ni orom aroma go timo; kole Were omaro ŋata miyo mic pere gi kisangala
English: Let each one give just as he has resolved in his heart, not grudgingly or under compulsion, for God loves a cheerful giver

Adhola: Nyutho mar ama ridho mere
English: Friendship is based on love

Adhola: Ka imedere fuonjirok gima mako kwoŋ Jehova, ibino medere maro go
English: The more you learn about Jehovah, the greater will be your love for him

Adhola: Ka imedere maro Jehova, ibino medere mito tiyo ri go
English: As your love for God grows, your desire to serve him will also grow

Adhola: Gime bino miyin mito bedo jafuonjirok pa Yesu Kristo
English: This will move you to become a disciple of Jesus Christ

Adhola: Ka iriwere kanyachiel gi Wajulizi pa Jehova, ibino bedo mere pa Were chil gi chil
English: By joining the happy family of Jehovah’s Witnesses, you can experience God’s friendship forever

Adhola: Ginaŋo miripo timo?
English: What must you do?

Adhola: Nyutho ni imaro Were, iripo winjo or pere.
English: You must show your love for God by obeying his laws.

Adhola: Me a dwoŋ maro Were: winjo or pere.
English: This is what the love of God means, that we observe his commandments.

Adhola: Aka or pere kitek riwan timo.
English: and yet his commandments are not burdensome.

Adhola: Kethi gikipiny mifuonjere i tim
English: Apply what you learn

Adhola: Yesu omiyo wan giranena maber ma nyalo konyo wan ketho gima wafuonjere i tim
English: Jesus told a story that illustrates this

Adhola: Dhano maryek ogeto ot pere wi tele
English: A wise man built his house on rock

Adhola: Dhano mamiŋ ogeto ot pere i kwoyo
English: A foolish man built his house on sand

Adhola: Munyo asur okudho, ot moget wi tele kopodho, to ot moget i kwoyo opodho podho matek swa
English: When a great storm came, the house built on rock did not cave in, but the house built on sand fell with a great crash

Adhola: Yesu owacho ni joma winjo fuonji pere to joketho i tim, jochale gi dhano maryek mogeto ot pere wi tele
English: Jesus said that those who hear his teachings and do them are like the wise man who built on rock

Adhola: To joma winjo fuonji pere to jokwero ketho i tim jochale gi dhano mamiŋ mogeto ot pere i kwoyo
English: But those who listen to his teachings and do not do them are like the foolish man who built on sand

Adhola: In imito chale gi dhano mene?
English: Which man do you want to be like

Adhola: Miyi Were kwo perin
English: Dedication

Adhola: Timo ameno nyutho ni ikwayo Jehova t’iwacho ri go ni imito timo gima go yenyo chil gi chil
English: This means that you go to Jehovah in prayer and tell him that you want to do his will forever

Adhola: Timo gima Were yenyo nyutho ni ijafuonjirok pa Yesu Kristo
English: Doing God’s will shows that you are a disciple of Jesus Christ

Adhola: Batisimo
English: Baptism

Adhola: Ay obatisa in, aka reco perin wolwoki woko munyo ilwoŋo nyingi go
English: Get baptized and wash your sins away by your calling upon his name

Adhola: Tiyi ri Were gi men perin jye
English: Become fully involved in serving God

Adhola: Gimoro je ma witimo, timi win gi cuny win acel, pa witiyo ri Rwoth, makiweno ri dhano
English: Whatever you are doing, work at it whole-souled as to Jehovah, and not to men

Adhola: Soma iŋeyi ka Were winjo kwayo je, paka waripo kwayo, kodi giman ma waripo timo nyalo corok cegin gi Were
English: Find out whether God listens to all prayers, how we should pray, and what else we can do to draw close to God

Adhola: Paka nwaŋo mere obedo gimatek, apaka kuro mere bende kiyot.
English: It takes effort to make a friend; it takes effort to keep a friend.

Adhola: Ka imako mere gi Were, ibino limo silwany.
English: Your efforts to become and remain a friend of God will be richly blessed.

Adhola: Yesu owacho ri joma joyeyo go ni: "Adieri no bino miyo wibedo i siem."
English: Jesus said to those who believed in him: "The truth will set you free."

Adhola: Gino nyutho aŋo?
English: What does that mean?

Adhola: Inyalo limo syem pama.
English: You can enjoy freedom now.

Adhola: Inyalo both fuonji matwodo ma Sitan onyayo.
English: You can be free from the false teachings and lies that have been spread by Satan.

Adhola: Ikobedi paka ji gana gi gana ma jongoye gi geno rupiri jokuya Jehova.
English: You can be free from the hopelessness that fills the lives of millions of people who do not know Jehovah.

Adhola: Kendo, merin pa Were jokilwor tho.
English: God’s friends are even free from the "fear of death."

Adhola: Ibino limo syem i piny manyien.
English: You can enjoy freedom in God’s new world.

Adhola: Ibino limo syem madit swa i piny manyien!
English: What marvelous freedom you can enjoy in the future!

Adhola: Piny manyien kobed’iye lweny, two, kodi turo chik.
English: In the Paradise earth, there will be freedom from war, sickness, and crime.

Adhola: Kir chandi bende kobed’iye.
English: Freedom from poverty and hunger.

Adhola: Ti kodi tho kobedi.
English: Freedom from old age and death.

Adhola: Lworo kodi chandirok moro jye kobedi i piny manyien.
English: Freedom from fear, oppression, and injustice.

Adhola: Baibul wacho ama kwoŋ Were: "Iyawo cingin t’iyeŋo mito pa kisi gima kwo je."
English: The Bible says of God: "You are opening your hand and satisfying the desire of every living thing."

Adhola: Merin pa Were jobino limo kwo makirum.
English: God’s friends will live forever.

Adhola: Were bino miyo merin pere mich ma kwo makirum
English: Everlasting life is a precious gift that God will give to all who seek his friendship.

Adhola: Par paka kwo makirum lebedo!
English: Just think of what endless life would mean for you!

Adhola: Ibino bedo gi hongo matimo gikipiny makweth.
English: You will have time to do many things

Adhola: Miti inyalo mito fuonjere goyo tongoli
English: Perhaps you would like to learn how to play a musical instrument

Adhola: Inyalo mito goyo pichin, kosa payo gikipiny.
English: Or maybe you want to learn to paint pictures or to be a carpenter

Adhola: Inyalo mito fuonjirok kwoŋ ogwange kosa yen,
English: You might like to learn about animals or plants

Adhola: kosa inyalo mito kidhoye i piny mopokere opokere kodi neno ji mopokere opokere.
English: Or possibly you want to travel and see different lands and peoples

Adhola: Ka inolimi kwo makirum ilenyalo timo gikipiny no jye!
English: Having everlasting life will make all these things possible!

Adhola: Ibino limo merin makweth
English: You will have time to make many friends.

Adhola: Kwo makirum bino miyin silwany ma ŋeyo merin pa Were makweth
English: Living forever will make it possible to get to know many others who have become God’s friends.

Adhola: Ibino ŋeyo tich ma jonyalo timo kodi kite pajo mabeyo
English: You will come to know their talents and fine qualities, and they will be your friends too.

Adhola: Ibino maro jo, aka jo bende jobino marin
English: You will love them, and they will love you.

Adhola: Kwo makirum bino miyin hongo ma timo mere kodi kis dhano m’obedi i piny ka!
English: Having endless life will give you the time to befriend everyone on earth!

Adhola: Medo kwoŋ meno, mere perin kodi Jehova bino medere
English: Best of all, your friendship with Jehovah will grow ever stronger as the centuries pass.

Adhola: Ri ameno, timi gimanyalere jye inyal bedo mere pa Were chil gi chil!
English: Do everything possible tobe God's friend

Adhola: Kitawo lakonyin ŋeyo nger m’inyalo bedo mere pa Were
English: This information is designed to help you find out how to be God's friend

Adhola: Were Mito Ni Ibedi Mere Pere
English: You can be God’s friend too.

Adhola: Go lakonyin limo kisangala i kwo
English: He will help you to be happy and secure

Adhola: Ginaŋo manyalo konyin ŋeyo gima go mito kodi gima go kimiti
English: That will help you to know what he likes and what he hates

Adhola: Go konyo wan ŋeyo gima go otimo cango con, gima go tima pama, kodi gima go latimo i hongo mabino
English: He has made it possible for us to know what he has done in the past, what he is doing now, and what he will do in the future

Adhola: Piny manyien k’obedi paka piny ma wan’iye pama
English: Paradise will not be like the world we live in now

Adhola: Piny manyien ochale nedi?
English: What will it be like?

Adhola: Aŋo manyutho?
English: How can we be sure?

Adhola: Gima Baibul waco ri wan kwoŋ mikula ma ndir pa Nowa fonjo wan aŋo?
English: What does the Bible account about Noah mean for us today?

Adhola: Inyalo ŋeyo jo to joweyo wondin
English: You can identify them and avoid being fooled

Adhola: Ginaŋo ma jomito nike ji jowofonjere kwoŋ Jehova?
English: And what do they want people to know about Jehovah?

Adhola: Nitye gikipiny m’opokere manyalo konyin nwaŋo din maradyeri
English: There are a number of things that can help you to identify it

Adhola: Inyalo ŋeyo nedi din matwodo? Raŋo din matwodo rac swa?
English: How can you recognize false religion? Why is it so bad?

Adhola: Baibul waco ri wan adyeri ma mako kwoŋ jomotho
English: The Bible does not leave us in any doubt

Adhola: Raŋo Were kimiti ni wathyedhi?
English: Why does God condemn them?

Adhola: Megi kwoŋ kula marecho ma Were kimiti a mene?
English: What are some of the practices that God hates?

Adhola: Megi kwoŋ gikipiny mabeyo ma wanyalo timo bedo mere pa Were a mene?
English: What are some of the good works that can help us to become his friends?

Adhola: Nyalo kuro mere perin, iripo luwo gi go, winjo gima go waco rin, gi luwo kwoŋ maber
English: To keep a friend, you have to talk to him, listen to him, and say good things about him to others

Adhola: Ameno bende apaka obedo kwoŋ Were
English: The same is true with being a friend of God

Adhola: K’imedere fonjirok gima mako kwoŋ Were, ilamedo maro go
English: The more you learn about Jehovah, the greater will be your love for him

Adhola: Were lamiyin silwany k’ibedo mere pere
English: Everlasting life is a precious gift that God will give to his friends

Adhola: Were Mito Ni Ibedi Mere Pere
English: God Invites You to Become His Friend

Adhola: Were a Mere Maloyo Merin Jye
English: God Is the Best Friend You Could Ever Have

Adhola: Ber Fonjere Gima Mako Kwoŋ Were
English: You Need to Learn About God

Adhola: Inyalo Fonjere Nedi Gima Mako Kwoŋ Were?
English: How You Can Learn About God

Adhola: Merin pa Were Jobino Bedo i Piny Manyien
English: God’s Friends Will Live in Paradise

Adhola: Piny Manyien Chiegin Tundo!
English: Paradise Is Near!

Adhola: Mikula ma Ndir pa Nowa Fuonjo Wan Aŋo?
English: A Warning From the Past

Adhola: Jokwor pa Were a Jomene?
English: Who Are God’s Enemies?

Adhola: Merin pa Were a Jomene?
English: Who Are God’s Friends?

Adhola: Inyalo Nwaŋo Nedi Din Maradyeri?
English: How to Find the True Religion

Adhola: Kweri Din Jye Matwodo!
English: Reject False Religion!

Adhola: Jomotho Jo Nikune?
English: What Happens at Death?

Adhola: Thyeth gi Yido Obedo Gimarach
English: Magic and Witchcraft Are Bad

Adhola: Merin pa Were Jokitimi Gimarach
English: God’s Friends Avoid What Is Bad

Adhola: Merin pa Were Jotimo Gimaber
English: God’s Friends Do What Is Good

Adhola: Nyuthi Ni Imaro Were
English: Show Your Love for God

Adhola: Ka Imito Kuro Mere, Iripo Bedo Dhano Majamere
English: To Keep a Friend, You Must Be a Friend

Adhola: Bedi Mere pa Were Chil gi Chil!
English: Be God’s Friend Forever!

Adhola: Wajulizi pa Jehova
English: Jehovah’s Witnesses

Adhola: Ŋatcondiko Baibul?
English: Who is the Author of the Bible?

Adhola: Aŋo manyutho ni Baibul obedo kitawo ma n’iye adieri?
English: How can we be sure the Bible is true?

Adhola: Baibul luwo kwoŋ aŋo?
English: What is the Bible about?

Adhola: Inyalo nedi niaŋ gi Baibul?
English: How can you understand the Bible?

Adhola: Kali itundi i gima n'iye
English: Skip to content

Adhola: Kali itundi i gikipiny man'iye
English: Skip to table of contents

Adhola: Imito kisoma gime i?
English: Would you like to read this article in?

Adhola: Baibul n’iye wac maber ma waco ni ji jolabedo i piny ka cil gi cil
English: The good news that people will live forever on earth is written in the Bible

Adhola: Baibul n’iye kitawin 66
English: The Bible is made up of 66 smaller books.

Adhola: Were ooro ji 40 ndiko kitawin no
English: God used about 40 faithful men to write them

Adhola: Musa am’ondiko kitawin abic mar’apena, oro 3,500 m’okadho
English: The first five books were written by Moses about 3,500 years ago.

Adhola: Jamoor Yohana am’ondiko kitawo macowe oro 1,900 m’okadho
English: The last book was written by the apostle John over 1,900 years ago.

Adhola: Joma jondiko Baibul jondiko paro pa ŋa?
English: Whose ideas did Bible writers present?

Adhola: Were om’owaco ri jo gikipiny ma jondiko munyo oro cuny maleŋ
English: God communicated with the Bible writers by means of his holy spirit.

Adhola: (2 Samwiri 23:2) Wac ma jondiko obedo apa Were ma kiweno apa jo
English: (2 Samuel 23:2) They wrote down the thoughts of God, not their own thoughts.

Adhola: Ri ameno, Baibul obedo wac pa Jehova
English: So Jehovah is the Author of the Bible.

Adhola: Neni vidiyo Ŋat’ondiko Baibul?
English: Watch the video Who Is the Author of the Bible?

Adhola: Chwaki ri wan, media player okwero.
English: Sorry, the media player failed to load.

Adhola: Baibul obedo wac pa Were rupiri kis gima Baibul waco tundo i kare.
English: We know that the Bible is from God because it accurately foretells the future in detail.

Adhola: Ongoye dhano manyalo timo ameno.
English: No man can do that.

Adhola: (Yosuwa 23:14) Were Majameni Je kende, amanyalo ŋeyo gim’otimere i hongo mabino.
English: (Joshua 23:14) Only Almighty God can accurately foresee mankind’s future

Adhola: Kitawo mawok bongi were ripo bedo ni opokere kwoŋ kitawin megi, aka iy’adieri Baibuli obedo kitawo m’opokere swa.
English: We would expect a book from God to be unique, and it is.

Adhola: Otieki wodho Baibul mathoth swa i dhudhok makweth.
English: Billions of copies of the Bible have been distributed in hundreds of languages.

Adhola: Kada nende Baibul obedo kitawo m’ondiki cango con, makere gi sayans.
English: Though ancient, the Bible is in harmony with proved science.

Adhola: Aka gikipiny ma ji 40 jondiko i Baibul makere pa gini dhano acel am’ondiko.
English: Also, its 40 writers did not contradict one another.

Adhola: Medo kwoŋ meno, Baibul konyo wan ŋeyo mar pa Were, aka Baibul nigi meni manyalo wiro kwo pa dhano tobedo maber.
English: Furthermore, the Bible bears the unmistakable stamp of God’s love, and it still has the power to change people’s lives for the better.

Adhola: Gikipinyi no je miyo ji ridho ni Baibul obedo Wac pa Were, soma 1 Jothesalonika 2:13.
English: These facts convince millions that the Bible is God’s Word, read 1 Thessalonians 2:13.

Adhola: Neni vidiyo Aŋo Manyutho Ni Gima Nitie i Baibul Obedo Adieri?
English: Watch the video How Can We Be Sure the Bible Is True?

Adhola: Megi kwoŋ gikipiny maber ma Baibul waco ri wan a gikipiny maber ma Were cegin timo ri ji.
English: The Bible centers on the good news that God has a loving purpose for mankind.

Adhola: Baibuli waco ri wan paka cango ji jokeŋ silwany ma bedo i piny maŋon, aka odoko to waco ri wan nger ma Were bino loko piny me kabedo maŋon
English: The Scriptures explain how man’s privilege of living on a paradise earth was lost early in human history and how a paradise will finally be restored

Adhola: Kendo Wac pa Were n’iye cik, fonji, kodi rieko manyalo konyo wan.
English: God’s Word also contains laws, principles, and advice.

Adhola: Baibul waco ri wan paka cango Were otiyere gi ji.
English: In addition, the Bible records the history of God’s dealings with mankind

Adhola: Ri ameno, Baibul nyalo konyo wan ŋeyo kite pa Were maber.
English: Thus, the Bible can help you to know God.

Adhola: Kendo Baibul nyutho wan paka wanyalo bedo merin pa Were.
English: It explains how you can become his friend.

Adhola: Kitawo me lakonyin Walaoro nger ma Yesu cango ooro munyo fonjo ji.
English: This brochure will help you to understand the Bible by using the same method that Jesus used.

Adhola: Yesu osoma ri ji ndiiko maleŋ, to "tito ri jo gima ndiiko no waco.
English: He referred to one Bible text after another and explained "the meaning of the Scriptures.

Adhola: Ongoye gimaber loyo wac maber mawok bongi Were.
English: Few things are as fascinating as the good news from God.

Adhola: Kada ameno, nitie joma jokimiti kada winjo wac no, aka joman wac no miyo jo nge.
English: Yet, some people are indifferent to it, and others are even annoyed by it.

Adhola: To in medere fonjirok wac maber.
English: Nevertheless, continue learning the good news

Adhola: K’imito limo kwo makirum, iripo ŋeyo Were.
English: Your hope of enjoying everlasting life depends on your getting to know God.

Adhola: Kwo pa Yesu ocako nedi?
English: How did Jesus’ life begin?

Adhola: Raŋo Yesu obino i piny?
English: Why did Jesus come to the earth?

Adhola: Raŋo cul oyido mitere?
English: Why do we need a ransom?

Adhola: Raŋo Yesu otho?
English: Why did Jesus die?

Adhola: Yesu timo aŋo pama?
English: What is Jesus doing now?

Adhola: Aŋo m’omiyo Yesu obedo dhano mayot tiyirok gine?
English: What qualities made Jesus approachable?

Adhola: Yesu kutho obedo i polo paka malaika munyo fodi k’onywol go i piny ka.
English: Jesus lived in heaven as a spirit person before he was born on earth.

Adhola: Go am’obedo cwec pa Were m’otelo, aka okonyo Were gi cweyo gikipiny megi je.
English: He was God’s first creation, and he helped in the creation of all other things.

Adhola: Go kende ama Jehova won ocweyo am’omiyo ilwoŋo go ni "Wod Were acel kende.
English: He is the only one created directly by Jehovah and is therefore appropriately called God’s "only-begotten Son.

Adhola: Kendo Yesu obedo jaluwo pa Were am’omiyo ilwoŋo go ni "Wac.
English: Jesus served as God’s Spokesman, so he is also called "the Word.

Adhola: Were odhiro Wode i piny ka munyo ketho kwo pere i iyi nyako m’ilwoŋo ni Maria m’oyido fodi k’obedoye gi jacwo.
English: God sent his Son to earth by transferring his life from heaven to the womb of a virgin Jewess named Mary.

Adhola: Am’omiyo Yesu k’odedo gi bamere i piny ka.
English: So Jesus did not have a human father.

Adhola: Yesu obino i piny (1)Â fonjo wan adieri ma mako kwoŋ Were, (2)Â nyutho wan ranena i nger ma timo gima Were mito kada ka wan’iteko, kodi (3)Â miyo kwo pere paka "cul.
English: Jesus came to the earth (1)Â to teach the truth about God, (2)Â to set us an example in how to do God’s will even when we are in difficulties, and (3)Â to give his perfect life as "a ransom.

Adhola: Cul obedo welo m’iculo botho dhano tho.
English: A ransom is the price paid to release a person from the threat of death.

Adhola: (Wok 21:29, 30) K’obedo atoŋa pa Were ji ti kosa tho.
English: (Exodus 21:29, 30) Death and old age were not part of God’s original purpose for mankind.

Adhola: Raŋo wawaco ameno?
English: How do we know that?

Adhola: Were cango owaco ri dhano m’otelo, Adam, ni k’otimo gimarac, go d’otho.
English: God told the first man, Adam, that if he committed what the Bible calls "sin, he would die.

Adhola: Meno nyutho ni bedi Adam k’otimo gimarac dinyo go fodi kwo kir konon.
English: So if Adam had not sinned, he would never have died.

Adhola: Baibul waco ni tho obino i piny luwo kwoŋ Adam.
English: According to the Bible, death "entered the world of mankind through Adam.

Adhola: Ri ameno, Adam am’okelo ri nyikwaye je gimarac kodi tho.
English: Thus, Adam passed on  to all his descendants sin and its penalty, death.

Adhola: Cul mitere nyaka wabothi tho ma walunjo wok kwoŋ Adam.
English: We need a ransom to release us from the penalty of death that we inherited from Adam.

Adhola: Oyido ŋa manyalo culo ri wan cul no to botho wan tho?
English: Who could pay the ransom to free us from death?

Adhola: Ka watho waculo reco mawan kende.
English: When we die, we pay the penalty only for our own sins.

Adhola: Ongoye dhano manyalo culo reco pa joman rupiri ji je joni gi reco.
English: No imperfect man can pay for the sins of others.

Adhola: Pokirok kwoŋ wan, Yesu oyido ongoye gi reco.
English: Unlike us, Jesus was perfect.

Adhola: Ri ameno, go oyido kiripere tho rupiri ongoye gimoro je marac ma go otimo.
English: So he did not need to die for his sins, he never committed any.

Adhola: Yesu otho ri reco pa joman.
English: Instead, Jesus died for the sins of others.

Adhola: Were onyutho wan mar munyo odhiro Wode tho ri wan.
English: God expressed extraordinary love for mankind by sending his Son to die for us.

Adhola: Yesu bende onyutho wan mar munyo owinjo Bamere toyeyo tho ri reco mawan.
English: Jesus also showed love for us by obeying his Father and giving his life for our sins.

Adhola: Neni vidiyo Raŋo Yesu Otho?
English: Watch the video Why Did Jesus Die?

Adhola: Munyo Yesu fodi nitie i piny ka, go obotho jotwo, ocerino jom’otho, kendo okonyo ji m’oyido joni gi teko m’opokere opokere.
English: When on earth, Jesus cured the sick, raised the dead, and rescued people in peril.

Adhola: Ameno Yesu onyutho gikipiny ma go latimo i hongo mabino, ri joma timo gima Were mito.
English: He thereby demonstrated what he will do in the future for all obedient mankind.

Adhola: Munyo Yesu otho, Were ocerino go i kwo ma cuny.
English: After Jesus died, God restored him to life as a spirit person.

Adhola: (1 Petero 3:18) Rumacen, Yesu ogiki i polo to bedo yu cingi Were maracuc to kuro Were miyo go dhum ma piny gipi.
English: (1 Peter 3:18) Jesus then waited at God’s right hand until Jehovah gave him power to rule as King over all the earth.

Adhola: (Joebulaniya 10:12, 13) Pama Yesu dhumo paka Kere i polo, aka jofonjirok pere jofonjo ji wac maber me i piny gipi.
English: (Hebrews 10:12,13) Now Jesus is ruling as King in heaven, and his followers are announcing that good news worldwide.

Adhola: Yesu cegin oro meni pere paka Kere wokwany woko candirok je kodi jono majokelo ri wadi gin candirok.
English: Soon, Jesus will use his power as King to bring an end to all suffering and to those who cause it.

Adhola: Jono je majoketho yeyo pajo i Yesu to jotimo gima go mito jobino limo kwo makirum i piny
English: All who exercise faith in Jesus by obeying him will enjoy life in a paradise on earth

Adhola: Raŋo Were ocweyo piny?
English: Why did God create the earth?

Adhola: Raŋo pama piny k’obedo paka cango Were omito ni wobedi?
English: Why is the earth not a paradise now?

Adhola: Were oloki nedi piny me kabedo maber?
English: How will Paradise be restored?

Adhola: Candirok orumi keraŋo?
English: When will suffering end?

Adhola: Jomene ma jolabedo i piny manyen?
English: Who will live in the future Paradise?

Adhola: Jehova ocweyo piny me t’omiyo ji.
English: Jehovah gave the earth to men and women.

Adhola: Me a peco mawan.
English: It is our home.

Adhola: Ri ameno, ji ario ma Were otelo cweyo, Adam gi Eva, k’ocwey jo bedo i polo.
English: Therefore, the first human couple, Adam and Eve, were not created to populate the heavens

Adhola: Were oyido otieko cweyo jomalaika bedo i polo.
English: God had already created angels to live in heaven.

Adhola: Munyo Were otieko cweyo Adam, dhano m’otelo, oketho go i ndelo ma Eden.
English: Rather, God took the first man and settled him in a delightful paradise called the garden of Eden.

Adhola: Jehova omito ni Adam kodi nyithindho pere jowobedi i piny ka cil gi cil.
English: Jehovah gave him and his future offspring the prospect of enjoying life without end on earth.

Adhola: I cakirok, ndelo ma Eden kende ama oyido kabedo maŋon.
English: Originally, only the garden of Eden was a paradise.

Adhola: Adam kodi Eva oyido joripo nywolo nyithindho ji jowopoŋi piny gipi.
English: The first human couple were to fill the earth with their offspring.

Adhola: Rumacen, piny gipi d’olokere kabedo maŋon.
English: In time, they were to subdue the entire globe and make it a paradise.

Adhola: Were kilareyo woko piny.
English: The earth will never be destroyed.

Adhola: Piny lamedere bed’iye ji.
English: It will always be mankind’s home.

Adhola: Adam gi Eva jocayo Were to jotimo gimarac to Were riemo jo i Eden.
English: Adam and Eve disobeyed God, so Jehovah put them out of the garden.

Adhola: Jokeŋ piny maŋon ma Were oyido omiyo jo, aka ongoye dhano moro je manyalo yiko piny me.
English: Paradise was lost, and no man has succeeded in restoring it.

Adhola: Baibul waco ni: "Were otieko miyo piny i cingi jokidakana.
English: The Bible says: "The earth has been handed over to the wicked.

Adhola: Onyo wawaci ni atoŋa ma Jehova oyido ni gine ri ji odhiero go?
English: Has Jehovah abandoned his original purpose for mankind?

Adhola: Be, Rupiri go obedo Were Majameni Je, ongoye gima nyalo dhiero go.
English: No, He is almighty, He cannot fail.

Adhola: Were bino loko piny me kabedo maber ri ji, paka atoŋa pere obedo wok i cakirok.
English: He will restore the human race to the way he meant it to be

Adhola: Ka Yesu ocako dhumo piny, odoko piny lalokere kabedo maber.
English: Paradise will be restored on earth during Jesus’ rule as God’s King.

Adhola: I lweny m’ilwoŋo ni Amagedon, Yesu bino telo jomalaika pa Were joworeyi woko ji je ma jokwero timo gima  Were mito.
English: In a battle called Armageddon, Jesus will lead  God’s angels and destroy all who oppose God.

Adhola: Rumacen, Yesu latweyo Sitan oro 1,000.
English: Then Jesus will imprison Satan for 1,000 years.

Adhola: Ji pa Were jolaboth rupiri Yesu lakuro jo.
English: God’s people will survive the destruction because Jesus will guide and protect them.

Adhola: Jolalimo kwo makirum i piny manyen.
English: They will enjoy everlasting life in Paradise on earth.

Adhola: Were okwany woko keraŋo gikipiny mareco i piny?
English: When will God bring an end to evil on earth?

Adhola: Yesu omiyo wan ranyuth makonyo wan ŋeyo ni gik piny cegin tundo.
English: Jesus gave a "sign to indicate when the end would be near.

Adhola: Gikipiny mareco matimere i piny pama kelo ri ji candirok madit swa.
English: Present world conditions threaten man’s survival

Adhola: Kuceli, gikipiny no nyutho ni gik piny cegin tundo.
English: Present world conditions show that we now live in "the conclusion of the system of things.

Adhola: I hongo ma oro 1,000 ma Yesu ladhum’iye piny, go lakwanyo woko candirok je i piny.
English: During Jesus’ 1,000-year rule from heaven over the earth, he will bring all suffering to an end.

Adhola: Medo kwoŋ meno, Yesu bino tiyo paka jacwayi ri Were i wi migam aka lacwako reco pa ji je ma jotimo gima Were mito.
English: Besides serving as King, Jesus will act as High Priest and will cancel the sins of those who love God.

Adhola: Ameno Were bino oro Yesu kwanyo woko two, ti, kodi tho
English: Thus, by means of Jesus, God will eliminate sickness, aging, and death.

Adhola: K’ibino i Kingdom Hall, ilanwaŋo ji ma jomaro Were sano jofonjere nger ma jonyalo timo gima Were mito
English: At the Kingdom Hall, you will meet people who love God and want to learn how to please him

Adhola: Joma timo gima Were mito ama jolabedo i piny manyen.
English: People who obey God will live in Paradise.

Adhola: Yesu odhiro jofonjirok pere dwaro jomamwol jowofonji jo gikipiny ma Were mito.
English: Jesus sent his followers to search for meek people and to teach them how to become acceptable to God.

Adhola: Pama Jehova dwaro ji ma jolabedo i piny manyen.
English: Today, Jehovah is preparing millions of people for life in the future Paradise on earth.

Adhola: I Kingdom Hall, kama Wajulizi pa Jehova jorom’iye lamo Were, ji jofonjere nger ma jonyalo bedo cwo gi mon maber.
English: At Kingdom Halls of Jehovah’s Witnesses, people learn to be better husbands and fathers and to be better wives and mothers.

Adhola: Nyithindho gi jonywol pajo jolamo Were kanyacel kendo jofonjere nger ma Baibul nyalo konyo jo i kwo.
English: Children and parents worship together and learn how to benefit from the good news.

Adhola: Wac maber ma mako kwoŋ jom’otho a mene?
English: What is the good news about the dead?

Adhola: Ginaŋo matundo kwoŋ dhano k’otho?
English: What is the condition of the dead?

Adhola: Jom’otho jonyalo luwo kodi wan?
English: Can the dead speak to us?

Adhola: Jomene ma jolacerino?
English: Who will return to life?

Adhola: Cerino fonjo wan aŋo kwoŋ Jehova?
English: What does the resurrection tell us about Jehovah?

Adhola: Munyo Yesu otundo Bethania cegin gi Yerusalem, onwaŋo mere pere m’ilwoŋo ni Lazaro otho aka oyido nyaka ocowo ndelo aŋwen i kalyel.
English: When Jesus arrived at Bethany near Jerusalem, his friend Lazarus had been dead for four days.

Adhola: Yesu okidho dho kalyel gi Marita kodi Maria, nyimin Lazaro
English: Jesus went to the burial place with Martha and Mary, sisters of the deceased man.

Adhola: I hongo macek, ji jocokere.
English: Soon, a crowd gathered.

Adhola: Iparo ni Marita gi Maria jowinjo nedi munyo Yesu ocerino Lazaro?
English: Can you imagine the joy of Martha and Mary when Jesus raised Lazarus back to life?

Adhola: Marita oyido oŋeyo wac maber ma mako kwoŋ jom’otho.
English: Martha was already aware of the good news about the dead.

Adhola: Go oyido oŋeyo ni Jehova bino cerino jom’otho kendo jowobedi i piny ka.
English: She knew that Jehovah will resurrect the dead to live on earth again

Adhola: Were owaco ri Adam ni: "Ocweyin wok i lowo, aka doko ibino lokere lowo.
English: God told Adam: "Dust you are and to dust you will return."

Adhola: Were ooro lowo munyo cweyo dhano.
English: Humans are made from dust.

Adhola: Wakibedo cuny m’oruko del, aka ka watho ongoye gima both.
English: We are not spirits living in a body of flesh,  so no part of us survives death.

Adhola: Ka watho nyaŋith wan bende tho, odoko wakinyali paro.
English: When we die, our brain dies too, and our thoughts perish.

Adhola: Am’omiyo Lazaro k’owaco gimoro kada aciel m’otimere i hongo ma go ocowo munyo otho, rupiri ongoye gima jom’otho joŋeyo.
English: Thus, Lazarus said nothing about his experience of death because the dead are unconscious."

Adhola: Were waŋo ji i mac makitho?
English: Does God torment people with fire after death?

Adhola: Be, rupiri Baibul fonjo ni ongoye gima jom’otho joŋeyo, fonji ma mac makitho obedo fonji matwodo mamiyo ji kipusa Were ru gima go kitimi.
English: Since the Bible shows that the dead are unconscious, hellfire is clearly a false teaching that slanders God.

Adhola: Jehova obedo Were majamar, go kinyal cando ji ameno.
English: The very idea of tormenting people with fire disgusts him

Adhola: Neni vidiyo Jom’otho Jonyalo Kwo Kendo?	Watch the video What Is the Condition of the Dead?
Jom’otho jokinyali luwo kosa winjo.
English: The dead can neither speak nor hear.

Adhola: To nitie jomalaika mareco ma joluwo gi ji to jorendere ni a jom’otho.
English: But some angels are wicked, and they may speak to people and pretend to be dead humans

Adhola: Jehova kimiti ni watem luwo kodi jom’otho
English: Jehovah forbids trying to inquire of the dead.

Adhola: Ji mathoth ma jotho jolacerino odoko jowobedi i piny ka.
English: Many millions of people who are dead in the grave will return to life on earth.

Adhola: Joman ma cango jotimo gikipiny mareco rupiri oyido fodi jokoŋeyo Were, bende jolacerino.
English: Even some who did not know God and who practiced bad things will be resurrected

Adhola: Joma jolacerino jolafonjere adieri ma mako kwoŋ Were, jowonyali ketho yeyo pajo i Yesu, kodi timo gikipiny ma go mito.
English: Resurrected ones will be able to learn the truth about God and to exercise faith in Jesus by obeying him.

Adhola: Jono ma jolacerino to jotimo gima Were mito jolabedo i piny ka cil gi cil
English: Those who return to life and do good things will be able to enjoy life forever on earth.

Adhola: Wani gi geno ni jom’otho jolacerino rupiri Were odhiro Wode to tho ri wan.
English: God made hope for the dead possible by sending his Son to die for us.

Adhola: Ri ameno, cerino fonjo wan ni Jehova omaro wan swa kendo go nigi wor.
English: So the resurrection tells us about Jehovah’s love and undeserved kindness.

Adhola: Ka jom’otho jocerino, ŋa m’imito neno?
English: When the dead return to life, whom do you especially want to see?

Adhola: Ker pa Were a ginaŋo?
English: What is God’s Kingdom?

Adhola: Raŋo Yesu ama ripere bedo Kere?
English: Why is Jesus the ideal King?

Adhola: Jomene ma joladhumo gi Yesu?
English: Who will rule with Jesus?

Adhola: Ginaŋo m’otimere munyo nyaka Yesu ocako dhumo?
English: What happened when Jesus began ruling?

Adhola: Ker pa Were timo aŋo pama?
English: What does God’s Kingdom accomplish?

Adhola: Raŋo Yesu ama ripere bedo kere?
English: What makes Jesus an ideal King?

Adhola: Ker pa Were obedo dhum ma polo.
English: The Kingdom of God is a heavenly government.

Adhola: Bino kwanyo woko dhum pa ji je, aka lemiyo gima Were mito w’otimere i polo kodi i piny.
English: It will replace all other governments and will cause God’s will to be done in heaven and on earth.

Adhola: Wac ma mako kwoŋ Ker pa Were obedo wac maber swa
English: The news about God’s Kingdom is good.

Adhola: Ker pa Were cegin bino wocaki dhumo ji i nger maber.
English: Soon God’s Kingdom will satisfy man’s need for good government.

Adhola: Ker pa Were lariwo ji je ma jolabedo i piny ka.
English: It will unite everyone living on earth

Adhola: Ker moro je ripo bedo gi kere.
English: A kingdom must have a king.

Adhola: Yesu Kristo ama Jehova oyero bedo Kere ma Ker pere
English: Jehovah appointed his Son, Jesus Christ, to be King of His Kingdom.

Adhola: Wod Were ama ripere bedo Kere rupiri go nigi wor aka timo gim’otire hongo je.
English: God’s Son is the ideal King because he is kind and he is firm for what is right

Adhola: Aka Yesu ni gi meni kendo nyalo konyo ji rupiri go bino dhumo g’ipolo.
English: Also, he is powerful enough to help people because he will rule over the earth from heaven.

Adhola: Munyo ocerino, go ogiki i polo to bedo yu cingi Were maracuc to kuro Were miyo go dhum.
English: After he was resurrected, he ascended to heaven and sat down to wait at Jehovah’s right hand.

Adhola: Rumacen, Were omiyo go dhum to cako dhumo.
English: Finally, God gave him power to begin ruling.

Adhola: Nitie kitipa pa ji ma Baibul lwoŋo ni "jomaleŋ ma joladhumo gi Yesu i polo.
English: A group called "the holy ones will rule with Jesus in heaven.

Adhola: Jehova ocako cango con yero jono.
English: The first holy ones chosen were Jesus’ faithful apostles.

Adhola: Go otelo kodi jomoor pa Yesu. Kir konon, Jehova fodi yero cwo gi mon ma joladhumo gi Yesu.
English: Jehovah has continued to select faithful men and women as holy ones until now.

Adhola: Jono jocerino gi del manyacuny, paka Yesu ocerino.
English: Like Jesus, they are resurrected with a spiritual body.

Adhola: Joma jolakadho i polo jolabedo ji adi?
English: How many people go to heaven?

Adhola: Yesu olwoŋo jo ni "nyaka rombo"
English: Jesus called them a "little flock. "

Adhola: (Luka 12:32) Jolabedo ji 144,000.
English: (Luke 12:32) They will finally number 144,000.

Adhola: Jono kende ama jolakadho i polo to jodhumo piny kanyacel gi Yesu.
English: They will rule over the earth with Jesus

Adhola: Ker pa Were ocako dhumo i oro ma 1914.
English: God’s Kingdom began ruling in 1914.

Adhola: Gima Yesu otelo timo munyo nyaka cako dhumo, a bolo Sitan kodi jwogi pere i piny.
English: Jesus’ first action as King was to throw Satan and his demons down to the earth.

Adhola: Gino omiyo Sitan nge tocako kelo ri ji teko i piny gipi.
English: Satan became furious and began causing trouble throughout the earth.

Adhola: Wok i hongo no, teko omedere swa i piny.
English: Since then, mankind’s woes have severely increased.

Adhola: Lweny, kec, two, kodi yengirok pa piny, am’obedo megi kwoŋ gikipiny manyutho ni Ker pa Were cegin cako dhumo piny
English: Wars, famines, epidemics, and earthquakes are all part of a "sign that the Kingdom will soon take full charge of earth’s affairs."

Adhola: Luwo i tic ma fonjo ji Baibul ma pama timere i piny gipi, Ker pa Were riwo ji mathoth.
English: By means of a global preaching work, God’s Kingdom is already uniting a great crowd of people from all nations

Adhola: Pama ji mathoth joyeyo dhum pa Yesu.
English: Millions of meek people are becoming subjects of Jesus.

Adhola: Ker pa Were lakuro jo k’obino reyo woko piny pa Sitan marac me.
English: God’s Kingdom will protect them when it destroys the present wicked system of things on earth.

Adhola: Ri ameno, ji je ma jomito limo silwany ma Ker pa Were lakelo i piny, joripo yeyo Yesu.
English: So all who want to benefit from God’s Kingdom should learn to be obedient subjects of Jesus.

Adhola: I hongo ma oro 1,000, Ker pa Were latimo gikipiny je ma Were ocano timo ri ji wok i cakirok.
English: During a period of 1,000 years, the Kingdom will accomplish God’s original purpose for mankind.

Adhola: Piny gipi bino lokere kabedo maŋon.
English: The earth will become a global paradise.

Adhola: Rumacen, Yesu ladwoko dhum bongi Bamere.
English: Finally, Jesus will hand the Kingdom back to his Father

Adhola: Nitie dhano moro je m’inyalo wacoye ri go wac maber me ma mako kwoŋ Ker pa Were?
English: Do you know someone whom you would like to tell about God’s Kingdom?

Adhola: K’imito ŋeyo maloyo kwoŋ oro ma 1914, soma papila 217-220, ma kitawo m’ilwoŋo ni What Can the Bible Teach Us?
English: For details of how Bible prophecy foretold the year 1914, see pages 215-218 of the book What Does the Bible Really Teach?

Adhola: Raŋo nywomirok i cik kelo kisangala i peco?
English: Why is marriage vital to family happiness?

Adhola: Jacwo kodi cege joripo tiyere nedi?
English: How should a husband and a wife treat each other?

Adhola: Wiripere pokirok ka nywomirok mewin ongoy’iye kisangala?
English: Should you abandon an unhappy marriage?

Adhola: Nyithindho, aŋo ma Were mito ri win?
English: Children, what does God want for you?

Adhola: Jonywol, winyalo konyo nedi nyithindho mewin limo kisangala?
English: Parents, how can your children find happiness?

Adhola: Gikipiny mareco ocako nedi?
English: How did evil begin?

Adhola: Cwec pa Were oyido k’otire?
English: Was God’s creation defective?

Adhola: Raŋo Were oweyo candirok bedo tundo pama?
English: Why has God allowed suffering until now?

Adhola: Silwany mene ma wanigine rupiri Were fodi odiyo cunye?
English: What does God’s patience allow us to do?

Adhola: Wanyalo nyutho nedi ni wamito dhum pa Were?
English: How can we choose God as our Ruler?

Adhola: Din mar’adieri nitie acel kende?
English: Is there only one true religion?

Adhola: Yesu owaco aŋo kwoŋ Jokristo ma twodo?
English: What did Jesus say about false Christians?

Adhola: Inyalo ŋeyo nedi din mar’adieri?
English: How can you recognize true worshippers?

Adhola: Onyo pama inyalo ŋeyo din mar’adieri?
English: Can you identify the true religion?

Adhola: Raŋo Were otimo maber miyo wan cik?
English: Why do we need guidance?

Adhola: Rieko ma Were miyo wan konyo wan nedi?
English: What are Bible principles?

Adhola: Cik ario maloyo man je a mene?
English: Which two principles are primary?

Adhola: Cik pa Were konyo wan nedi?
English: How do Bible principles benefit us?

Adhola: Were winjo kwayo je?
English: Does God listen to all prayers?

Adhola: Waripo kwayo nedi?
English: How should we pray?

Adhola: Raŋo Jokristo joromo kanyacel?
English: Why do Christians meet together?

Adhola: Inyalo nedi core cegin gi Were?
English: How can you draw close to God?

Adhola: Bero aŋo m’ilalimo k’icore cegin gi Were?
English: How will drawing close to God benefit you?

Adhola: Din je ber?
English: Is all religion good?

Adhola: Ginaŋo ma latundu kwoŋ din?
English: What is the good news about religion?

Adhola: Ginaŋo ma jomaber no joripo timo?
English: What should sincere people do?

Adhola: Were okeli nedi kisangala i piny gipi?
English: How will God bring joy to every land?

Adhola: Raŋo cango Were oyero Joisiraili bedo ji pere?
English: Why did God organize ancient Israel?

Adhola: Raŋo Jokristo mar’adieri joripo bedo i kitipa acel?
English: Why are true Christians organized?

Adhola: Din pa Wajulizi pa Jehova manitie konon ocako nedi?
English: How did the modern-day organization of Jehovah’s Witnesses begin?

Adhola: Wajulizi pa Jehova jolimo nedi teli?
English: How are Jehovah’s Witnesses organized?

Adhola: Bero aŋo m’ilalimo k’imedere fonjirok Baibul?
English: How will continuing your Bible study benefit you?

Adhola: Inyalo konyo nedi joman?
English: How could your knowledge of God benefit others?

Adhola: Bero aŋo m’ilalimo?
English: What relationship with God can you enjoy?

Adhola: Inomedere nedi dongo?
English: How can you continue to progress?

Adhola: Hongo ma Were oweyo ji dhumo, nyutho kamaler ni ji jokinyal cowo teko manitie i piny
English: God has allowed men to rule for long enough to demonstrate that they cannot resolve mankind’s problems

Adhola: Gikipiny mareco ocako i piny munyo Sitan oluwo twodo mar’apena
English: Evil began on earth when Satan told the first lie

Adhola: I cakirok Sitan obedo malaika maber, to rumacen olokere malaika marac rupiri go "k’obedo yuthenge mar’adieri
English: Satan was originally a perfect angel, but "he did not stand fast in the truth

Adhola: Go omito ni ji jowolami go ayin aka sano Were kende ama waripo lamo
English: He developed a desire for worship that rightly belongs only to God

Adhola: Gim’owok’iye, Sitan owondo Eva to kelo rigo cayo Were
English: Satan lied to the first woman, Eve, and persuaded her to obey him instead of God

Adhola: Adam bende oriwere gi Eva to joturo cik pa Were
English: Adam joined Eve in disobeying God

Adhola: Gima Adam otimo owok’iye candirok kodi tho
English: Adam’s decision led to suffering and death

Adhola: Munyo Sitan okelo ri Eva turo cik pa Were, meno amo’bedo cakirok ma piemo gi dhum pa Were
English: When Satan suggested that Eve disobey God, he was starting a rebellion against God’s sovereignty, or position as Most High

Adhola: Ji mathoth jomakere gi Sitan aka jokwero Were bedo jadhum pajo
English: The majority of mankind have joined Satan in rejecting God as their Ruler

Adhola: Am’omiyo Baibul waco ni pama Sitan am’obedo "jadhum ma piny me
English: Thus, Satan has become "the ruler of the world

Adhola: Kis gima Were ocweyo k’obedo gi teko moro je.
English: All of God’s works are perfect.

Adhola: Ji kodi jomalaika ma Were ocweyo oyido jonyalo winjo go.
English: The humans and angels whom God created were capable of obeying God perfectly.

Adhola: Were omiyo wan thwolo ma timo gimaber kosa gimarac.
English: God created us with the freedom to choose between doing good and doing evil.

Adhola: Thwolo no miyo wan silwany ma nyutho ni wamaro Were
English: That freedom gives us a way to express love for God.

Adhola: Hongo maromo otieko kadho munyo Jehova fodi oweyo ji piemo gi dhum pere.
English: For a limited time, Jehovah has allowed rebellion against his sovereignty.

Adhola: Raŋo go otimo ameno?
English: Why?

Adhola: Wonyali nyutho ni go kende amanyalo dhumo maber.
English: To show that no effort to rule without him benefits people.

Adhola: Oro 6,000 m’otieko kadho munyo ji ama jodhumo,  nyutho kamaler ni jodhum ma piny me jokinyali kwanyo woko lweny, turo cik, kodi two
English: After 6,000 years of human history, the evidence is clear that human rulers have failed to eliminate war, crime, injustice, or disease.

Adhola: Pokirok kwoŋ dhum pa ji, dhum pa Were kelo bero ri joma joyeyo dhum no.
English: In contrast to human rulership, God’s rule benefits those who accept it.

Adhola: Jehova cegin kwanyo woko dhum pa ji je.
English: Soon, Jehovah will bring all human government to an end.

Adhola: Jono kende ma joyeyo dhum pa Were ama joladoŋ i piny
English: Only people who choose to be ruled by God will inhabit the earth.

Adhola: Sitan waco ni ji jolamo Were rupiri nitie gikipiny ma jolimo wok bonge
English: Satan claimed that no one would serve Jehovah out of unselfish love

Adhola: Imito nyutho ni meno obedo twodo?
English: Would you like to disprove that lie?

Adhola: Inyalo, rupiri Were fodi odiyo cunye wanyali nyutho ka wamito dhum pere kosa apa ji
English: You can, God’s patience allows all of us to show whether we favor rule by God or rule by man

Adhola: Gima watimo amanyutho ni wamito dhum pa Were kosa be
English: We indicate our choice by the way we live

Adhola: Gima watimo amanyutho ni wamito dhum pa Were kosa be
English: Our choices reveal whether we want God as our Ruler

Adhola: Wanyutho ni wayero Were dhumo wan ka wayero din mar’adieri, ma luwo Wac pa Were, Baibul
English: We can choose God as our Ruler by seeking out and practicing true worship based on God’s Word, the Bible

Adhola: Wakwero Sitan dhumo wan munyo wakidonji i wac mar’adhum ma piny me kodi i lweny, paka Yesu otimo
English: We can reject Satan as our ruler by keeping out of politics and war, as Jesus did

Adhola: Sitan oro meni pere miyo ji timo kidakana kanyacel gi kula moro je marac
English: Satan uses his power to promote immoral, harmful practices

Adhola: Ka wakwero kula macale ameno, merin mawan gi jowat mawan jonyalo nyero wan kosa cero wan fonjirok gima mako kwoŋ Were
English: When we reject such practices, some friends and relatives may ridicule or oppose us

Adhola: Ri ameno, waripo yero gir’atima
English: So we face a choice

Adhola: Wanotiyere gi ji ma jomaro Were?
English: Will we associate with people who love God?

Adhola: Wanowinji cik ma Were miyo wan ru bero mawan?
English: Will we obey his wise and loving laws? If we do, we prove that Satan lied when he claimed that under pressure no one would do as God says

Adhola: Ka watimo ameno, wanyutho ni Sitan otwodo munyo owaco ni ongoye dhano manyalo winjo Were ka nitie i dinyo
English: Ka watimo ameno, wanyutho ni Sitan otwodo munyo owaco ni ongoye dhano manyalo winjo Were ka nitie i dinyo

Adhola: Were lakwanyo woko candirok je rupiri go omaro ji
English: God’s love for mankind guarantees that evil and suffering will end

Adhola: Joma joketho yeyo pajo i wac me jobino limo kwo makirum i piny
English: Those who demonstrate that they believe this will enjoy life on earth forever

Adhola: Wac maber wok bongi Jehova Were "majakisangala, ma mito ni pecin wobed’iye kisangala
English: The good news comes from Jehovah, the happy God, who wants families to be happy

Adhola: Go amo’cako ri ji can ma nywomirok
English: He originated marriage

Adhola: Nywomirok m’iyeyo i cik kelo kisangala i peco rupiri konyo jonywol kuro kodi pidho nyithindho pajo maber
English: Legal marriage is vital to family happiness because it provides a secure environment in which to raise children

Adhola: Jokristo joripo luwo cik pa piny ma jobed’iye ma mako kwoŋ ndiko nywomirok pajo i cik
English: Christians should respect local laws concerning the registration of marriage

Adhola: Were tero nedi nywomirok?
English: How does God view marriage?

Adhola: Go mito ni nywomirok wobedi i dier jacwo gi dhako, aka jokiri joweyere
English: He wants it to be a permanent union between a man and a woman

Adhola: Jehova kimiti jocot
English: Jehovah wants husbands and wives to be loyal to each other

Adhola: Go kimiti jacwo woriemi cege
English: He hates divorce

Adhola: Kwanyo woko, Were yeyo dhano eye i nywomirok to nywomere kosa to nywomo ŋatman ka nyawote otimo cot
English: But he does allow Christians to divorce and remarry if their spouse commits adultery

Adhola: Jehova ocweyo cwo gi mon jowokonyere i nywomirok pajo
English: Jehovah created men and women to fill complementary roles in marriage

Adhola: Jacwo am’obedo jatel ma peco, aka go ripo limo ri jopeco pere gikipiny ma mitere i peco gi fonjo jo gima mako kwoŋ Were
English: As family head, a husband should take the lead in providing materially for his family and in teaching them about God

Adhola: Go ripo maro cege
English: He should be self-sacrificing in his love for his wife

Adhola: Jacwo kodi cege joripo mare kodi miyere wor
English: Husbands and wives should love and respect each other

Adhola: Rupiri jacwo gi cege jobedo ji ma jonyalo timo makosa, ka jomito limo kisangala i peco pajo, kis dhano ripo fonjere cwako ri nyawote
English: Since all husbands and wives are imperfect, learning to forgive is a key to happiness in marriage

Adhola: Ka wilimo teko i nywomirok mewin, kis dhano ripo timo gima nyalere je nyutho nyawote mar
English: If you experience difficulties in your marriage, both of you should work at treating each other with love

Adhola: Wac pa Were kinyuthi ni pokirok am’obedo nger ma cowo teko ma winigine i nywomirok mewin
English: God’s Word does not recommend separation as a way to resolve problems that are common in marriage

Adhola: Jehova mito wilimi kisangala i kwo
English: Jehovah wants you to be happy

Adhola: Jehova miyo soye ryeko maber manyalo konyo jo
English: He gives you the best advice on how to enjoy your youth

Adhola: Go mito ni wiwinji jonywol mewin winyali limo kisangala
English: He wants you to benefit from the wisdom and experience of your parents

Adhola: Kendo Jehova mito ni wilimi kisangala mawok i timo gikipiny ma go kodi Wode jomito
English: Jehovah also wants you to experience the joy of doing things for your Creator and his Son

Adhola: Wiripo tiyo gi meni winyali limo ri nyithindho mewin cemo, kanindo, kodi ruk
English: You should work hard to provide food, housing, and clothing for your children

Adhola: To ka wimito nyithindho mewin jowolimi kisangala i kwo, wiripo kir fonjo jo gikipiny ma mako kwoŋ Were
English: But for your children to find happiness, you also need to teach them to love God and to learn from him

Adhola: Jolamaro Were ka wiketho ri jo ranena maber
English: Your example in showing love for God can deeply influence your child’s heart

Adhola: Ka wifonjo nyithindho mewin munyo wioro Wac pa Were, joladongo gi kula maber
English: When based on God’s Word, your instruction can mold your child’s thinking in a positive way

Adhola: Nyithindho jowinjo maber ka wifoyo gikipiny mabeyo ma jotimo
English: Children benefit when you encourage and commend them

Adhola: Aka ber tiro jo jowonyali dongo gi kula maber
English: They also need correction and discipline

Adhola: Ka witimo ameno, nyithindho mewin jokobedi gi kula mareco manyalo cowo kwoŋ jo siem
English: Such training protects them from conduct that could rob them of happiness

Adhola: To kiber oro nge munyo wifonjo nyithindho mewin
English: Yet, discipline should never be harsh or cruel

Adhola: Wajulizi pa Jehova jondiko kitawin makweth manyalo konyo jonywol kodi nyithindho
English: Jehovah’s Witnesses publish several books that are especially written to help parents and children

Adhola: Rieko je manitie i kitawin no wok i Baibul
English: These books are based on the Bible

Adhola: Gwokere win kwoŋ jotuci wac Were ma twodo
English: Be on the watch for the false prophets

Adhola: Yesu ofonjo ji din acel kende mar’adieri
English: Jesus taught his followers only one religion, the true religion

Adhola: Din mar’adieri cale gi royo ma tero jo i kwo makirum
English: It is like a road leading to everlasting life

Adhola: Yesu owaco ni: "Ji manok ama jonwaŋo royo no"
English: Jesus said: "Few are finding that road"

Adhola: Din kende ma Were yeyo, a meno ma fonjo Wac pere manitie i Baibul
English: God accepts only worship based on his Word of truth

Adhola: Joma jonitie i din mar’adieri jotiyere maber aka joyeyo gimoro acel
English: All true worshippers are united in one faith

Adhola: Jowaco ni joŋeyo Were, to tim pajo nyutho ni jodak go
English: They publicly declare that they know God, but they disown him by their works

Adhola: Yesu owaco ni jofonji ma twodo di jobino to jofonjo gikipiny ma twodo.
English: Jesus warned that false prophets would corrupt Christianity.

Adhola: Jocale gi Jokristo mar’adieri.
English: Outwardly, they seem like true worshippers.

Adhola: Aka joma joluwo jo jolwoŋere ni Jokristo.
English: Their churches claim to be Christian.

Adhola: To inyalo ŋeyo nedi ni jokobedo Jokristo mar’adieri?
English: But how can you recognize such people for what they really are?

Adhola: Inyalo ŋeyo jo rupiri din mar’adieri kende amabed’iye ji ma jotimo gikipiny mabeyo.
English: Only true worship produces genuine Christians with recognizable qualities and ways.

Adhola: Onyo wey wanen gikipiny abic manyalo konyin ŋeyo din mar’adieri:
English: Consider these five identifying marks:

Adhola: Joma jonitie i din mar’adieri joworo Wac pa Were, Baibul
English: True worshippers respect the Bible as God’s Word

Adhola: Jotemo swa luwo fonji manitie i Baibul
English: They strive to live by its principles

Adhola: Ri ameno, din mar’adieri opokere kwoŋ din maluwo paro pa ji
English: So true religion differs from religion that is based on men’s ideas

Adhola: Joma jonitie i din mar’adieri joketho i tim gikipiny ma jofonjo
English: True worshippers do not preach one thing and practice another

Adhola: Joma jonitie i din mar’adieri joworo nyingi Were, Jehova
English: Jesus’ true followers honor God’s name, Jehovah

Adhola: Yesu onyutho ni woro nyingi Were munyo waco ri ji nyingi Were
English: Jesus honored God’s name by making it known

Adhola: Yesu okonyo ji ŋeyo Were kendo ofonjo jo kwayo ni nyingi Were wolwor
English: He helped people to know God and taught them to pray that God’s name be sanctified

Adhola: I adec m’ibed’iye, din mene ma fonjo ji nyingi Were?
English: Where you live, which religion makes God’s name known?

Adhola: Jokristo mar’adieri jofonjo kwoŋ Ker pa Were
English: True Christians preach about God’s Kingdom

Adhola: Were odhiro Yesu i piny ka fonjo ji Wac maber ma mako kwoŋ Ker pa Were
English: God sent Jesus to preach the good news of the Kingdom

Adhola: Ker pa Were kende ama lakwanyo woko teko pa ji je
English: God’s Kingdom is the only hope for mankind

Adhola: Yesu oluwo kwoŋ Ker pa Were cuka otho
English: Jesus continued speaking about it until his dying day

Adhola: Owaco ni jofonjirok pere di jofonjo kwoŋ Ker pa Were
English: He said that his followers would preach about it

Adhola: Dhano k’obino bongin to waco rin gima mako kwoŋ Ker pa Were, iparo ni ŋato wok i din mene?
English: If someone approaches you to speak about God’s Kingdom, to which religion does he likely belong?

Adhola: Jokristo mar’adieri jokobedo ji pa piny
English: Jesus’ followers are no part of this wicked world

Adhola: Inyalo ŋeyo jo rupiri jokidonji i wac mar’adhum ma piny kendo jokidonji i lweny
English: You can recognize them by the way they take no part in politics or social conflicts

Adhola: Aka joweyo kula mareco manitie i piny kodi paro pa ji mareco
English: Also, they do not imitate the world’s harmful practices and attitudes

Adhola: Jokristo mar’adieri jomarere swa
English: True Christians have outstanding love for one another

Adhola: Wac pa Were fonjo jo ni joripo woro ji ma nonin je
English: From God’s Word, they learn to respect all ethnic groups

Adhola: Kada nende joma jonitie i din ma twodo jomaro donjo i lweny ma piny m’opokere opokere, joma jonitie i din mar’adieri jokitimi ameno
English: Although false religions have often strongly supported the wars of the nations, true worshippers refuse to do so

Adhola: Kwanyo woko jooro meni kodi lim pajo konyo joman
English: Rather, true Christians unselfishly use their time and resources to help and encourage others

Adhola: Din mene ma fonji mere je wok i Baibul, ma woro nyingi Were, kendo ma fonjo ni Ker pa Were kende ama lakwanyo woko teko pa ji je?
English: Which religion bases all its teachings on God’s Word, honors God’s name, and proclaims God’s Kingdom as mankind’s only hope?

Adhola: Din mene ma n’iye ji ma jomarere aka ma jokidonji i lweny?
English: Which group practices love and shuns war?

Adhola: Iparo ni a jomene?
English: What do you think?

Adhola: Cik pa Were kuro nedi kwo mawan?
English: How could Bible principles move us to take safety precautions?

Adhola: Were riek loyo wan
English: Our Creator is wiser than we are

Adhola: Go omaro wan swa aka mito ni wabedi gi kwo maber
English: As a loving Father, he cares for us

Adhola: K’obedo atoŋa pa Were nike wawegi wadhumere
English: Also, he did not intend for us to be independent of him

Adhola: Paka nyithindho joripo limo rieko wok bongi jonywol pajo, apaka wabende waripo limo rieko wok bongi Were
English: So just as a small child needs the guidance of parents, we all need the guidance of God

Adhola: Baibul obedo mic maber mawok bongi Were, rupiri n’iye rieko manyalo konyo wan i kwo
English: Bible principles provide guidance that is a gift from God

Adhola: Ka waluwo cik pa Jehova, wanyalo bedo gi kwo maber pama, aka wanyalo kir limo kwo makirum i hongo mabino.
English: Jehovah’s laws and principles teach us the best way of life now and show us how we can gain everlasting rewards in the future.

Adhola: Rupiri Were am’ocweyo wan, go oŋeyo kis gimaber ri wan. Am’omiyo waripo winjo cik pere
English: Since God created us, it is only right that we respond appreciatively to his guidance.

Adhola: Gikipiny man ma wasoma i Baibul k’obedo cik, kwanyo woko nyutho wan paro pa Were.
English: Bible principles are fundamental truths.

Adhola: Kucel, cik nyutho wan gima waripo timo.
English: Laws, on the other hand, may be for specific circumstances.

Adhola: Ruman waripo oro rieko nyaka to waneno nger ma gikipiny man ma wasoma i Baibul konyo wan.
English: We must use thinking ability to understand how a principle applies in a particular situation.

Adhola: Paka gir’anena, Baibul fonjo ni kwo obedo mic mawok bongi Were.
English: For example, the Bible teaches that life is a gift from God.

Adhola: Ka watieko ŋeyo ameno, watimo gimanyalere je geŋo gikipiny manyalo ketho kwo mawan i teko ka wanitie katic, peco, kosa ka wawotho i royo.
English: That basic principle can guide us at work, at home, and while traveling.

Adhola: Yesu oluwo kwoŋ cik ario maloyo man je.
English: Jesus spoke of two principles of prime importance.

Adhola: Cik mar’apena nyutho gim’omiyo Were ocweyo wan.
English: The first reveals the very purpose of human life.

Adhola: Were ocweyo wan wanyali  ŋeyo go, maro go, kodi timo tic pere gi cuny wan acel.
English: God created us to know Him, to love him, and to serve him faithfully.

Adhola: Kis gimoro je ma wamito timo, kutho ber paro kwoŋ cik no.
English: This first principle should be considered in all our decisions.

Adhola: Joma jooro cik no i kwo pajo jolokere merin pa Were, jolimo kisangala, aka jolalimo kwo makirum.
English: Those who take this principle to heart  gain friendship with God, true happiness, and everlasting life.

Adhola: Cik mar’ario fonjo wan tiyirok maber gi joman
English: The second principle can guide us into peaceful relationships with others

Adhola: Cik no konyo wan tero ji paka Were tero jo
English: Applying this second principle involves imitating God’s way of treating people

Adhola: Ka jopeco joluwo cik pa Were manitie i Baibul, peco no bed’iye siem kodi kisangala
English: Bible principles teach families how to be united by love

Adhola: Kendo Baibul riwo peco rupiri fonjo jacwo gi cege ni kis dhano ripo cwire kwoŋ nyawote
English: God’s Word also protects families by teaching another guiding principleâ€”that marriage should be permanent

Adhola: Ka waketho i tim gima wafonjere i Baibul, nyalo kir konyo wan i nger man m’opokere opokere
English: By following Bible teachings, we can protect our material and emotional welfare

Adhola: Paka gir’anena, kis dhano mito jatic magenere kendo matiyo gi meni
English: For example, employers often prefer workers who live by the Bible principles of honesty and diligence

Adhola: Odoko Baibul fonjo ni wakiripi rembo ka wanyalo limo gikipiny ma mitere i kwo, kendo fonjo ni waripo maro Were loyo ŋaŋo
English: God’s Word also teaches us to be content with the things that are necessary and to value friendship with God above material things

Adhola: Ka waluwo cik pa Were, nyalo kir kuro kwo mawan
English: Applying Bible principles can protect our health

Adhola: Paka gir’anena, ka waluwo cik ma cero wan mero, botho wan kwoŋ two kodi teko man ma jomero jolimo
English: For example, adhering to God’s law against drunkenness protects us from deadly diseases and accidents

Adhola: Were yeyo wan madho mwenge, to nyaka manok
English: Jehovah permits us to drink alcoholic beverages but only in moderation

Adhola: Kendo cik pa Were konyo wan bedo gi paro m’otire
English: Godly principles benefit us by teaching us to guard not just our actions but also our thoughts

Adhola: To Jokristo mar’adieri jokiwinji cik pa Were rupiri konyo jo
English: Yet, true Christians do not respect God’s standards merely to benefit themselves

Adhola: Jowinjo cik pa Were rupiri jomito miyo go dwoŋ
English: They do so to honor Jehovah

Adhola: Were mito ni ji ma nonin je jowokwayi go, ameno jowonyali core cegin gi go
English: God invites people of all sorts to draw close to him in prayer

Adhola: To nitie kwayo ma Were kiwinji
English: Yet, he does not listen to, or accept, all prayers
