Adhola: Paka gir’anena, Were kiwinji kwayo pa jacwo ma cando cege
English: For example, the prayers of a man who mistreats his wife can be hindered

Adhola: Cango munyo Joisiraili jomedere timo gikipiny mareco, Were okwero winjo kwayo pajo
English: Also, when the Israelites persisted in badness, God refused to hear their prayers

Adhola: Kwayo obedo silwany madwoŋ swa ma Were omiyo wan
English: Clearly, prayer is a privilege

Adhola: Were winjo kir kwayo pa dhano m’oyido timo gikipiny mareco, ka ŋato oŋuto reco pere
English: Nevertheless, God will accept the prayers of even gross sinners if they repent

Adhola: Kwayo obedo acel kwoŋ nger ma walam’iye Were.
English: Prayer is part of our worship of God.

Adhola: Ri ameno, waripo kwayo Jacwec mawan, Jehova kende.
English: So we should pray only to our Creator, Jehovah.

Adhola: Aka paka wabedo jotimi reco, waripo kwayo i nyingi Yesu rupiri go otho ri reco mawan.
English: Also, since we are imperfect, we should pray in the name of Jesus because he died for our sins.

Adhola: Jehova kimiti ni waluda kwayo ma wamako amaka i wiyi wan kosa m’ondiki i kitawo.
English: Jehovah does not want us to repeat memorized or written prayers.

Adhola: Go mito ni gima wakwayo go wowoki i cuny wan
English: He wants us to pray from our heart.

Adhola: acwec mawan winjo kir kwayo ma nyaliŋliŋ
English: Our Creator can hear even silent prayers

Adhola: Go mito ni wakway go i hongo moro je; paka odikini, othieno, ka wakidho cemo, kosa ka walimo teko
English: He invites us to pray on every occasion, such as at the beginning and the end of the day, at mealtimes, and when we face problems

Adhola: Kiyot bedo mere pa Were rupiri wabedo i dier ji ma jokiyey Were kendo ma jokiyey gikipiny ma Were ociko timo ri wan, paka kelo siem i piny
English: Drawing close to God is not easy because we live among people who lack faith in God and ridicule his promise of peace on earth

Adhola: Am’omiyo ber romo kanyacel gi Jokristo wadi wan wamedere meni
English: So we need the encouraging association of fellow believers, and they need us

Adhola: Romo kanyacel gi joma jomaro Were konyo wan corok cegin gi Were
English: Associating with people who love God helps us to draw close to God

Adhola: K’ikidho kama Wajulizi pa Jehova jorom’iye lamo Were, ilanwaŋo ji ma joni gi yeyo aka jolamedin meni
English: The meetings of Jehovah’s Witnesses provide fine opportunities to benefit from the faith of others

Adhola: Inyalo core cegin gi Jehova k’imedo paro kwoŋ gikipiny m’itieko fonjere i Baibul
English: You can draw close to Jehovah by meditating on what you have learned from his Word

Adhola: Pari kwoŋ gikipiny ma Were timo, rieko ma go miyo wan, kodi gikipiny ma go ociko timo ri wan
English: Contemplate his activities, his advice, and his promises

Adhola: Kwayo Were kodi paro kwoŋ gikipiny m’ifonjere lakonyin medo ŋeyo mar pa Were gi rieko pere
English: Prayerful meditation builds appreciation in our heart for God’s love and wisdom

Adhola: K’imito core cegin gi Were, ripere igeni go kendo ibedi gi yeyo
English: You can be close to God only if you trust in him, if you have faith in him

Adhola: To yeyo cale kodi gimakwo ma mitere pidho
English: But faith is like a living thing that needs feeding

Adhola: Iripo pidho yeyo perin munyo iparo kwoŋ gikipiny m’ifonjere t’iridho ni obedo adieri
English: You must constantly feed your faith by reviewing the basis for your beliefs

Adhola: Jehova dewo kwoŋ ji ma jomaro go
English: Jehovah cares for those who love him

Adhola: Go nyalo kuro jo kwoŋ gimoro je manyalo nyapo yeyo pajo kosa cero jo limo kwo makirum
English: He can protect them from anything that could jeopardize their faith and their hope of everlasting life

Adhola: Go waco ri wan gikipiny manyalo ketho kwo mawan i teko kendo manyalo cowo kwoŋ wan siem
English: He warns us against ways of life that threaten our health and happiness

Adhola: Gikipiny ma Jehova fonjo wan konyo wan bedo gi kwo maber
English: Jehovah teaches us the best way of life

Adhola: Kis din n’iye jomaber.
English: There are sincere people in all religions.

Adhola: Bero mere, Were neno jono aka dewo kwoŋ jo.
English: It is good news that God sees those people and cares about them.

Adhola: To nitie gikipiny mareco madit swa matimere i din m’opokere opokere.
English: But sadly, religion has been used for evil ends.

Adhola: Oŋeyere maber ni jodini jomaro donjo i lweny, neko ji, kodi timo kidakana kwoŋ nyithindho.
English: According to news reports, some religions are even involved in terrorism, genocide, war, and child abuse.

Adhola: Gikipiny no ŋedho cuny ji ma jomaro Were.
English: How this saddens sincere believers in God!

Adhola: Din mar’adieri miyo Were dwoŋ to din ma twodo timo gikipiny ma kisangala go.
English: Whereas true religion glorifies God, false religion displeases him.

Adhola: Jofonjo gikipiny ma kimakere gi Baibul.
English: It teaches ideas that are not in the Bible,

Adhola: Jokifonji adieri ma mako kwoŋ Were kodi kwoŋ jomotho.
English: It teaches false ideas about God and about the dead.

Adhola: Jehova mito ni ji jowoŋeyi adieri ma mako kwoŋ go.
English: But Jehovah wants people to know the truth about him.

Adhola: Were oŋeyo maber swa jodini ma jorendere ni jomaro go to sano iy’adieri jomaro piny pa Sitan
English: Happily, God is not deceived by religions that claim to love him but are really in love with Satan’s world

Adhola: Din ma twodo je Baibul lwoŋo ni "Babilon madwong
English: God’s Word refers to all false religion as "Babylon the Great

Adhola: Babilon obedo tindi ma cango din ma twodo ocak’iye, rumacen ma mikula ma ndir pa Nowa
English: Babylon was the ancient city where false religion began after the Flood of Noah’s day

Adhola: Were cegin reyo woko din je ma wondo ji
English: Soon, God will bring a sudden end to religion that deceives and oppresses mankind

Adhola: Bero mere nitie
English: There is more good news.

Adhola: Jehova fodi poyo jomaber ma jonitie i din ma twodo m’opokere opokere i piny gipi.
English: Jehovah has not forgotten the sincere people who are scattered among false religions worldwide.

Adhola: Go riwo jono munyo fonjo jo adieri.
English: He is uniting such people by teaching them the truth.

Adhola: Din mar’adieri riwo ji
English: True religion is uniting people

Adhola: Jehova dewo kwoŋ ji ma jomito timo gim’otire
English: Jehovah cares about people who love what is true and good

Adhola: Go waco ri jono wok i din ma twodo
English: He urges them to leave false religion behind

Adhola: Ji ma jomaro Were kibedi ri jo matek wiro kwo pajo to jotimo gima Were mito
English: People who love God are willing to make changes to please him

Adhola: Munyo Yesu otieko tho, ji m’oromo jowinjo wac maber ma jofonjirok pere oyido jofonjo to jojolo wac no gi kisangala
English: In the first century, when sincere people heard the good news from the apostles, they responded with joy

Adhola: Jofonjere gikipiny manyen ma mako kwoŋ Jehova to jolimo geno
English: They learned a new way of life from Jehovah, a happier way of life with a purpose and a hope

Adhola: Jonyutho wan ranena maber rupiri munyo jowinjo wac pa Were, jojolo wac no to jotimo gima Were mito
English: They are a good example for us today because they responded to the good news by putting Jehovah first in their lives

Adhola: Ji ma joeye i din ma twodo Jehova jolo jo i din mar’adieri.
English: Jehovah welcomes into his family of worshippers those who turn away from false religion.

Adhola: Ka inocaki lamo Jehova, ilalokere mere pere.
English: If you accept Jehovah’s warm invitation, you will receive his friendship,

Adhola: Ibino lamo go kanyacel gi ji pere ma jomarere.
English: You will worship with a new and loving family of fellow worshippers of Jehovah,

Adhola: Medo kwoŋ meno, ibino limo kwo makirum.
English: In addition to that, you will receive and everlasting life

Adhola: Were cegin reyo woko din je ma twodo
English: The coming judgment of false religion is good news

Adhola: Meno obedo wac maber rupiri din ma twodo odoko k’okeli ri ji candirok i piny
English: It will bring worldwide relief from oppression

Adhola: Odoko jokowondi ji kodi kelo ri ji pokirok
English: Never again will false religion mislead and divide mankind

Adhola: I hongo no, kis dhano labedo ni lamo Were acel kende mar’adieri
English: Everyone living will be united in the worship of the only true God

Adhola: Were cango oyero nyikway Abraham to loko jo nono acel, rumacen to miyo jo cik.
English: God organized descendants of the patriarch Abraham into a nation and gave them a body of laws.

Adhola: Olwoŋo nono no ni "Isiraili aka jo kende am’oyido joŋeyo nger m’otire ma lamo Were.
English: He called the nation "Israel and made it the custodian of true worship

Adhola: Were omiyo jo wac pere.
English: God made them custodians of His word

Adhola: Ri ameno, ji ma nonin je oyido jonyalo limo silwany wok kwoŋ Joisiraili.
English: So people of all nations could benefit from Israel.

Adhola: Were oyero Joisiraili bedo wajulizi pere
English: God chose the Israelites to be his witnesses

Adhola: Gima mako kwoŋ jo nyutho ni ji jolimo silwany ka joluwo cik pa Were
English: Their ancient history provides a demonstration of how people benefit by obeying God’s laws

Adhola: Ri ameno, luwo kwoŋ Joisiraili, ji ma nonin man oyido jonyalo ŋeyo Were mar’adieri
English: Thus, through the Israelites, others could get to know the true God

Adhola: Hongo otundo to Jehova weyo ameno tiyirok gi Joisiraili, to cako tiyirok gi Jokristo ayin
English: In time, Israel lost God’s favor, and Jehovah replaced that nation with the Christian congregation

Adhola: Konon Jokristo mar’adieri ama jobedo Wajulizi pa Jehova, ma kiweno Joisiraili
English: Now, in place of the Israelites, true Christians serve as Jehovah’s witnesses

Adhola: Yesu obino ocano jofonjirok pere i kitipa acel to miyo jo tic ma fonjo wac maber ma mako kwoŋ Ker pa Were i piny gipi
English: Jesus organized his followers to preach and make disciples in all nations

Adhola: Tic no fodi kadho yuwaŋe i ndelo me ma rumacen, aka cegin kir rumo
English: This work is reaching its climax now, in the conclusion of the present system of things

Adhola: Jehova oriwo ji matoth swa wok inonin je aka onyo jolamo go iy’adieri; gino oyido fodi k’otimereye wok con
English: For the first time in history, Jehovah has united millions from all nations in true worship

Adhola: Jokristo mar’adieri jonitie i kitipa acel aka jokonyere
English: True Christians are organized to encourage and help one another

Adhola: I cokirok pajo, jofonjere gimoro acel i piny gipi
English: Worldwide, they enjoy the same program of Bible instruction at their meetings

Adhola: I oro ma 1870, jochako paka jofonjirok ma Baibul.
English: In the 1870’s a small group of people started studying the bible

Adhola: I ndir no, jocako dwaro adieri manitie i Baibul m’oyido orwenyo.
English: They began rediscovering long-lost Bible truths.

Adhola: Oyido joŋeyo ni cango Yesu Kristo ooro Jokristo mar’adieri fonjo ji wac maber ma mako kwoŋ Ker pa Were, to  ameno to jocako tito wac no gi derino i piny gipi.
English: They knew that Jesus had organized the Christian congregation to preach, so they began an international Kingdom-preaching campaign.

Adhola: I oro ma 1931, ocaki lwoŋo jo ni Wajulizi pa Jehova.
English: In 1931 they adopted the name Jehovah’s Witnesses.

Adhola: Munyo Yesu otieko tho, Jokristo mar’adieri ma ndir no oyido jolimo teli wok bongi jodongo ma jotero teli, aka jodongo no oyido jotero Yesu paka jateli pajo.
English: In the first century, the Christian congregations in many lands benefited from a central governing body that recognized Jesus as the Head of the congregation.

Adhola: Kiri kononi Wajulizi pa Jehova jolimo teli wok bongi jodongo ma jotero teli i piny gipi.
English: Similarly today, Jehovah’s Witnesses worldwide benefit from a Governing Body of experienced elders.

Adhola: Jodongo no ama joneno ni tic ma timere i ofis pa Wajulizi pa Jehova i piny m’opokere opokere kadho maber.
English: Those elders ensure that good work is done in branch offices of Jehovah’s Witnesses in different countries

Adhola: I ofis no akama iwir’iye kitawin ma tito Baibul i dhudhok makalo 600, t’ipoko ri ji i piny gipi.
English: It oversees branch offices of Jehovah’s Witnesses that translate, print, and distribute Bible-study material in over 600 languages.

Adhola: Wajulizi pa Jehova jonitie i kitipin mathindho thindho ma kalo 110,000 i piny gipi, aka joje jofonjere gimoro acel mawok bongi jodongo ma jotero teli.
English: Thus the Governing Body can provide Scriptural encouragement and direction for over 100,000 congregations worldwide.

Adhola: Kis kitipa n’iye cwo ma jotiyo paka jodongo ma kitipa.
English: In each congregation, qualified men serve as elders, or overseers.

Adhola: Cwo no joni gi mar aka jodewo swa kwoŋ rombo pa Were.
English: These men lovingly care for God’s flock.

Adhola: Wajulizi pa Jehova ocan jo tito wac maber kodi loko ji jofonjirok pa Yesu
English: Jehovah’s Witnesses are organized to preach the good news and make disciples

Adhola: Paka jomoor pa Yesu cango jotimo, wabende wafonjo ji i pecin pajo
English: Like the apostles, we preach from house to house

Adhola: Aka joma jomito fonjirok adieri manitie i Baibul, wafonjo jo nono
English: We also offer to study the Bible with sincere lovers of truth

Adhola: To Wajulizi pa Jehova jokobedo abeda kitipa ma din
English: But Jehovah’s Witnesses are not just an organization

Adhola: Wabedo wutimere gi nyimere kendo wani gi Bawan m’omaro wan swa
English: We are a family with a loving Father

Adhola: Kis dhano dewo kwoŋ nyawote
English: We are brothers and sisters who care for one another

Adhola: Wajulizi pa Jehova a ji ma joloyo bedo gi kisangala i piny, rupiri jotimo gima  Were mito kendo jokonyo joman
English: Since Jehovah’s people are organized to please God and to help others, they form the happiest family on earth

Adhola: Gikipiny ma nyaka ifonjere i Baibul ripo bedo ni okonyin medo maro Jehova
English: No doubt, this overview of basic Bible teachings has strengthened your love for Jehovah

Adhola: To iripo timo gimanyalere je nyalo kuro mar no
English: This love needs constant cultivation

Adhola: Ilalimo kwo makirum k’imedere fonjirok gima mako kwoŋ Were
English: Your hope of everlasting life depends on whether you continue to draw close to God by studying his Word

Adhola: K’imedere ŋeyo Were, yeyo perin bino ridhere
English: As you grow in knowledge of God, your faith will become stronger

Adhola: Yeyo no lakonyin miyo Were winjo maber
English: Faith will help you to please God

Adhola: Kendo yeyo lamiyin ŋuto reco perin kodi timo gikipiny ma Were mito
English: It will move you to repent and to make beneficial changes in your way of life

Adhola: Inyalo bedo mere pa Jehova
English: You can enter into a special relationship with Jehovah

Adhola: Adieri ilamito wacoye ri joman wac maber m’ifonjere i Baibul.
English: Naturally, you will want to share with others what you have learned

Adhola: Wajoje watimo ameno.
English: we all enjoy telling good news.

Adhola: Joma thoth jocako tito wac maber me ri wati kodi merin pajo
English: Most people start by sharing the good news with friends or relatives

Adhola: K’imedere fonjirok Baibul, ilaŋeyo nger m’inyalo oro Baibul tito ri joman gim’omiyo iyeyo Jehova, kendo ilanyalo tito ri jo wac maber m’ifonjere.
English: As you continue studying the Bible, you will learn how to use the Bible to explain your faith in Jehovah and the good news

Adhola: To ber oro rieko munyo iluwo gi jo
English: Be tactful

Adhola: Ikiri iwaci ri jo ni din pajo obedo ma twodo, to waci ri jo gikipiny maber ma Were ociko timo ri ji
English: Rather than saying that their religion is mistaken, tell them about God’s promises

Adhola: Aka ber poyo ni kula perin maber amalaywayo ji loyo wac m’iluwo
English: Also, remember that people are often more impressed by your kind behavior than by what you say

Adhola: Fonjirok Wac pa Were lakonyin ridho yeyo perin t’ilokere mere pere.
English: Studying God’s Word will help you to grow spiritually.

Adhola: Aka ilabedo acel kwoŋ ji pa Jehova.
English: You can actually belong to him as a member of his family.

Adhola: Ilamedo dongo i yeyo perin k’imedere kisoma Wac pa Were
English: You can advance spiritually by continuing to study God’s Word

Adhola: Waci ri Wajulizi pa Jehova jowofonjin kitawo m’ilwongo ni What Can the Bible Teach Us?
English: Ask one of Jehovah’s Witnesses to study the Bible with you using the book What Does the Bible Really Teach?

Adhola: K’imedere kisoma Wac pa Were, kwo perin bende lamedere bedo maber
English: The more you learn from God’s Word, the more successful your life will be

Adhola: Wac maber wok bongi Jehova, Were majakisangala
English: The good news comes from Jehovah, the happy God

Adhola: Ilamedo core cegin gi Jehova k’iromo kanyacel gi ji pere
English: You can draw closer to him by drawing closer to his people

Adhola: K’imedere timo gima Jehova mito, meno nyutho ni imito limo kwo mar’adieri, m’obedo kwo makirum
English: By continuing your efforts to please Jehovah, you are reaching out for the real lifeâ€”everlasting life

Adhola: Ongoye gimaber loyo bedo mere pa Were
English: Drawing close to God is truly the best thing that you can do

Adhola: Raŋo waripo lamo Were?
English: Why should we worship God?

Adhola: Baibul fonjo wan aŋo kwoŋ Were?
English: What is God like?

Adhola: Were nigi nyinge?
English: Does God have a name?

Adhola: Jehova dewo kwoŋ wan?
English: Does Jehovah care about us?

Adhola: Wanyalo nedi bedo merin pa Were?
English: How can we draw closer to God?

Adhola: Were mar’adieri am’ocweyo kis gimoro je
English: The true God is the Creator of all things

Adhola: Go ongoye gi cakirok, kendo ongoye gi gike
English: He had no beginning and will never have an end

Adhola: (Zabuli 90:2) Wac maber manitie i Baibul wok bonge
English: (Psalm 90:2) He is the Source of the good news found in the Bible

Adhola: (1 Timothe 1:11) Rupiri Were am’omiyo wan kwo, go kende ama waripo lamo
English: (1 Timothy 1:11) Since God gave us life, we should worship only him

Adhola: Soma Menyirok 4:11
English: Read Revelation 4:11

Adhola: Ongoye dhano m’otieko nenoye Were rupiri Were obedo cuny
English: No human has ever seen God because he is a Spirit

Adhola: Meno nyutho ni go nigi kwo ma malo swa loyo cwec moro je manitie i piny ka
English: which means that he is a higher form of life than the physical creatures who live on earth (John 1:18; 4:24)

Adhola: (Yohana 1:18; 4:24) To wanyalo fonjere kite pa Were ka waneno gikipiny ma go ocweyo
English: Nevertheless, we can discern God’s personality from the things he has made

Adhola: Paka gir’anena, yen manyak giracama kodi mawuwa nyutho wan ni Were nigi mar kodi rieko
English: For instance, the variety of fruits and flowers tells us of his love and wisdom

Adhola: Gikipiny makweth ma Were ocweyo i polo g’ipiny nyutho wan ni go nigi meni, Soma Joroma 1:20.
English: The size of the universe tells us of his power, read Romans 1:20

Adhola: Wanyalo fonjere gikipiny makweth ma mako kwoŋ Were ka wasoma Baibul
English: We can learn even more about God’s personality by reading the Bible

Adhola: Paka gir’anena, Baibul waco ri wan gikipiny ma Were mito kodi gikipiny ma go kimiti, kendo waco ri wan paka Were tiyere gi ji kodi paka go mako wac i nger m’opokere opokere
English: For example, it tells us what God likes and what he does not like, how he treats people, and how he reacts in different situations

Adhola: Soma Zabuli 103:7-10
English: Read Psalm 103:7-10

Adhola: Yesu owaco ni: "Bawan ma i polo; nyingin wolwor. (Matayo 6:9)
English: Jesus said: "Our Father in the heavens, let your name be sanctified. (Matthew 6:9)

Adhola: Kada nende Were dwoŋ swa, aka wanyalo miyo go wor i nger m’opokere opokere, go nigi nyinge acel kende.
English: Although God has many titles, he has only one name

Adhola: I kis dhudhoki ituco nyingi Were i nger m’opokere
English: In each language, it is pronounced differently

Adhola: I Dhopadhola, ilwoŋo were ni "Jehova.â€”Soma Zabuli 83:18, NW
English: In English it is usually pronounced "Jehovah. Read Psalm 83:18

Adhola: I Baibul mathoth okwanyi woko nyingi Were tiketh’iye dwoŋ pere ayin, paka Rwoth kosa Were
English: God’s name has been taken out of many Bibles and replaced with the titles Lord or God

Adhola: To munyo nyaka ondiki Baibul, nyingi were obed’iye kalo di 7,000
English: But when the Bible was written, it contained God’s name some 7,000 times

Adhola: Yesu ofonjo ji nyingi Were
English: Jesus made God’s name known when he taught people about God

Adhola: Neni vidiyo Were Nigi Nyinge?
English: Watch the video Does God Have a Name?

Adhola: Chwaki ri wan, media player okwero
English: Sorry, the media player failed to load

Adhola: Gami Vidiyo Me
English: Download This Video

Adhola: Paka janywol me dewo kwoŋ nyathi pere, apaka Were bende dewo kwoŋ wan
English: Like this loving father, God is acting for our long-term good

Adhola: Candirok madit manitie i piny nyutho ni Jehova kidewi kwong wan?
English: Does widespread suffering mean that Jehovah is a God who does not care about us?

Adhola: Joman jowaco ni Were kelo ri wan candirok wonyali temo wan, to meno k’obedo adieri
English: Some people claim that he makes us suffer to test us, but this is not true

Adhola: Soma Yakobo 1:13
English: Read James 1:13

Adhola: Were omiyo wan thwolo ma yero gimarac kosa gimaber
English: God has granted man the dignity of free will

Adhola: Wakifoyi tektek bedo ni Were weyo wan to wawegi wayero lamo go? (Yosuwa 24:15) Raco mere, jomathothi jotimo wadi gin gikipiny mareco, am’omiyo candirok dit i piny
English: Do we not appreciate our freedom to choose to serve God? (Joshua 24:15) But many choose to do bad things to others, so suffering abounds

Adhola: Jehova winjo malith swa ka ji jotimo wadi gin gikipiny mareco
English: It saddens Jehovah to see such injustice

Adhola: Soma Cakirok 6:5, 6
English: Read Genesis 6:5, 6

Adhola: Jehova obedo Were ma dewo kwoŋ wan
English: Jehovah is a God who cares about us

Adhola: Go mito ni walimi kisangala i kwo
English: He wants us to enjoy life

Adhola: Go cegin kwanyo woko candirok kodi joma kelo ri wadi gin candirok
English: Soon he will eliminate suffering and those who cause it

Adhola: Were ni g’atoŋa maber m’omiyo go fodi kokwanyo woko candirok
English: Meanwhile, he has good reason to allow suffering for a limited time

Adhola: I fonji mar’aboro ma kitawo me, ilaŋeyo atoŋa no
English: In Lesson 8, we will learn what that reason is

Adhola: Jehova mito wabedi merin pere
English: Jehovah invites us to draw close to him by

Adhola: Go mito ni wakway go to wawaco ri go teko mawan je
English: He invites us to speak to him in prayer

Adhola: Go dewo kwoŋ kis dhano
English: He is interested in us individually

Adhola: Go mito swa cwako ri wan reco mawan
English: He is willing to forgive

Adhola: Go neno ka watemo paka wanyalo timo gima go mito, kada ruman kiyot ri wan
English: He recognizes our efforts to please him, even if we sometimes fail

Adhola: Kada nende wanigireco wanyalo bedo merin pa Were
English: So despite our imperfection, we really can enjoy a close relationship with God

Adhola: Rupiri Jehova am’omiyo wan kwo, waripo maro go loyo dhano moro je
English: Since Jehovah has given us life, we should love him more than we love anyone else

Adhola: K’imedere fonjirok gima mako kwoŋ Were kodi timo gima go mito, ilabedo mere pere
English: As you express your love for God by learning more about him and doing as he asks, you will draw ever closer to him

Adhola: Wabedo Jomene?
English: Who are we?

Adhola: Wawok i nonin mopokere opokere kendo waluwo dhudhok mopokere opokere, to wajojye wani gi gikipiny ma riwo wan
English: We come from hundreds of ethnic and language backgrounds, yet we are united by common goals

Adhola: Gimadwoŋ loyo, wajojye walamo Jehova, Were achiel maradyeri mochweyo kis gimoro
English: Above all, we want to honor Jehovah, the God of the Bible and the Creator of all things

Adhola: Watimo gima nyalere jye bedo paka Yesu Kristo, aka watero ni obedo wor madwoŋ swa lwoŋo wan ni Jokristo
English: We do our best to imitate Jesus Christ and are proud to be called Christians

Adhola: Wajojye walimo hongo to wafuonjo ji Baibul kodi wach maber ma mako kwoŋ Ker pa Were
English: Each of us regularly spends time helping people learn about the Bible and God’s Kingdom

Adhola: Ilwoŋo wan ni Wajulizi pa Jehova, rupiri wawacho ri ji adyeri ma mako kwoŋ Jehova kodi Ker pere
English: Because we witness, or talk, about Jehovah God and his Kingdom, we are known as Jehovah’s Witnesses

English: Explore our site

English: Read the Bible online

English: Learn more about us and our beliefs

Adhola: Ŋeyi ka chokirok mawan kodi paka walamo Were
English: Find out where we meet and how we worship God

Adhola: Chokirok ma Kitipa pa Wajulizi pa Jehova
English: Attend Meetings of Jehovah’s Witnesses

Adhola: Gami tuko ma winjo awinja ma makere gi gikipiny motimere i Baibul ilimi gi fuonjirok kwoŋ jomotimo gikipiny no
English: Download dramas based on Bible accounts, and learn important lessons about Bible characters and events

Adhola: Iwon neni gimatimere korago
English: Take a look inside and see for yourself

English: Come to our meetings

Adhola: Ŋeyi ma mako kwoŋ chokirok mawan
English: Learn about our meetings

Adhola: Nwaŋi ka chokirok mawan mani chiegin kodin
English: Find a meeting location near you

Adhola: Neni kachokirok mani chiegin kodin
English: Find a location near you

Adhola: Aŋo Matimere i Chokirok Mawan?
English: What Happens at Our Meetings?

Adhola: Wajulizi pa Jehova jochokere diryo kis sabiti to jolamo Were
English: Jehovah’s Witnesses hold meetings for worship twice each week

Adhola: I chokirok me, ma kis dhano nyalo bed’iye, wafuonjere Baibul gi nger ma wanyalo ketho gikipiny ma wafuonjere i tim
English: At these meetings, which are open to the public, we examine what the Bible says and how we can apply its teachings in our life

Adhola: I chokirok mawan mathoth ji jye jowodho paro, paka bedo i somero
English: Most of our services include audience participation, much like a classroom discussion

Adhola: Chokirok chako kendo to rumo gi wer kodi kwayo
English: Meetings begin and end with song and prayer

Adhola: Ikiripi bedo Mujulizi pa Jehova nyaka tibino i chokirok mawan
English: You don’t have to be one of Jehovah’s Witnesses to attend our meetings

Adhola: Kis dhano nyalo bino
English: We invite everyone to come along

Adhola: Ka bedo ma nono
English: Seats are free

Adhola: Wakichoki pesa
English: No collections are ever taken

Adhola: Imito medo fuonjirok Baibul?
English: Would you like to learn more about the Bible or about Jehovah’s Witnesses?

Adhola: K’ameno, poŋi fomi monyuth piny kenyo dhano wobin wofuonjin Baibul nono g’ipecho perin.
English: If so, request a visit by completing the form below, and a Witness in your area will contact you

Adhola: Ndiki gima mako kwoŋin idiyi wach Amito Fuonjirok Baibul inyali dhiro kwayo perin
English: Enter your information and click Please Contact Me to submit your request.

Adhola: Baibul ma n’Intanet
English: Online Bible

Adhola: Soma Baibul g’intanet kosa gami motyeki kisoma iwinji awinja
English: Read and listen to the Bible online, or download free audio recordings and sign-language videos of the Bible.

Adhola: New World Translation of the Holy Scriptures obedo Baibul motire, aka yot kisoma
English: The New World Translation of the Holy Scriptures is an accurate, easy-to-read translation of the Bible

Adhola: Otyeki wodho gipi kosa adech mere i dhudhok ma kalo 100
English: It has been published in whole or in part in over 100 languages

Adhola: Baibul no ma kalo milion 170 amotyeki poko ji
English: More than 170 million copies have been produced

Adhola: Iraŋo Ber Ni Ifuonjere Baibul
English: Why Study the Bible?

Adhola: Ŋeyi paka inyalo limo radwok ma penji ma mimaro penjere
English: Learn how the Bible can help you find answers to life’s big questions

Adhola: Baibuli dwoko penji madongo ma ji jomaro penjere i piny gipi
English: The Bible is providing answers to life’s big questions for millions of people around the world

Adhola: Ibende imito limo radwok ma penji m’imaro penjere?
English: Would you like to be one of them?

Adhola: I piny gipi, Wajulizi pa Jehova jofuonjo ji Baibul nono, aka inger mayot
English: Around the world, Jehovah’s Witnesses are known for the free Bible study program they offer

Adhola: Kethi vidiyo me ineni paka ji jofuonjere Baibul
English: Play the video and See how people study the bible

Adhola: Neni nger ma wafuonj’iye ji Baibul
English: See how our free Bible study program works

Adhola: Kis oro ji gana gi gana jochokere tojopoyo tho pa Yesu
English: Each year millions meet together to observe the anniversary of the death of Jesus

Adhola: Walwoŋin iŋeyi nger ma tho pa Yesu mako kwoŋin
English: You are invited to learn how this important event affects you

Adhola: Poyo Tho pa Yesu
English: Memorial of Jesus’ Death

Adhola: Walwoŋin ibini ichokere gi wan wapoyi tho pa Yesu
English: We invite you to join us for this special occasion

English: Lands where Jehovah’s Witnesses worship

Adhola: Wajulizi pa Jehova​
English: Jehovah’s Witnesses

Adhola: Ji ma jofuonjere Baibul
English: Free home Bible courses conducted

Adhola: Joma jobedo i poyo tho pa Yesu
English: Attendance at the annual Memorial of Christ’s death

Adhola: Titipin pa Wajulizi pa Jehova​
English: Congregations of Jehovah's Witnesses

Adhola: Kwo Mawan Wajokristo Kodi Tich Mawan
English: Our Christian Life and Ministry

Adhola: Kitawo Maoro
English: Meeting Workbook

Adhola: Kitawo me, Kwo Mawan Wajokristo Kodi Tich Mawan n’iye program kisoma Baibul kis sabiti kodi program ma chokirok pa Wajulizi pa Jehova ma bedo i dyer sabiti.
English: The Life and Ministry Meeting Workbook provides the schedule and study material for the weekly Bible-reading program and one of the weekly meetings of Jehovah’s Witnesses

Adhola: Wer ma Pako Were
English: Music for Christian Worship

Adhola: Limi wer mabeyo minyalo oro pako Were Jehova
English: Play or download Christian songs used for praise and worship of Jehovah God

Adhola: Inyalo limo wer moweri gi dwondi jo kodi mogoyi chumin kende
English: Vocal, orchestral, and instrumental audio recordings as well as sheet music are available

Adhola: Magazin mawan ma konyo ji fuonjirok Baibul inyalo gamo i websait me i dhudhok ma kalo 150
English: Our Bible-based magazines are available for download in over 150 languages

Adhola: Magazin ma Watchtower nyutho paka gikipiny ma timere i piny makere kodi gima Baibul chango owacho ni letimere
English: The Watchtower shows us the significance of world events in the light of Bible prophecies

Adhola: Kweyo chuny ji munyo wacho ri jo wach maber ma mako kwoŋ Ker pa Were, kendo konyo jo ketho yeyo i Yesu Kristo
English: It comforts people with the good news of God’s Kingdom and promotes faith in Jesus Christ

Adhola: Awake! nyutho ji nger ma chiro teko manitye pama aka konyo jo geno chikirok pa Were ma piny manyien ma lebed’iye syem.
English: Awake! shows us how to cope with today’s problems and builds confidence in the Creator’s promise of a peaceful and secure new world

Adhola: Soma Baibul inger motire munyo ioro kitawin monyuthi ka minyalo kir gamo
English: Study the Bible by topic with the help of these downloadable books and brochures

Adhola: Wac Maber Mawok Bongi Were!
English: Good News From God!

Adhola: Wac maber mawok bongi Were a mene
English: What is the good news from God?

Adhola: Raŋo waripo yeyo wac no
English: Why can we believe it?

Adhola: Kitawo me oro Baibul dwoko penji ma wamaro penjere
English: This brochure answers common Bible questions

Adhola:
Nger ma Kitawo Me Nyalo Konyin
Kitawo me lakonyin ŋeyo Wac pa Were, Baibul
English: This brochure will help you to enjoy learning directly from God’s Word, the Bible

Adhola: ndiiko maleŋ manitie i cowe ma kis adec nyutho kama inyalo nwaŋ’iye, i Baibul perin, radwok ma penji m’ondiki malo i rangi macoli
English: The references at the end of each paragraph show where in your Bible you can read answers to the numbered questions

Adhola: K’isoma ndiiko no i Baibul, pari kwoŋ nger ma ndiiko no dwoko penji m’ondiki i rangi macoli
English: As you review the Bible texts, consider how they answer these questions

Adhola: Mujulizi pa Jehova moro je nyalo konyin niaŋ kodi ndiiko no
English: Any one of Jehovah’s Witnesses will be pleased to help you to reason on the meaning of the Scriptures

Adhola: Wac Mene Maber?
English: What Is the Good News?

Adhola: Wac maber mawok bongi were a mene?
English: What is the news from God?

Adhola: Were mito ni ji jowobedi i kwo ma kisangala i piny ka
English: God wants people to enjoy life on earth

Adhola: Go ocweyo piny kodi kis gimoro je manitie i piny rupiri go omaro ji.
English: He created the earth and everything on it because he loves mankind

Adhola: Were cegin loko piny me kabedo maber swa
English: Soon he will act to provide a better future for people in every land

Adhola: Go cegin kwanyo woko gikipiny je makelo candirok.
English: He will relieve mankind of the causes of suffering.​

Adhola: Ongoye dhum moro je ma nyalo kwanyo woko lweny, two, kosa tho
English: No government has ever succeeded in eliminating violence, disease, or death

Adhola: To nitie wac maber
English: But there is good news

Adhola: Were cegin kwanyo woko dhum pa ji wokeli apere
English: Shortly, God will replace all human governments with his own government

Adhola: Ji ma jolabedo i dhum pa Were jolalimo siem kodi kwo maber.​—Soma Isaya 25:8; 33:24; Daniel 2:44.
English: Its subjects will enjoy peace and good health.​—Read Isaiah 25:8; 33:24; Daniel 2:44.

Adhola: Raŋo winjo wac maber obedo gimadwoŋ swa pama?
English: Why is the good news urgent?

English: Suffering will end only when God clears the earth of bad people. (Zephaniah 2:3)

English: God’s Word foretold the conditions that now threaten mankind.

Adhola: Gikipiny mareco ma timere i piny nyutho ni Were cegin reyo woko jomareco.
English: Current events indicate that God’s time to act is close.​

Adhola: Soma 2 Timothe 3:1-5
English: Read 2 Timothy 3:1-5

English: We should learn about God from his Word, the Bible.

Adhola: Baibuli cale gi balwa ma janywol ondiko ri nyithindho pere
English: It is like a letter to us from a loving father

Adhola: Nyutho wan nger ma wanyalo limo kwo maber pama, kodi nger ma wanyalo limo kwo makirum i piny, i hongo mabino

Adhola: Yesu onyutho paka Were ledwoko kwayo no
English: Jesus demonstrated how that prayer will be answered.

English: World conditions confirm that God’s Kingdom will soon come.

English: Jesus foretold that just before the Kingdom brings peace to the earth, our world would be plagued with wars, famines, and earthquakes.

Adhola: Teko no won ama waneno konon.
English: We see those very conditions today.

Adhola: Ri ameno, wanyalo ridho ni Ker pa Were chiegin bino wokwany woko teko jye.
English: So we can be confident that God’s Kingdom will soon bring an end to all such problems.
